Job Description:
About Quora:


The vast majority of human knowledge is still not on the internet. Most of it is trapped in the form of experience in people's heads, or buried in books and papers that only experts can access. More than a billion people use the internet, yet only a tiny fraction contribute their knowledge to it. We want to democratize access to knowledge of all kinds from politics to painting, cooking to coding, etymology to experiences so if someone out there knows something, anyone else can learn it. Our mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, and we're building a world-class team to help us achieve this mission.

About the Team:


We're creating a repository for all human knowledge. To do this, we need to design systems that make sharing knowledge rewarding and discovering it easy; and that scale to support the participation of the entire planet. Designing a global ecosystem for knowledge sharing, and the platform for businesses to reach this audience, requires a multidisciplinary approach. We're building a diverse team with people of different backgrounds and experiences, empowered to shape strategy while moving quickly and learning as much as possible.

Designers at Quora are building a system to democratize access to all knowledge for the entire world. Our work leverages what we learn about psychological and social dynamics, communities and networks, and systems and policy design, in addition to more typical design skills. We value a diverse team and pursue candor, holism, rigor, care, and awareness in our work.

About the Role:


Quora designers are thoughtful generalists. As a product designer, you'll be responsible for what you design from start to finish: brainstorming solutions, iterating on visuals and interactions however you see fit, and finally implementing your designs in code yourself (no middlemen required!). You work on everything from ranking to UI, from internationalization to moderation systems. Your design decisions are validated through A/B testing and user studies alike, as we value rigor and empathy in equal measure.

Responsibilities:
Work on a product team focused on a major, user-facing area of Quora. Identify high-impact opportunities, design features in pursuit of goals, and explain the rationale for your decisions
Collaborate with engineers to define features and functionality, with other designers for feedback and critique, and with data scientists and user researchers to evaluate the impact of your work
Design interactions for new features, applying existing design patterns and creating new ones, across our platforms
Build what you design using React
Work quickly and effectively on multiple projects. Ship new features, bug fixes, and small improvements multiple times a week
Minimum Qualifications:


A portfolio demonstrating relevant design capabilities is required. Applications without portfolios will not be reviewed
Technical competence with front-end technologies: React, HTML, CSS, JS
Ability to think at a high level about a complex, social product, and to clearly explain reasons for new features and changes
Experience building clear, effective interactions to accomplish product or business goals
Demonstrated visual design skill, especially in the construction of visual hierarchies, and attention to detail on typography, spacing, and color
Interest in using data and user research to inform design decisions. Experience with effective A/B testing is a plus
The number of years of professional experience you have isn't important to us
Preferred Qualifications:


Interest or experience in designing for ads, mobile, or user growth is a plus
Experience with effective A/B testing
Experience with server-side languages like Python
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) disclosure

Job Description
The Washington Post is seeking a Product Designer to join its Subscriptions team focusing primarily on our subscribers' experience. This team of UX, UI and visual designers leads design strategy and visual approaches for The Post’s suite of digital products, including our subscriptions, native iOS and Android apps, internal tools, paywall, and account management experiences.
In this Product Designer role, you’ll focus on both the UX and visual design of experiences to support user engagement, browsing and reading experiences, subscriber retention experiences, and new feature conceptualization. You will help define the next generation of digital products for The Washington Post. A passion for designing news and media experiences is a must.
You’ll be part of a team of more than a dozen designers. With your focus on site engagement, you will partner with Product, Engineering, Marketing, the Newsroom, and other business units. You’ll collaborate with product managers and internal stakeholders across multiple teams to identify, ideate on and propose new approaches to our user experience.
This ideal candidate for this role:
Wants to be hands-on with design and design strategy
Constantly looks for ways to improve the way our products look AND work
Loves to collaborate closely with colleagues in research, product management and engineering
Is organized, driven and excited about designing the news products of the future
Can clearly and passionately articulate the thinking behind a design
Is energized by problem-solving and loves to develop solutions for difficult problems
Enjoys gathering user and project requirements to create conceptual wireframes, prototypes, and final designs for user-facing and newsroom-facing products
Loves every aspect of design from visual to typography, ideation through user testing, experimentation, and innovating on design process
Is a passionate expert in human-centered design
Is passionate about identifying and solving problems that will have a positive impact for our users and our business
You have:

A portfolio that shows a strong body of work including outstanding visual and user interface designs
2+ years of design experience on digital platforms
Extensive experience designing interactive applications, preferably editorial
An established track record of producing business results through design
Deep knowledge of research techniques including competitive analysis, user interviews, persona creation and journey mapping
A collaborative spirit and a proven ability to work well with others, building strong partnerships across teams
Experience designing across all platforms including web, mobile, iOS and Android
Comfort with design and prototyping software like Sketch, the Adobe Creative Suite, Invision, and other prototyping tools
Working knowledge of front-end development and best practices for design implementation
Strong presentation and writing skills
Experience with or strong interest in digital media and news
The innovation doesn’t end in the Newsroom – dozens of teams power The Washington Post. We are now hiring the next innovator – how will you Impact Tomorrow?

#washpostlife

We just keep growing. It’s amazing. Seriously. And if we had to boil our success down, it really comes down to great clients and remarkable people. Not good or solid. But truly remarkable people doing amazing things day after day, month after month, and year after year. It’s a tall order to find new people, because our kind of people tend to be really hard to find.
Are you ready to step out of the shadows?
We’re looking for a remarkable art director with 2-3 years experience. But, we know that sometimes remarkable comes in non-traditional packages. If you think you’ve got the stuff, don’t let “years of experience” stop you, read on.
So, what constitutes remarkable? We’re glad you asked.
Well, to start you can't be rude or an egomaniac.
You should hate, hate, hate boring. The last thing this world needs is another boring anything.
You’d be surprised but just those two mandatories disqualify so many possible candidates. We told you remarkable was hard to find.
Still reading? That’s a good sign.
We're not looking for just an art director; we're looking for a craftsperson. Someone who understands that a big part of success is thinking big, then rolling up your sleeves and getting dirty. And by "dirty" we mean: graphite, ink or even blood from a mean callous that split on your pointer finger from overusing a stylus pen or mouse.
Ok, so for those of you who just love a bulleted list here you go.
Responsibilities
Drive winning ideas forward.
Work closely with copywriters, ACD’s, CD’s to maintain an understanding of clients’ business challenges related to creative work and brand voice.
Work on design and layouts to develop and produce a strong, effective, and on-brief advertising campaign across multiple media platforms.
Concept creation and development, design direction, management and execution of overall visual language.
Work across teams regarding branding and visual hierarchy including interactive, pre- and post-production video, social and photography direction.
Interpret and apply brand identity standards effortlessly across all mediums.
Create and present creative concepts and design processes to clients, soliciting feedback and collaboration with clients and teams to ensure effective visual communications.
Qualifications
Exceptional portfolio that displays a strong understanding of design principles.
Experience in digital, video and print.
A work ethic that makes people wonder if you sleep at the office. (Not that you will we’ve got a really great work/life balance thing going on here).
The ability to take constructive critiques of your work by client and co-worker alike in stride.
Self-motivated to do incredible work.
You should love design and love to design. It should show in your work.
2 - 3 years of agency experience.
You should be brilliant at Photoshop. Not proficient, good or even great — brilliant. Same goes for Illustrator and InDesign. Actually, strike that. You should be amazing at finding and using whatever tools you need to make your ideas sing.
It would be great if After Effects and Premier were a little scared of you too. You haven’t beat them yet, but you’ve had some experience and are looking forward to dominating them as well.
You still here? We’ve got to be honest we’re impressed and excited that you might be one of the few. How to apply
If you want to become our new art director, here are a few simple steps you should take:
1. Look at our website. It outlines our philosophy, clients, work, etc. Do your homework. Then, if you get an interview, you can ask us smart questions.
2. Give us your resumé, website, glamour shot, or whatever your version of self-promotion looks like. Design it well, and again, don't be boring. Send it to jobs@paradowski.com with the header “Art Director”. Oh, and make sure the work you send is not the work you think we'll think is OK. Show us the work you love. Show us what makes you remarkable.

General Function:

Reporting to the Regional Vice President (R.V.P.), the AV System Designer (SD) is responsible for ensuring completed designs and functionality for all projects assigned to them and their team. Daily activities include Sales support, PM support, Customer support, overall design concepts and product choices, developing and testing each system in house and performing final optimizations in the field.

Character of the Position:

SPINITAR is a leading Audiovisual Systems Integration, Product, Service organization providing innovative visual communication systems to the industrial / commercial market worldwide. SPINITAR is comprised of four business units: Systems Integration, Presentation Products, Visual Products and Service.

The employee in this position is responsible for designing of the systems integration projects on time, on budget and achieving high satisfaction from our customers. The majority of this employee's time will be spent on overall project design, collaborating with the project team (ie. SD, AM, PM, INST, PROG, CUST, ASD), and responsible for the testing of the system in the shop and field optimization.

This person will maintain deep knowledge of all assigned projects and communicate daily with the project team and the Director, Technical Operations to address scheduling issues or technical difficulties.

They will focus on creating efficiencies in the workflow process to help Spinitar maintain growth and profitability. This person will be held accountable for following the approved Spinitar processes and the overall design and functionality of the project.

This person works in conjunction with the entire project Team (specifically the ASD).

Responsibilities:

General

1. Make SPINITAR a fun, profitable, world-class and customer intimate provider and integrator of audio visual solutions.

2. High level of customer interaction required

3. Ensure Project documentation standards are followed

4. Overall responsible party for the design of a Spinitar Integration Project

5. Maintain current industry certification(s)

6. Training customers on equipment and products as needed

7. Provide adequate sales support as needed

8. Responsible for understanding the customers scope and vision for the project and communicating that throughout the project team

9. Testing and Commissioning of all systems

10. Daily entry of time into the Spinitar Café system

Project Specific will follow the Spinitar System Integration Workflow (details below)
Sales Phase
a. Act and serve as a sales designer if/when needed
Design Phase
a. Attend kick-off meeting

b. Perform initial site walk with PM and validate performance scope with customer

c. Visio/draw the details as required, the following items for inclusion in the design package. Submit to ASD (Associate Systems Designer) or CAD as required for completion of design package.

i. Conceptual drawings

ii. Functional drawings

iii. Video Single line

iv. Audio Single line

v. Room layout screens, projectors

vi. Speaker placement

vii. Floor and wall plates

viii. Site Line drawings

ix. Rack Elevations

x. Structural drawings

d. Lead design review with the project team

e. Validate with ASD that the equipment list is accurate and all system elements (ie. cable, connectors, rack plates, etc.) are present and needed

f. Perform value engineering (improving performance of the design, while at the same time maintaining/reducing costs) by working with the ASD

g. Approve and sign-off all final design and drawing packages

h. Actively participate in Inventory reduction and control
Pre-Install Phase
a. Gather design intent of audio DSP code by gathering requirement from customer and discussing approach with ASD.write the DSP configuration.

b. Load all programming and configurations in the system for testing(working in conjunction with the ASD)

c. Conduct In-House test for functionality and sign-off before allowing the system to be deployed to site (working in conjunction with the ASD)
Install Phase
a. Be available to install team for any site related questions

b. Perform final install tests and optimization of the system (working in conjunction with the ASD)
Closeout Phase
a. Own completion of technical punch list

b. Ensure as-built drawings are correct and turned into ASD for completion

c. Perform customer training

Qualifications:

4+ years of A/V experience

Strong customer relation skills

Strong technical and troubleshooting skills

Self-motivated

CTS-D

ISF-C

Suggested Education Certifications and Professional Degrees:

CTS-I

BA or BS in Engineering or Electronics

Job Description

Summary

Uses CAD software to create, revise, and issue civil/structural drawings that comply with current CAD and client CAD standards.Provide support to engineers by preparing general grading layouts, detail structural drawings, sketches and diagrams. Develop drawing details to include all views and dimensions necessary for construction and manufacture of foundations and structures.

Essential Job Functions
Prepare and revise project drawings for review by the Project Engineer:
Site plans and details
Foundation plans and details
Structural steel plans, erection and fabrication details
Accountable for electronic version control, standards, and delivery of civil/structural project drawings.
Review of Vendor prints, mechanical equipment, and building foundations to ensure proper fit.
Attend and participate in peer drawing design reviews (QA/QC).
Implement good design practices and follow company, industry and client design standards.
Update drawings to field “As-Built” conditions from redlines and engineering change notices.
Develop and maintain standard designs and templates for foundations and steel structures.
Be proactive in coordinating design issues with clients, vendors, and other disciplines.
Competencies
Technically detailed and competent with land development and structural layout.
Communicates well in English both written and verbal.
Problem Solving/Analysis skills to proactively solve or recommend solutions to problems.
Collaborates well with clients, vendors, internal group and other disciplines.
Expert level with AutoCAD 2D and familiar with AutoCAD Civil or Carlson.
Supervisory Responsibility
This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Required Experience and/or Education

3-5 years’ experience with mechanical or structural layout and detailing, or Associates degree or greater in mechanical or structural design with courses in engineering/technology preferred and 1-3 years’ experience with mechanical or structural layout and detailing.

Clear understanding of steel sections, beams, sizing, calculation of weights, design, layout and drafting.

Additional Notes

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for the job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran’s status.

OBJECTIVES OF THE POSITION
The Staff Designer position sells Platinum Pools product using technical, organizational and customer knowledge to influence customers and assist them in applying the products/services to their needs, resulting in revenue generation.
RELATIONSHIPS
Directly reports to Sales Manager
Close interaction with Lead Coordinator, Plan Auditor, Construction Department and Customers.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Respond to all customer inquiries the same day via email, phone text, or any other type of contact, and log into CRM,
Convert all inquiries into a sales lead within three (3 days) of initial contact, and try to set-up and notate in CRM.
Ensure CRM is updated daily with 1st appointments, Be Backs, and any other relevant information pertaining to the sales process and task.
Conduct in-home consultations to assess customer vision and budget for project,
Create presentation based off of customer’s vision
Manage design appointment in designated appointment time.
Properly prepare for each consultation by having survey, plan, flood plain info, municipality requirements, etc.
Proficient in assisting customers in materials selection process,
Knowledgeable in project features and equipment selections,
Design, price and have video to home-owner within 24-hour.
Take multiple pictures of the property regarding backyard and access and upload in CRM
Competent in 11 Steps of Success.
Maintain a working knowledge of the company’s sales programs (CRM, CAD design software etc.)
Maintain minimum sales standards set by Platinum Pools: lead to appointment completed ratio 80%, Be Back completed ratio of 70% and closing ratio of 35%,
Responsible for project construction plans,
Review drawings with customers in detail to ensure construction expectations have been met, and have customer sign off on drawings,
Audit all sales paperwork for accuracy prior to being entered in Construction software,
Make sure all Tile and Coping selection sheets are completed prior to being sent to Construction,
For projects that have not been excavated, contact Customer every Monday, and place notes in Construction software until project is excavated.
Contact customers for projects that are currently under construction every Friday, and place notes in Construction software, and follow-up with customer throughout the construction process to ensure the customer’s expectations are being met,
Responsible for writing an Addendum for every customer change until the pool is excavated,
Follow the proper back charges procedure set by Platinum Pools,
Participates in sales forecasting and planning,
Develops and maintains communications in a cooperative and professional manner with all levels of staff and customers using established guidelines,
Performs other duties as assigned.
REQUIREMENTS
2 to 3 years of experience in similar positions
Sales experience preferred, but not required
Expertise of Microsoft Office products
Writing Skills, Organization, Time Management, Verbal Communication
Technical Capacity
High level of initiative
Negotiation Skills
Presentation Skills
Customer/Client Focus
Communication Proficiency
Adaptability
Work Environment
This job operates in an indoor and outdoor environmental conditions, with occasions of being subjected to temperatures above 100 degrees for periods of more than one hour.
Physical demands
Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects.
Involves sitting, walking, and standing
Must be able to talk, conveying information in detailed fashion customers and co-workers
Must be able to hear sounds and words at normal speaking levels, with or without correction. Must be able to receive detailed information through verbal communication
Close visual acuity is needed for viewing computes, preparing and/or analyzing data and figures, transcribing information, and reading
Visual acuity is also needed to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of work assigned and to make general observations of facilities or structures
Position Type and Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., with a one-hour lunch break. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.
Pay
Base Pay plus potential bonus of $25k

Location: San Jose, CA

Start Date: July 2020 - flexible

About Avenues Silicon Valley

Avenues | The World School prepares students for engaged global citizenship during a time of unprecedented complexity and accelerating change, combining language immersion, interdisciplinary learning, a global curriculum, and a culture of creativity and deep collaboration.

Avenues plans to open its Silicon Valley campus in San Jose for the 2021/22 academic year, serving students from nursery through 9th grade. As the newest campus of Avenues, Avenues Silicon Valley is slated to be the first global school in the Bay Area, providing students with transformative, world-focused learning experiences in a state-of-the-art educational facility.

The Opportunity

Avenues |The World School is committed to pioneering cutting-edge experience design in the field of education. We are looking for a versatile, collaborative Experience Designer to carry the torch of this commitment for our new Silicon Valley campus. This is an extraordinary opportunity for an innovative design leader passionate about education to play a critical role in shaping and enhancing the experiences of students, families, faculty and staff from the very beginning of the launch of this new campus.

About You
You have a track record of leveraging your evolving design/creative toolkit to a variety of challenges to create better experiences for people
You are deeply curious about people; observing and asking questions from a place of empathy, relentlessly questioning assumptions (whether yours or someone else's) and leveraging data
You tell great stories that resonate (and stick!) with people and are a masterful communicator across mediums
You are a creative, analytical problem solver who loves to dive into complex, ambiguous puzzles; seeking out original solutions over predetermined paths
People get really excited about implementing your ideas--not just because they're great--but because you know how to influence stakeholders and navigate organizational complexity to realize them
You've always been interested in education--whether inside or outside school settings you are a passionate learner and fascinated by the structures/tools/experience of learning
What You Will Do
Enhance the Avenues family experience through great design - potentially including facilities, processes and services, and any points of family/student interaction from report cards to signage to special events
Lead the implementation of key experience initiatives--balancing a focus on mid and long term projects with real time parachuting in to tackle near term high need areas
Serve as a key advocate for Avenues students, families and colleagues in the design and execution of all campus experiences
Determine how to best measure and listen to stakeholders' experience and use data and observational research to inform how we continually improve
Partner closely and effectively with campus leadership, faculty, staff and others to create and advocate for more beautiful, satisfying and intuitive stakeholder experiences
Help build a culture of user-centered design at Avenues Silicon Valley and throughout the organization as a member of the Global Experience team, teaching and embedding habits of design thinking, UX research and problem solving with colleagues
Qualifications

Must Haves
Mastery of one or more aspects of design, including Graphic Design, Experience Design, Information Design, Art Direction, Storytelling, Editorial Design, Creative Technology, Architecture etc
Familiarity with canonical texts in the field (Design of Everyday Things [Norman], The Visual Display of Quantitative Information [Tufte], Universal Principles of Design [Lidwell])
Ability to carry out complex projects successfully in an environment of multiple stakeholders and competing priorities
Willingness and ability to quickly adapt to and address changing priorities while also making progress on mid to long term initiatives
A passion for education and Avenues' Mission
Nice to Haves
Strong grasp of user-centered design principles and user experience design
Experience using data analysis techniques, common UX research methods and observational research to inform design
Experience in international and/or private schools
What We Offer
Unparalleled career growth opportunities across multiple campuses around the world
The thrill of a start-up and a green field to build things from scratch, all within an organization with global resources and supports, and a proven track record of results
Frequent feedback, ongoing coaching and top-notch, job-embedded professional learning
Competitive rewards package, wellness resources, relocation support (as needed), and other benefits to best support you and keep you healthy and happy
A beautiful, uplifting, student-centric school environment
A chance to change the world of education as part of a global community spanning three continents
To Apply

Learn more about Avenues on our website (www.avenues.org) and LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/avenues-the-world-school/). Apply through the Careers section of the Avenues website (http://www.avenues.org/en/careers/).


Avenues offers competitive compensation and a generous benefits package. Avenues is committed to diversity among our staff, and applicants of diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.

In order for your application to be considered, you must complete the assessment that will be emailed to you once your application has been completed.

Born from the belief that great things come to those who cook, Yummly provides limitless inspiration, with the tools to make it happenfrom recipe discovery to prep to perfect results. Just as appliances removed the most cumbersome chores, the next tipping point in daily life is upon us in the food space. A system of personalized discovery that learns you better to serve you better, so the question "what's for dinner?" is answered before it's even asked.

Yummly has grown to over 28M registered users and our mobile apps are consistently one of the leading recipe apps on iPhone, iPad, Android, and Windows. Next on the menu? Building the connected kitchen of the future.

Yummly is seeking a seasoned and experienced UX Designer to join our food-obsessed team and lead the UX function in developing the next phase of category-defining smart cooking and connected kitchen products.

Join the Yummly Design Team in crafting great experiences that help home cooks plan, prep, and cook meals faster and more easily through smart personalized guidance. We want you to elevate our user experience efforts to the next level through your passion for future-facing user-centric design solutions that will help further shape and strengthen our position in this space.

As Senior UX Designer:
You are a thought leader that thrives on bringing innovation to your work.
You pride yourself in designing meaningful experiences that delight and inspire users.
You are organized and detail-oriented, fluent with UX best practices and emerging trends.
You advocate for intuitive affordance and design from the point of view of the user while understanding and meeting the needs of the business.
You are an expert communicator and are able to articulate the rationale that informs the decision-making in your work.
You use data and supporting research methodologies to inform your perspective and develop design hypotheses.
You continuously seek out improvements in usability and validate your thinking through user testing.
You work collaboratively with product, engineering, marketing, content, visual design, and data science teams to build the best products possible.
Responsibilities:


Champion the role of UX and user-centric design within the organization.
Define and uphold best-in-class UX design processes that streamline the product design cycle.
Oversee the development of a consistent UX design language and design pattern libraries.
Scope and design new features for mobile and web environments and engage with relevant teams throughout the development process to ensure delivery meets expectations and performs as intended.
Utilize a fully developed skill set including researching, sketching, and iterating to develop actionable design solutions.
Identify and document use cases that improve life in the kitchen with Yummly.
Bring clarity to solving complex problems through thoughtful information architecture.
Map the flow of user traffic and data to identify areas for improvement and solve problems at the early stages of the design process.
Create wireframes, clickable prototypes, and high fidelity UX flows and design to drive design decisions and optimize user experience.
Conduct usability testing remotely and on-site at Yummly (at times using our fully equipped professional kitchen!)
Communicate design expectations and interaction behaviors to engineering and QA teams using the most appropriate tools and means available.
Qualifications:


An inspirational, wide-ranging portfolio of your work you can share including work for mobile and web.
5-8 years of relevant design experience with examples of productionalized design work you have shipped.
Exceptional knowledge of IA and interaction design specifications, wireframes, mockups, prototypes.
Extensive experience with design validation and usability testing.
Experience using metrics and leveraging analytics tools to track user behavior and develop data-driven insights.
Well-versed with UX and workflow tools such as Sketch, Zeplin, Abstract, InVision, and/or other industry-standard tools such as Axure, Omnigraffle, etc.
Excellent understanding of iOS, Android, and website technological capabilities.
Bachelor's degree in UX Design, HCI, Graphic Design, or related qualification, or equivalent design industry. Master's degree is a bonus!
Bonus:


Hands-on experience or education in design research and behavioral economics.
Start up experience.
Passionate about food.
And a little more about us:

At Yummly, we are a team of talented and diverse technology professionals on a mission to rule the kitchen. We've seen great success using machine learning and artificial intelligence to make cooking fun, easy, and personalized. Our iOS and Android apps have 4.5+ star reviews, millions of downloads, and many awards (download and give it a try!).

We were acquired by Whirlpool, the world's largest home appliance maker. Together, we have appetizing aspirations to build the fully-connected kitchen of the future.

We work in a historic old building in downtown Redwood City, a few minutes walk from Caltrain at the Redwood City Station. Although, during Covid-19 we are all working from home. In early Fall, we will be relocating to a new custom built office in San Carlos. Please talk to us if you have a love for design, hard problems, and food!

Yummly is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Job Description:

Are you creative and enjoy the details from start to finish? If you know packaging and digital and can come up with creative solutions, we'd love you to join our team.

Your Story.

You are enthusiastic, creative, process driven, collaborative and goal oriented. You seek an opportunity to expand your skills and experiences in the consumer packaged goods industry.

Our Story.

With more than 2,000 employees and net sales of $1.4 billion, Sargento Foods is a family-owned company that has been a leader in cheese for more than 60 years. We created the world's first, successful pre-packaged sliced and shredded natural cheeses. Sargento is based north of Milwaukee in Plymouth, Wisconsin, where we manufacture and market shredded, sliced and snack natural cheese products, as well as ingredients and sauces. Sargento is known for the exceptional quality of our products and for product design, packaging and merchandising innovations that have transformed our industry.

Your Passion. Our Culture.

At Sargento, you work for a company you believe in, with a family of people who believe in you. Our culture stems from a simple premise: Hire good people and treat them like family. At Sargento, you can make decisions based on how they affect people as well as the long-term health of our company. You will be encouraged to make a meaningful difference in the community, in the company and in your career. With diverse experiences and tools to learn and develop, you can transform your aspirations into reality. If you're ready for the right place to belong and grow your career, you can find it here.

What You Do.
Prepare and produce graphic designs, concepts, and layouts for packaging, print and digital applications. Expertise in all channels is not required but a familiarity and a willingness to learn is essential for success
Utilize project management skills; Consult with internal clients and supervisor to define project requirements, communicate status and suggest improvements as needed
Prepare work to specification for print or digital application, verify accuracy of proof and monitor quality throughout project. Supervise pre-press approvals when required
Participate in ideation, concept development and research
Stay abreast of creative and digital trends
Your Education and Experience.
Bachelor's degree required
2+ years of relevant experience in Graphic Design
Experience in packaging design at a consumer products company a plus
Design needs for multiple channels including, but not limited to, consumer or customer facing selling materials, social media, video production, webpages, internal communications, packaging and others
Equal Opportunity Employer

#LI-FULLTIME

Requirements:
Your Qualifications.
Conceptual Knowledge accompanied by professional experience in one or more creative channel (packaging, print or digital)
Demonstrated experience as a talented designer and conceptual thinker
Strong and diverse portfolio that proves solid typography and composition skills as well as a passion for innovation and the latest trends & influences
Excellent computer skills including Illustrator, Photoshop, Powerpoint, and Slides
Strong understanding of print processes
Collaborate with the cross functional team to ensure deliverables are accurate and on schedule
A passion for details: building accurate files, reviewing proofs and color drawdowns
Excellent communication skills in sharing your design thinking, presenting to all levels of co-workers throughout all stages of design
Additional Information.
Travel to other facilities and photo studios for photo needs is required; must possess a current Driver's License
Your Needs. Our Values.

"People-First Culture" - Our people-first culture is founded on a simple premise: Hire good people and treat them like family. Your team really is your extended family and friends. Our Sargento Family rallies around those experiencing challenging situations and are the first ones to celebrate milestones.

Live Well, Work Well - You are encouraged and enabled to balance your career with interests and activities outside of work. We value Humor and Fun because we can laugh at ourselves and you can't smile without saying "cheese". Our CEO always says, if you're not having fun at work or spending time with your family, then you're doing it wrong.

Career Advancement - We support your career aspirations with individual development plans, career paths, coaching and mentoring through our "grow from within" philosophy. It is not uncommon for employees to start their career in an entry-level position and with dedication, hard work, and our tuition reimbursement program they have the potential to advance into leadership roles.

Caring for Community - When you work here, you can make a difference in the company and in the lives of people in our communities, including supporting the United Way, Habitat for Humanity and Hunger Task Force. We partner with the Green Bay Packers through our 'Touchdowns for Hunger' program which has resulted in donating $1.3 million to date for hunger relief. We support our employees who serve their communities year-round including providing paid time off to contribute to causes that are meaningful to them.

Brand Innovation & Leadership - We're a national brand, owned by a real family. Because we are privately-held every employee is considered part of the Sargento Family and can make a meaningful impact. We seek people who will challenge assumptions and introduce new ideas to help achieve our corporate goals. We are an industry leader because of our quest to find the next breakthrough and have been a Nielsen Award Winner thanks to our innovative products.

Generally have 12+ years of experience.

A Senior Architectural Designer is used to refer to anyone responsible for conceiving of, creating, and implementing ideas that affect human cultural, social, technological, scientific, or financial systems at any scale while serving in a project and firm leadership capacity. At this level, the Senior Architectural Designer will make decisions and recommendations that are recognized as authoritative and have an important and/ or significant impact on extensive architectural activities. The Senior Design Architects skills and expertise will provide significant guidance by defining and setting the project direction.

About SERA

SERA is a progressive, 100% employee-owned architecture, interior design and urban design & planning firm based in Portland, Oregon. Since 1968, SERA has been instrumental in the development of the citys national reputation for livability. In 2015, we opened a second office in the San Francisco Bay Area where we service Silicon Valley and other California clients.

Our culture reflects our commitment to great design, client service, and sustainability. SERA provides our employees with an enjoyable work environment and opportunities for professional and personal development.

About Workplace

The SERA Workplace team enables businesses and organizations to transform their vision, culture and objectives into purposeful built environments. Our design team employs planning frameworks and outcome-based design strategies to maximize value in real estate solutions for sustainable design, interior environmental quality and space planning principles. We create visually and spatially compelling places that engage the workforce and create a rich cultural experience.

Our Workplace team brings diverse professional skills in architecture, interior design and engineering to create solutions that enrich human health, performance and happiness for both local and global organizations. The work is high performance, high velocity, and highly collaborative. Our teams achieve their highest performance as integrated teams with owners and builders.

Job Title: Senior Architectural Designer
Level: ARC VIII
Supervisor: Studio Leader / PIC
FLSA: Exempt

Duties and Responsibilities
Primary
Advance creative design direction for the project team this could include but is not limited to; project pursuit, client meetings, stakeholder engagement and project delivery.
Be an active listener and inspire project teams.
Responsible for originating, leading and generating overall design direction for project teams.
Must be able to rapidly explore a multitude of design options that solve design problems in various ways that are in compliance with applicable jurisdictional requirements.
Actively engage with project team, consultants, clients, public entities, and the community at large when required to advance project design concepts and details.
Supervise, plan, collaborate and review work with team members. This includes mentoring of staff on project teams.
Convey design solutions and communicate effectively to project team, client and general public.
Provide innovative solutions that are sound, founded in deep architectural practice theory and consistently align with SERAs organizational mission, vision and core values.
Initiate and maintain extensive contacts with key architects and officials of other organizations and companies, requiring skill in persuasion and negotiation of critical issues.
Deliver iterative design ideas that meet project goals including project schedules, budgets, applicable codes, in addition to advancing organization mission, vision and core values.
Understand and adhere to the project's contract requirements. Provide attention to detail at areas of higher risk or deemed critical for the success of the project.
Use the building code to develop architectural solutions. Provide code interpretations that are advantageous for the project and client.
Demonstrate creativity, foresight, and mature architectural judgment in anticipating and solving unprecedented architectural problems, determining program objectives and requirements, organizing programs and projects, and developing standards and guides for diverse architectural activities.
Generate and supervises design presentations.
Advance work to be recognized as an expert/leader and authority in the company in a broad area of expertise or in a narrow but narrowly specialized field.
Promote firm and project goals of excellence in design, execution and sustainability.
Be a recognized expert and essential resource to other SERA staff.
Additional
Responsible for staying actively involved throughout the construction document process to support design development and delivery of projects.
Perform design review of design documents on several concurrent projects.
Deliver conceptual design ideas with both graphic and written communication skill sets that are technical, clear, and concise.
Show an open and willing desire for teaching and mentoring junior designers.
Take on leadership roles in the office for a variety of assignments, either temporary or permanent.
Fosters and advances a community design culture through commitment to design both inside and outside of the office.
Provide constructive feedback to facilitate continuous improvement.
Actively participate in and lead market sector business development pursuits.
Other duties as assigned.
Education and Experience
Requires either a 5 year Bachelor of Architecture degree or a 6 year Masters of Architecture degree from an NCARB accredited university or international equivalent.
Licensed architect with a NCARB certificate is required. Generally have 12+ years of experience.
Candidate should have documented proof of design solutions including conceptual ideas, design development details and construction documents created as designer/project architect/architectural designer.
Proficiency in Autodesk Revit, Adobe Creative Suite, MS Office Suite required.
LEEP AP within 1 year of hire.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Possesses advanced knowledge of the OSSC/ADAAG and the ability to achieve the intent of the code through, creative design solutions, variances and/or appeals.
Strong working knowledge of sustainable building design.
Possesses knowledge of other codes and/or guidelines such as NFPA, OSHA, FHA, ANSI, and the USGBC LEED Rating system.
Knowledge of Sketchup, Rhino, Grasshopper, and hand graphic skills preferred.
Advanced ability to communicate through verbal, written and graphic communication formats.
High level of creativity, innovative thinking, and problem solving.
Advanced ability to objectively analyze and document critical items for project sites that should serve as the foundational basis for place based design solutions.
Advanced ability to deliver innovative design and concept thinking skills in various graphic formats including both digital and hand drawings.
Advanced ability to work in an independent setting as well as a collaborative team member that is highly productive and effective.
Advanced ability to advance personal and team member growth in line with SERA goals and mission.
Advanced ability to design innovative process delivery methods that match the needs of the client and or project.
Advanced ability to engage and coordinate cross discipline expertise within other SERA staff including but not limited to Urban Planning, Interior design, Landscape Architecture, and SURG.
Familiarity with trends in the A/E/C industry.

Established building envelope consulting firm seeks a talented and creative individual with experience in the design of building enclosures of all types. Experience and knowledge in historic masonry construction, modern curtain wall system design, rain screen design systems and roofing systems of all types is a must. Additionally, knowledge in the principles of embodied carbon building design and high-efficient building envelope design, is a plus.
Building Envelope Specialists (BES) (Recently acquired by LeMessurier Consultants), is a full-service consulting company specializing in the investigation, evaluation, and repair of historic and non- historic building enclosures. BES’s experienced consultants provide clients a specialized knowledge and skill set in understanding how building enclosures should be designed and assembled, how building enclosures age once installed and how to maintain this critical component of the building to maintain its maximum performance value. From onsite assessments and forensic investigations, to the preparation of construction documents, BES/LeMessurier provides their clients a level of professional consulting services matched by none.
Our ideal candidate for this position would embody the desire to investigate, analyze and solve complex building envelope failures. They would have the ability to accurately document and explain the issues to the client as well as offer remedial design solutions to remedy the situation. Additionally, this candidate would have strong computer & graphic presentation skills, be proficient in Autodesk Revit, AutoCAD 12 or higher, excellent technical writing skills with a proficiency in creating project plans to include project specifications. Excellent communication skills are a must with the ability to work effectively and collaboratively with clients and workmates. Knowledge in understanding, interpreting and applying applicable building codes, design principles, regulations and professional standards of care is expected.
The candidate should be a highly motivated person focused on superior client service and technical excellence with a desire to excel in a fast-paced environment. Minimum requirements include:
Bachelor’s Degree or higher education in architecture and/or architectural design.
5 to 10 years of progressive design or building experience.
Professional licensure is preferred but not required.
Hold a valid driver’s license.
Clean driving record.
Availability to travel and stay overnight for short periods of time.
Pass a back-ground test.
Duties shall include:
Assist in building conditions surveys and assessments in the field.
Writing technical reports and assessments.
Provide architectural design support within the Design Department.
Resolve complex technical/design issues and provide guidance to the client and team.
Manage and communicate regularly with project team, consultants, and other team members regarding project status; ensure work meets clients’ requirements and is completed timely and within budget.
Maintain records to document all phases of client/architect/contractor relationship and activities.
Perform a variety of architectural staff level duties, as needed and dependent on project scope.
Assist in design department activities as defined by the department manager.
BES/LeMessurier offers a relaxed work environment, competitive salary, medical/dental/vision/life insurances, retirement investment match, ample PTO, paid holidays, flexible working hours, growth potential and more.
Please E-mail resume and salary requirements to Scott Whitaker @ swhitaker@building-envelope-specialists.net

Work comfortably alongside client and internal stakeholders.
Experience working with both co-located and remote team members.

Weave supports small business owners by providing an all-in-one platform to help them communicate with, and grow their customer base. With Weave’s complete business toolbox, small businesses can streamline all their communication, payments and marketing - all from one place - and continually provide a phenomenal customer experience.

At the core of Weave’s growth are our people. We are passionate about providing an amazing workplace for talented people who demonstrate our core values: Hungry, Creative, and Caring. In 2019, Weave received several significant awards, including the Fortune 100 Best Companies, Forbes Cloud 100, and Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies.

Don’t believe us? Check out why our employees, their families, and our 13,000+ customers love Weave - Our Story OR head to our Instagram page @workatweave to see what our employees are up to.

As a Product Designer at Weave, you will collaborate with product managers, product designers, and engineers to design experiences, interactions, and prototypes. You will make decisions that have a direct impact on Weave and our customers. We are looking for a designer that aligns with our core values: hungry for success and personal growth, creative in their work and ideas, and caring about colleagues, customers, and our community.

Requirements

What you’ll be doing?
Work directly with Product Managers and engineers to define the product strategy
Convey designs via sketches, storyboards, hi-fidelity mockups, prototypes
Create iterative designs that meet Weave’s product & design objectives, respond to user feedback and usability testing.
Be an advocate for the user. Conduct primary and/or secondary research, as well as quick rounds of usability tests.
Work across a wide range of projects, technologies, and devices.
Support development teams throughout the implementation cycle.
What will make us love you?
A passionate Product Designer with a proven track record of great designs and strategy that meet user needs, product requirements, and business goals.
3-6 years of design industry experience. with an emphasis on user experience, interaction design, or visual design.
Experience creating innovative digital interface design solutions for mobile, web, and/or desktop applications.
Ability to grasp the essence of complex design problems, user pain points, research findings, and translate them into practical design solutions.
Ability to proficiently facilitate brainstorming sessions, cultivate the creative thinking process, create compelling presentation decks or videos, and present articulate concept pitches.
Ability to accept and design against feedback from colleagues
Proficient in fundamental visual & interaction design principles.
Benefits
Medical, dental, and vision benefits
Life and Short term disability
Unlimited PTO
Great company culture

If you had the best ERP tool that powered some of the most high-profile Architecture, Engineering and Government Contracting firms in America, what would you do? Make it even better! The Unanet/Clearview team is committed to consistently delivering new features to its suite of products and we are just getting started! We want to grow our team, tackle even bigger challenges and do amazing things. We work in focused, agile-based, teams to constantly improve our code base, add new ways of interfacing with the system and have amassed a large backlog of interesting product initiatives. We want to grow to enable even greater success within our industry. This is where you come in!

As a UX Designer, this is a great opportunity for growth, experimentation, and the challenge to create something truly remarkable all while having the support of an executive team that understands the importance of a Lean UX process.

Applicants must be authorized for non-sponsored employment in the U.S.

Responsibilities

Design software that delivers on what users need.
Through solo and collaborative design methods, create low and high-fidelity prototypes of possible design solutions
Translate complex product requirements into easy and intuitive user flows
Take a data-driven approach to influence your visual and interaction design decisions
Validate that design solutions meet user needs through usability testing methods such as unmoderated testing, moderated testing, and A/B testing
Be able to present and validate your design concepts with internal and external business stakeholders
Oversee the maintenance and application of visual design standards
Understand what users need, and help your team understand it, too.
Collaborate with product managers, technical leads, customers, and other stakeholders to introduce, iterate, and clarify requirements
Use research methods such as participatory design, ethnographic studies, and user interviews to learn how users think and behave; use that research to help drive your innovative concepts forward
Model knowledge about users and share it with your team to help everyone make better decisions
Explain your ideas, designs, and best practices in order to successfully convince, motivate, and inspire stakeholders
Be a tireless advocate for exceptional user experience
Skills & Experience
At least 5 years of experience designing business-oriented web and mobile applications
Demonstrated ability to work with business stakeholders and technical teams to understand, analyze, and document requirements
A strong technical aptitude (you don't have to code, but you do have to be able to earn the respect of the people who do)
Effective interpersonal communications skills (presentation, written and oral) and the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
A positive attitude and a passion for working with strong, collaborative teams
Experience with Agile development methodologies (e.g. Scrum, Kanban)
Exceptional visual design skills
About Unanet

With headquarters in Dulles, Virginia, Unanet serves more than 2,000 businesses with its ERP software solutions purpose-built for professional service organizations. Unanet's software helps project-driven organizations reliably plan, track and manage projects, people, and financials. Unanet's customer-centric culture means we strive to deliver insights with personal service.

At Unanet you will work collaboratively with colleagues equally committed to achieving customers' expectations. We take pride in delivering more than technology, but also the extra support and service customers need.

Selected as one of the 'Top Places to Work' three years running, Unanet's culture is collaborative, dedicated and energetic. We offer a competitive salary, health and life insurance benefits, and the potential for bonus.

Unanet is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for positions without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Company Overview
Catalyst is the world’s most intuitive Customer Success Platform (CSP), and was built by an experienced group of industry leaders. Our software integrates with all of the tools that CS teams are already using to provide one centralized view of customer data. Customer Success Managers can subsequently take the right actions to prevent churn, increase product adoption, and align the entire organization on a unified workflow to manage customers throughout their journey. Catalyst helps organizations turn Customer Success into a company-wide mission.

Position Overview
As a Product Designer at Catalyst, you will craft delightful user interfaces and experiences for our core features. As the organization’s second product designer, you will report to the Head of Product and have an opportunity to help shape large parts of the product and the future of the Design and Product org. If you are looking for the opportunity to own multiple features with strong mentorship along the way, let’s chat!

What You’ll Do
Own and deliver the end-to-end product design process for multiple features
Perform internal and external user research to understand our users’ needs
Work closely with product managers and engineers to develop solutions that are best tailored for the problems the team has identified
Maintain and iterate on design components to drive consistency and reusability throughout the app
Help mentor product designers, product managers, and engineering managers to be design-minded
Present designs to designers, engineers, PMs, and leadership on a regular basis
Actively learn about new design trends and concepts to improve the design process and culture at Catalyst

What You’ll Need

Job Title: WP - Marketing - Graphic Designer - Year Round - Full Time
Job Description:
Graphic Designer

Deliver creative design that communicates ideas that inspire, inform, and captivate guests to Venture Out at Winter Park Resort. Create compelling content by getting to know the Winter Park brand, audience, and marketing strategy. Plus, work with a variety of internal businesses, external partners, and across multiple platforms to effectively bring our brand and key messages to life.

You should be a self-starter, have a passion for the outdoors, demonstrate great attention to detail and have a strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite. You will take design projects from concept to completion while serving as the lead/only designer and production coordinator. This includes photography selection, occasional copy writing, and the ability to work under minimal supervision while problem solving for multiple businesses, seasons and problems. An Ideal candidate for this roll will be able to maintain their creativity while tackling a wide variety of projects including administrative demands.

This is a full-time, year-round position.

Essential Job Functions
Adhere to the Winter Park Resort and Trestle Bike Park brand standards in all creative
Serve as the Resort’s Brand Champion and address issues when you see that brand standards are not being met
Understand the Resort’s graphic design needs and work with appropriate stakeholders to collect copy, images, logos, etc. to complete design projects
Create project timelines; communicate expected delivery dates and deadlines
Develop a proof editing process to limit design errors (all large projects require final sign-off by the Director of Marketing)
Establish an open line of communication with all business unit leaders
Manage vendor relationships and negotiate print quotes/contracts
Build a small team of“as-needed” freelance graphic designers to aid in the completion of large projects
Manage print production budgets
Monitor competitor marketing efforts and industry marketing trends
Analyze consumer touch points and improve their experience
Requirements
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Marketing or related field.
Experience: Minimum of 2-3 years progressive experience in graphic design role required.
Highly adept in use of Adobe Creative Suite with a developed portfolio of past graphic design work where individual is the sole author
Strong understanding of design, copy, typography, layout, photography, guest experience, and using marketing materials to communicate with the consumer
Demonstrable understanding of the advertising / media placement workflow
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with modest supervision
Ability to work under deadline pressure and handle many projects at once
Ensure a high quality of creative and production is upheld.
Commitment to guest and employee satisfaction
Strong oral and written communication skills
Effective and proactive communication across all levels of management, including thorough“follow-up” skills
Ability to accept positive and negative feedback
Strong attention to detail, organizational and time management skills
Computer skills needed include email, word processing, spreadsheets, presentations,
Display strong team play and interpersonal skills in order to be effective with significant interactions at all levels within and outside of the organization.
Demonstrate command of key functional skills: copy development and evaluation, timely production management and strategic creative development
Ability to take the creative direction, campaign creative, and statistics from an agency and develop all onsite signage, collateral pieces, as well as print, internet, and digital advertisements. This includes creating items for not just Marketing and Events, but all departments including Group Sales, Weddings, Food& Beverage, Retail, Rental, Ski + Ride School, Lodging, the Village, Guest Services, Season Pass, and Human Resources.
Management of the Winter Park Resort, Trestle Bike Park brand as well as internal business units’ brands
Intermediate or better skiing/snowboarding ability strongly preferred
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS

This position will be required to work evenings, weekends and holidays.

Office Environment:

Able to lift, carry, or otherwise move and position a minimum of 40 pounds on an occasional basis.
Manual dexterity to operate a computer and other common office equipment on a constant basis.
Auditory and visual acuity to operate computers, phones, mobile devices and basic office equipment on a constant basis.
Ability to work for extended periods of time sitting, bending, reaching, and speaking on a constant basis.
Ability to work for extended periods of time standing, walking, kneeling, pushing and pulling on an occasional basis.
Talking and hearing occur continuously in the process of communicating with guests, supervisors and other employees.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily- reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

OTHER DUTIES AS ASSIGNED:

This position description is an overview of the scope of responsibilities for the role described above. With the evolution of Winter Park Resort, the responsibilities of this position may change as may the dates associated with many of the tasks. During these times of change, this position requires the flexibility and willingness to accept new responsibilities and potentially transfer others. It will also be the responsibility of any employee of Winter Park Resort to be a positive influence on the transformation of the resort and its associated lines of business.

Are you ready to join the fastest-growing digital banking platform in the world?

Kony DBX is the banking and financial services arm of Kony, Inc. and is a globally recognized leader in digital banking transformation recognized by top analysts such as Gartner, IDC, Forrester and Ovum. Are you constantly thinking about the entire ecosystem and how a change to one user's experience could affect another? Here at Kony, employees are MOBILIZERS - someone who acts and inspires to build a digital world. Being a mobilizer means that we realize that our impact goes far beyond our job function. We're a global company with a local heartbeat. Connecting with people is a part of all we dofrom apps to volunteer events.

Job Title: Transportation Project Engineer and Lead Designer
Job Description:
Job Summary

Our team consists of over 120 committed professionals at all levels. Founded in 1979, we have been expanding over the past several years and now serve clients from offices in Benton Harbor, Manistee, South Haven and Battle Creek, Michigan as well as South Bend, Valparaiso, Lafayette, Hobart and Goshen, Indiana. We offer civil engineering with emphasis on transportation design and construction engineering for Michigan Department of Transportation (MDOT), surveying, architectural, waterfront development, and landscape architecture services for local and state agencies.

We are seeking bright, new talent to join our knowledgeable, creative, experienced team. Benefits include a competitive salary, health, dental and vision insurance, 401k plan, paid time off, and life insurance. Please visit our website at www.abonmarche.com

Responsibilities and Duties
Provide engineering design for a variety of highway design projects including: roadway reconstruction and overlay, bridge approaches, storm sewers, sidewalk ramps, guardrail, pavement marking and signing, and right of way plans.
Develop plans, specifications and estimates based on current MDOT plan development requirements.
Perform drainage delineation, calculation and storm sewer pipe sizing using GEOPAK drainage.
Ability to develop pavement marking plans, signing plans, and maintenance of traffic plans
Must have the ability to recommend Best Management Practices (BMPs) per requirements of MDOT and Michigan Department of Environmental Quality (MDEQ).
Perform and deliver cost estimates using MDOTs Weighted Average Item Price Report and ability to work through AASHTO software, Trnsport-Stand-Alone PES Worksheet (SAPW).
Prepare design computations and quantity estimates.
Review, assign and provide guidance to drafting technicians to prepare working design plans using Microstation.
Utilize Microstation GEOPAK SS4 and GEOPAK drainage to develop plans.
Assist in client contact and communication pertaining to specific projects.
Assist in the preparation of reports, specifications, plans, design schedules, and environmental impact studies.
Qualifications and Skills
Bachelors degree in civil engineering with emphasis in transportation engineering.
Michigan Professional Engineer license preferred.
4+ years of experience in highway design (all components of alignment and geometrics design). based on Michigan Department of Transportation (MDOT) road design manual.
Must be proficient with Microstation GEOPAK SS4.
Must have an understanding of MDOT Workspace concept for plan development using Microstation.
Must have prior experience in 3D modelling using Microstation.
Ability to perform drainage design using GEOPAK drainage when needed.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office.
Good written and verbal communication skills
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Born from the belief that great things come to those who cook, Yummly provides limitless inspiration, with the tools to make it happenfrom recipe discovery to prep to perfect results. Just as appliances removed the most cumbersome chores, the next tipping point in daily life is upon us in the food space. A system of personalized discovery that learns you better to serve you better, so the question "what's for dinner?" is answered before it's even asked.

Yummly has grown to over 28M registered users and our mobile apps are consistently one of the leading recipe apps on iPhone, iPad, Android, and Windows. Next on the menu? Building the connected kitchen of the future.

Yummly is seeking a seasoned and experienced UX Designer to join our food-obsessed team and lead the UX function in developing the next phase of category-defining smart cooking and connected kitchen products.

Join the Yummly Design Team in crafting great experiences that help home cooks plan, prep, and cook meals faster and more easily through smart personalized guidance. We want you to elevate our user experience efforts to the next level through your passion for future-facing user-centric design solutions that will help further shape and strengthen our position in this space.

As Senior UX Designer:
You are a thought leader that thrives on bringing innovation to your work.
You pride yourself in designing meaningful experiences that delight and inspire users.
You are organized and detail-oriented, fluent with UX best practices and emerging trends.
You advocate for intuitive affordance and design from the point of view of the user while understanding and meeting the needs of the business.
You are an expert communicator and are able to articulate the rationale that informs the decision-making in your work.
You use data and supporting research methodologies to inform your perspective and develop design hypotheses.
You continuously seek out improvements in usability and validate your thinking through user testing.
You work collaboratively with product, engineering, marketing, content, visual design, and data science teams to build the best products possible.
Responsibilities:


Champion the role of UX and user-centric design within the organization.
Define and uphold best-in-class UX design processes that streamline the product design cycle.
Oversee the development of a consistent UX design language and design pattern libraries.
Scope and design new features for mobile and web environments and engage with relevant teams throughout the development process to ensure delivery meets expectations and performs as intended.
Utilize a fully developed skill set including researching, sketching, and iterating to develop actionable design solutions.
Identify and document use cases that improve life in the kitchen with Yummly.
Bring clarity to solving complex problems through thoughtful information architecture.
Map the flow of user traffic and data to identify areas for improvement and solve problems at the early stages of the design process.
Create wireframes, clickable prototypes, and high fidelity UX flows and design to drive design decisions and optimize user experience.
Conduct usability testing remotely and on-site at Yummly (at times using our fully equipped professional kitchen!)
Communicate design expectations and interaction behaviors to engineering and QA teams using the most appropriate tools and means available.
Qualifications:


An inspirational, wide-ranging portfolio of your work you can share including work for mobile and web.
5-8 years of relevant design experience with examples of productionalized design work you have shipped.
Exceptional knowledge of IA and interaction design specifications, wireframes, mockups, prototypes.
Extensive experience with design validation and usability testing.
Experience using metrics and leveraging analytics tools to track user behavior and develop data-driven insights.
Well-versed with UX and workflow tools such as Sketch, Zeplin, Abstract, InVision, and/or other industry-standard tools such as Axure, Omnigraffle, etc.
Excellent understanding of iOS, Android, and website technological capabilities.
Bachelor's degree in UX Design, HCI, Graphic Design, or related qualification, or equivalent design industry. Master's degree is a bonus!
Bonus:


Hands-on experience or education in design research and behavioral economics.
Start up experience.
Passionate about food.
And a little more about us:

At Yummly, we are a team of talented and diverse technology professionals on a mission to rule the kitchen. We've seen great success using machine learning and artificial intelligence to make cooking fun, easy, and personalized. Our iOS and Android apps have 4.5+ star reviews, millions of downloads, and many awards (download and give it a try!).

We were acquired by Whirlpool, the world's largest home appliance maker. Together, we have appetizing aspirations to build the fully-connected kitchen of the future.

We work in a historic old building in downtown Redwood City, a few minutes walk from Caltrain at the Redwood City Station. Although, during Covid-19 we are all working from home. In early Fall, we will be relocating to a new custom built office in San Carlos. Please talk to us if you have a love for design, hard problems, and food!

Yummly is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia is one of the 12 regional Reserve Banks that, together with the Board of Governors in Washington, D.C., make up the Federal Reserve System. It helps formulate and implement monetary policy, supervises banks and bank and savings and loan holding companies, and provides financial services to depository institutions and the federal government. The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia serves eastern and central Pennsylvania, southern New Jersey, and Delaware.

Job Summary:

This position is responsible for ensuring a compelling visual and graphic interpretation of the Bank's brand and content for our users. The role supports and assists business lines by designing friendly and usable creative solutions that meet the business needs. Serves as a coach and mentor for less-experienced staff when needed. Positions the Bank as a mission-driven organization that values accountability, excellence, inclusion, innovation, integrity, and service. This role also helps the team with digital design, production and related processes, while working closely with content providers, web developers, writers, editors, designers, project managers, IT staff, and other Federal Reserve System staff.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

Develops the most appropriate and strategically designed collateral based on project scope and need.

Possesses the ability to meet directly with clients and give creative advice that is appropriate for brand and audience.

Works with the creative team to develop digital assets to be used across various channels, including: social media, web, print, and other digital formats.

Assesses new digital communications technologies and their impact on visual content strategy and delivery; offers recommendations and works with internal and external experts to provide effective traditional and digital creative services across the Bank.

Enforced adherence to style standards.

Helps maintain a cohesive Style Guide for use across the Bank’s internal and external digital properties.

Conceptualizes and articulates strong, user-centered and impactful interactions, while balancing the needs of the business and the capabilities of technology.

Exhibits product ownership, presents work and rationale to stakeholders, and is accountable to timelines and project needs.

Develops and recommends basic art and copy layout utilizing best practices and outcome driven strategies.

Performs other duties as assigned or requested.

Creates user flows, wireframes, visual designs, site maps, storyboards, style guides, low- and high-fidelity prototypes

Oversees design for web pages, supporting images, and other visual content, ensuring a user-centric design perspective.

Incorporates user-interface (UI) and user-experience (UX) best-practices into design and production, including usability testing and other user research programs to inform user-centric design.

Leads design and wireframe reviews and prototyping processes, proposing design solutions to increase engagement, and as appropriate, conversion.

Executes design from requirements gathering to concepts, to handoff to developers.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor of Arts degree in Graphic Design, Interaction Design or field related to visual information design

Minimum of 5 years of related work experience

Detailed knowledge of fundamental design principles that affect typography, color use, composition, use of space, and presentation of information

Demonstrated experience developing concepts and brainstorming independently or as part of a team

Experience using wire-framing techniques to show navigation, flow and interaction details.

Familiarity with web accessibility guidelines

Minimum of 5 years’ experience in graphic design, including experience with data presentation and visualization.

Minimum of 2 years’ experience designing websites and applications, responsive interfaces (including optimization for mobile and tablet), email campaigns, and other user experiences (UX) and interaction.

An online portfolio demonstrating strong visual design experience, as well as expertise in user-centric, interactive design for multiple platforms.

Expert in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign

Familiarity with some or all of the following: SASS, Sketch, Foundation/Bootstrap, GIT, Javascript (jQuery, AngularJS)

Familiarity with prototyping tools (e.g.: Axure, Balsamiq, invisionapp

Familiarity with web languages: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

Professional interpersonal skills, written and verbal communication

Ability to prioritize and manage multiple milestones and projects efficiently

Other:

Our business successes have led to growth and our extraordinary culture is the cornerstone for an engaged and productive workforce.

Job Summary:

The designer is part of the creative team responsible for designing, developing and delivering a wide range of communication materials for our national brand and hospital clients across all media platforms. The right candidate will be a key contributor to the team, juggling multiple design requests in an incredibly organized fashion with creative acumen and remarkable accuracy. You will work alongside our design team and internal account teams, maintaining high levels of communication and collaboration.
