Ensures strategic and creative objectives are understood and consistently met, communicating project status and recommending adjustments to plan
Takes direction and works independently or in a collaborative group atmosphere
Ensures that projects are produced timely and on budget
Understands multiple media formats - Possesses strong collaborative nature
We have extremely high standards. You will be joining a high-achieving in-house design team with your solid integrated understanding of print and digital. You are highly motivated with a can-do attitude, flexible, with excellent communication skills. You know how to turn challenges into solutions and actively seek greater responsibility.

Bachelors degree

Relevate strives to have high-performing, well-balanced individuals who are generous community contributors

Weave supports small business owners by providing an all-in-one platform to help them communicate with, and grow their customer base. With Weave’s complete business toolbox, small businesses can streamline all their communication, payments and marketing - all from one place - and continually provide a phenomenal customer experience.

At the core of Weave’s growth are our people. We are passionate about providing an amazing workplace for talented people who demonstrate our core values: Hungry, Creative, and Caring. In 2019, Weave received several significant awards, including the Fortune 100 Best Companies, Forbes Cloud 100, and Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies.

Don’t believe us? Check out why our employees, their families, and our 13,000+ customers love Weave - Our Story OR head to our Instagram page @workatweave to see what our employees are up to.

As a Product Designer at Weave, you will collaborate with product managers, product designers, and engineers to design experiences, interactions, and prototypes. You will make decisions that have a direct impact on Weave and our customers. We are looking for a designer that aligns with our core values: hungry for success and personal growth, creative in their work and ideas, and caring about colleagues, customers, and our community.

Requirements

What you’ll be doing?
Work directly with Product Managers and engineers to define the product strategy
Convey designs via sketches, storyboards, hi-fidelity mockups, prototypes
Create iterative designs that meet Weave’s product & design objectives, respond to user feedback and usability testing.
Be an advocate for the user. Conduct primary and/or secondary research, as well as quick rounds of usability tests.
Work across a wide range of projects, technologies, and devices.
Support development teams throughout the implementation cycle.
What will make us love you?
A passionate Product Designer with a proven track record of great designs and strategy that meet user needs, product requirements, and business goals.
3-6 years of design industry experience. with an emphasis on user experience, interaction design, or visual design.
Experience creating innovative digital interface design solutions for mobile, web, and/or desktop applications.
Ability to grasp the essence of complex design problems, user pain points, research findings, and translate them into practical design solutions.
Ability to proficiently facilitate brainstorming sessions, cultivate the creative thinking process, create compelling presentation decks or videos, and present articulate concept pitches.
Ability to accept and design against feedback from colleagues
Proficient in fundamental visual & interaction design principles.

Life and Short term disability
Unlimited PTO
Great company culture

About Guidance

Guidance is a customer centric commerce service provider dedicated to growth oriented mid-market and enterprise branded manufacturers and merchants in both B2C and B2B with industry leading practices in multichannel retail strategies, mobile, customer experience, innovative design, and complex system integration. Guidance delivers award winning ecommerce solutions using Magento, Shopify Plus, Big Commerce and EPiSERVER.

Job Description:
Designer
ICRAVE, an award-winning strategy, interior and experience design firm, is looking for a talented, passionate and highly creative Architect and/or Interior Designer to join our team.
Design is a life-love. Not a job.
The ICRAVE Studio is our second home, we encourage collaboration and foster a vibrant work culture that is diverse, lively, balanced and inspiring. This is a place where everybody’s creativity is welcomed, and participation and ideas are always expected.
Candidates should have a degree from an accredited Masters or Bachelor of Architecture or Interior Architecture program and should have a minimum of (3) years of design experience. Ability to express innovation and rigor around ideas is a must. Experience in the hospitality design industry is a plus. The ideal candidate should be creative, should have the desire to take initiative, and should have the ability to multi-task between different projects. You will be required to express your ideas both visually and verbally.
As an ICRAVE Architect or Interior Designer, you will:
Collaborate with your team to create and develop projects through all design phases
Create, produce and manage detailed design drawings using Revit or AutoCad
Craft elaborate client presentations using InDesign
Communicate and drive conceptual thinking on your projects
Produce 3D models, sketches and boards to support your ideas
Select, specify and design FF&E as well as architectural finishes
Participate in client meetings and presentations
Have the opportunity to lead projects of various sizes based on experience and demonstrated growth within the studio
Be expected to apply creativity, rigor and passion to your work
Be expected to bring new ideas daily
Be expected to be an active participant and a positive influence on the creative culture of the studio
To apply for this position, you must:
Have at least (3) years of post-graduate architectural or interior design experience
Hold a degree from an accredited Architecture or Interior Design program
Have experience producing drawing sets in Revit or AutoCad
Be proficient with Adobe Creative Suite programs
Possess excellent communication skills
Possess the ability to model in 3D Max, Rhino, Sketchup or Revit
Experience with Revit or BIM management and the hospitality design industry are a plus
Visit our website to learn more about our work and Studio values https://www.icrave.com/
We offer a competitive employee benefits package including medical and dental insurance, 401K with a matching program, significant vacation time and annual bonuses based on merit.

Qualified candidates should send their resume, portfolio and drawing samples to jobs@icrave.com, designate the Designer position in the subject line of your email and please keep all correspondence under 10MB. Note that only the selected applicants will receive a response.

TheHomeMag, the nation's Fastest Growing Home Improvement Magazine, is seeking a qualified print advertising designer for Colorado to specialize in creating results driven ads and campaigns for existing clients as well as spec ads and campaigns to supercharge our sales team.
Our design team works directly with clients and staff to create visual advertising, to inspire, inform, or captivate clients while honoring the TheHomeMag Design Standards. This is not a position for just anyone, but rather an outgoing, energetic, enthusiastic, creative go-getter who wants to make an impact on the lives and businesses of their community.

STRIVE TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING RESULTS:

WORK SCHEDULE:

Benefits are medical, dental, 401k, paid time off and paid major holidays.
Confidential video-call interviews available.

The Senior Instructional Designer is responsible for defining, designing & implementing training & knowledge management strategies that directly support the delivery of the operations strategic plan. Responsibilities are primarily focused on, but not limited to:
building strong partnerships with business leaders, field & home office associates, SMEs, suppliers and others to identify key areas where advanced training, knowledge management or other talent management solutions are required to meet business objectives
serving as an expert instructional design consultant, partnering with the business area to develop training solutions optimizing methods, channels and other factors in facilitating field associate and manager training programs
supporting large-scale department-specific projects or companywide initiatives (ex: update / maintain photo studio training materials)
managing design & delivery of training, knowledge management or other talent management programs through direct or indirect reporting relationships (ex: driving GO training through select SMEs)
As a leader within the corporate training community, this individual will create curricula and materials aligned with corporate training strategies and lead the integration of this material into CarMaxs overall training strategy and initiatives where appropriate.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Directly supports the development and deployment of the department talent management strategy through specific training programs in support of overall business goals
Leverages professional skills, internal & external relationships and in-depth understanding of current environment to support program development
Partners with field and other resources to clearly define opportunity/root cause, then leads creation of workable solutions that deliver measurable, sustainable results
Develops measurable outcomes, partnering with others to develop appropriate measurement systems to assess training strategy impact
Makes recommendations and adjusts training processes, programs and materials to improve effectiveness and appropriately satisfy stakeholder needs
Determines appropriate instructional methods such as self-paced
training, group instruction, simulation exercises, role plays, computer
based training and other alternatives to optimize cost, quality, speed and measurable impact to business objectives

Collaborates with appropriate subject matter experts to develop and maintain training and communication materials such as workbooks, facilitator guides, multimedia/web based courses, computer tutorials, videos, case studies and reference guides
Analyzes learning needs and partners with subject matter experts to provide input on course/knowledge content
Plans and coordinates skills assessments, knowledge organization & storage, training and other materials continually adapting approach to optimize ease of use and business impact
Support / manage the KMX Way KMXU migration by supporting the end users ability to easily locate appropriate documents
Partners with stakeholders to provide strategic instructional direction
Facilitates training during introduction to new courses
Monitors and analyzes training programs by examining learners satisfaction levels, proficiency testing, job performance & overall measurable business impact
Directly supports larger scale projects as training/talent management subject matter/design/delivery expert
QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions:
Strong organizational and planning skills
Superior communication skills
Outstanding instructional design & delivery skills
Knowledgeable on methods and applications designed for adult learning
Up to date on latest training methods and practices used in leading companies
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

3+ years experience in instructional design and application.
Experience supporting Lean or Six Sigma initiative delivery a plus
Proficient in Training design/development
Proficient in educational methods and application for adult learning
Proficiency with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel
MS Project, MS Access, OnTrack for Training, relational databases and web-based development software (eg. Captivate, Macromedia products) a plus

Job Description:
Company Description

KWSM is a full service digital marketing agency made up of journalists. We specialize in website development & SEO, social media strategy & management, content creation, PR & influencer marketing, and digital advertising. Clients hire us to create integrated digital marketing strategies to generate leads or sales. Half our clients are B2B and half are B2C.

We have offices in Orange County, CA, San Diego, CA, Atlanta, GA and Las Vegas, NV.

Job Description

We are looking for a website designer/developer to create new websites, and refresh existing websites, for our clients. We are a digital marketing agency that believes that social media and digital ads work best when we can drive traffic to a highly-functional hub. There is no reason for a company to invest in a digital strategy if their website is outdated. You will work with our Content Editors to create an outstanding online presence for each of our clients, ensuring that their website and social media channels are working together.

We're looking for someone who truly wants to be part of our team. We're building something amazing, and need your ideas and talent to take our website program to the next level.

You will need to be familiar with Wordpress, Google web tools, and have a basic understanding of the major social media channels (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube). The ability to work on non-wordpress sites is also a plus. Throw in some graphic design skills, and we would be pretty excited about you.

We are looking for someone innovative and creative. We expect our web designers to have design capabilities in addition to the ability to simply build out a website. You must be able to listen to a client's goals and ideas, and create a website that exceeds their expectations.

We value efficiency and the ability to juggle several projects at once. At any given time, we are working with several clients simultaneously, and each one of them needs to be treated as a priority. You must be able to prioritize a to-do list and meet deadlines without fail.

This isn't the kind of gig where you can work through a couple of rounds of changes, and be finished with the site. We will continue to tweak a project until the client is thrilled. We're looking for someone who is loyal, patient, and cares deeply about giving clients exactly what they want and need.

The right designer/developer for our team will have a solid understanding of search engine optimization, how social media and websites work together, and best practices for online marketing. We design great looking sites - that work to boost our clients' visibility (and bottom line).

This is a full-time, salaried position with benefits and job security.

We operate on a 9/80 workweek - Fridays off every other week, 9-hour workdays from 7:00 am - 4:30 pm Monday - Thursday.

Qualifications

The right person for this job will be...

Creative.

If creating exceptional websites was easy, anyone could do it. If you have big ideas, are willing to take risks, and want a job where you can be innovative and try new things, KWSM could be a very good fit.

Communicative.

We tell stories for a living. That involves engaging and communicating with an audience online, but it also requires the ability to communicate well with our clients, and each other. We’re a small company, and you will have a lot of opportunity to add your feedback. We need someone who wants to be heard.

Great at Time Management.

Can you take a lengthy ‘to do’ list and prioritize what’s important? Can you multi-task when necessary, while continuing to perform well? Can you thrive in a bustling and interactive environment, and still get your work done? If so, you’ll fit right in!

Team-oriented.

We have a very collaborative office, and want to work with people who want to be part of a team. If you’re the kind of person who likes the door to their office closed, you probably won’t be happy here. (Our offices don’t actually have doors.)

Passionate.

We want to work with people who are passionate. If you have the ability to get excited about something and throw yourself into it, you will find a lot of kindred spirits here.

Additional Information

If this sounds like you, please email Katie Wagner at katie(at)kwsmdigital.com

The "Internet of Things" (IoT) market is expected to grow to trillions of dollars over the next 10 years as 50 billion devices are brought online. Aeris is at the forefront of this industry, building the networks and software infrastructure that companies need to win in a connected world. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, with offices in Chicago, London, Delhi, and Tokyo, we rank among the top ten IoT connectivity providers globally. We also provide an end-to-end connected vehicle platform that is helping some of the worlds largest automotive manufacturers compete for customers as the transportation industry rapidly evolves. We also power critical projects across energy, transportation, retail, healthcare and more.

Our company is in an enviable spot. Were profitable, and both our bottom line and our global reach are growing rapidly. Were playing in an exploding market where technology evolves daily and acquisitions / consolidations happen left and right. We are continuing to expand our IoT connectivity offerings to not only include all cellular technologies and services, but also a best-in-class IoT device management, services, and application SaaS platform, as well as alternate connectivity options such as low power WAN (LPWA), Wi-Fi and other short-range networking options.

About the Role

Thats where you come in. As a Product Designer, youll help define and refine best-in-class IoT products and play a crucial role in developing delightful end-to-end experiences for our customers. Working closely with leadership, Sales, Marketing, Engineering, Product Marketing and Product Management, youll perform in-depth user research, user flows and journey maps, create wireframes and prototypes for testing, advocate data-driven solutions, and layer in a visual experience utilizing and extending our brand and design systems.

The role offers access to some of the most brilliant minds in the industry, and the opportunity to build and elevate a thriving company in an environment that values innovation, autonomy and integrity. A few things to know about us:
We do things differently. As a pioneer in an industry poised to reshape every sector of the global economy, we cant settle for another companys tried and tested template. Innovation is the key to our success and its reflected in everything we do: from product design to corporate wellness.
We are owners. Strong managers enable their teams to figure out how to solve problems. You will be no exception and will have the ownership and autonomy needed to be truly creative.
Values are essential. We believe in doing things well and doing them right. Integrity is a core value here: youll see it embodied in our staff, our management approach and growing social impact work (we have a VP devoted to it).
We walk the walk on diversity and inclusion. Were a brilliant and eclectic mix of ethnicities, religions, industry experiences, sexual orientations, generations and more and thats by design. We see diverse perspectives as a core competitive advantage.
Career elevation. Create platform for growth where employees can take ownership of their opportunity and make it their own. Grow with the company and elevate your career.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with leadership, Sales, Marketing, Engineering, Product Marketing and Product Management to create innovative IoT solutions
With user-centered design as the basis for any project, youll conduct research with end users and internal stakeholders, evaluate feedback, create user journeys, wireframes and prototypes, and rapidly test and iterate your designs
Identify design issues and devise elegant solutions, and conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design challenges
Design for a wide range of devices and interfaces, and execute from concept to final hand-off to engineering
Build solutions within and help expand and grow our brand and design system
Requirements:
BS/MS in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, or equivalent experience
2-3 years of hands-on experience, including Web and Mobile UI/UX development
Demonstrable design skills with a strong portfolio
Confident in making strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core and new functions and features
Comfortable presenting your designs and key deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch and Figma
Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively
A life-learner, up-to-date with the latest design trends, techniques, and technologies
Versed in Agile/Scrum development methodologies
Have a working understanding of how designs are expressed in HTML and CSS
Aeris Benefits:

Working at Aeris is both rewarding and challenging, so we do our best to make staying healthy a little easier. Our beautiful office space in the heart of River North is only a short walk away from the Chicago River, and steps away from an incredible array of award-winning restaurants. We offer full medical, dental and vision benefits which take effect immediately at start of employment, in addition to gamified wellness challenges, unlimited PTO, a fully stocked kitchen with healthy (and unhealthy!) snacks, twice-weekly company walks with provided lunch, volunteer opportunities with social impact organizations, and monthly events that support our female-identified employees.

Description

Associate Graphic Designer

At Dietz & Watson, our employees’ talent and dedication to world-class sales and customer service are key contributors to our success. You will find that our company’s energetic environment and fast-paced work ethic are vital pieces that continue the growth and development of Dietz & Watson. We are looking for these talented and dedicated individuals to join our family, if you feel you have the experience and resources to become an integral part of the Dietz & Watson family, we want to hear from you.

We are looking for an Associate Graphic Designer to be the newest addition to our ever growing creative team in our Marketing Department. Responsibilities include creation and production of printed and digital marketing materials, and POS to help elevate the brand message through visual communications. The Associate Graphic Designer facilitates workflow through the system by making sure all production deadlines are met with proper brand guidelines and standards to ensure quality above all else. Reports to Visual Merchandising Manager.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with external agencies and in-house design studio to articulate and execute design decisions to help elevate brand message through all visual communications.
Conceive, design and produce professional creative marketing pieces for print, web and POP that will establish and reinforce the company’s brand, image and message.
Ensure the design and production of the piece effectively implements the creative concept and adheres to established brand standards.
Design and produce and manage all assigned projects in a timely and cost-effective manner.
Develop concepts, layout, and graphics for tradeshow booths including custom booth displays, free-standing displays, table-tops, and banner stands.
Develop print, online, and billboard advertising design collateral including sales sheets, brochures, Power Point presentations, proposals and newsletters.
The candidate should be culturally savvy and have a pulse on current trends.
Assist Marketing team with brainstorming, marketing and advertising strategies
Maintain digital graphics library

Minimum Requirements

Job Requirements
1 to 3 years’ experience in graphic design for print and web mediums
Education with relevant Certificate or degree strongly preferred
Proficiency in Adobe Suite
Experience with web editors and web-based CMS.
Fast pace work environment functioning on all levels.
The ability to handle multiple projects at once all the while being able to prioritize jobs based on required deadlines is critical.
Knowledge of all stages of graphic design from concept to production.
Previous experience working with IT departments and developers for implementation of complex design aspects.
Must be self-motivated with a strong desire to develop existing skills while maintaining an emphasis on learning new techniques.
Ability to work in a team
Strong time management skills and sense of urgency while maintaining attention to detail and still delivering high quality output.
Competitors: Boar's Head, Hatfield Quality Meats, Smithfield Foods

Job Description:
Do you love AutoCAD and Civil 3D? Are you looking to take the next step in your career? Are you ready to take on more responsibility and grow with a successful team with an entrepreneurial mindset? We provide professional development, work/life balance and the ability to work independently with 100% support of the company.

The best of both worlds: Not the giant engineering firm where one can easily get lost, and not the uncertain future of a small firm either. Bowman has a proven track record of success offering top notch professional engineering services in Glendale, Arizona and with the backing of several other offices in Arizona and across the country. Come join the best of the best in the area of top-notch professional engineers, surveyors and designers.

We are looking for a passionate and meticulous CAD Designer who can act in a lead role over other designers and/or drafters in residential, subdivisions, multifamily and commercial projects. Requirements include but are not limited to - BS in Civil Engineering or a minimum of 5 years hands on experience in detail design work. Must be proficient with AutoCAD and Civil 3D. Must be open to taking on additional responsibilities.

We offer exemplary benefits and competitive edge salaries with the ability to grow and advance professionally. Become a part of our growing team of professionals with a focus on delivering success to our clients. We believe in growth, entrepreneurial spirit and responsible freedom.

Glendale, Arizona, is home to national teams for spring training with an endless amount of recreational and cultural activities.

Opportunities are endless, join the Bowman team today!

Since our founding in 1995, Bowman Consulting has provided award-winning service on hundreds of successful projects, each with its own challenges and opportunities. Bowman Consulting's Engineers and Project Managers have earned a reputation for delivering timely and economical solutions to virtually every type of civil engineering challenge.

At Bowman Consulting, we believe in creating opportunities for aspiring people to thrive and achieve ambitious goals. Thats why a career at Bowman Consulting is more than a job. It is an opportunity to be part of a diverse and engaged community of professionals, to be treated as a respected and valued member of a motivated team and to be empowered to do exceptional work that advances the best interest of everyone involved in it. We recognize the importance of creating a work environment that is both rewarding to our employees and supportive of our unwavering commitment to provide unparalleled service to our clients.
****
Bowman Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

At this time, Bowman Consulting Group will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization.

Full time position for a designer with a minimum of 6 years of experience (or more) in a professional studio setting, with exposure to a variety of project types, preferably including interior design focused work. The position will work directly with a Project Manager and Principals as part of our hospitality and interior design studio and must have the capacity to assist on projects of all typology and scale.
Responsibilities include (but not limited to):
Assist Project Managers and Principals with development of design from concept to construction documentation
Independently execute pre-design tasks including field investigations of existing facilities, research of building codes, accessibility design requirements, and assist with documenting client programmatic requirements
Work both independently and as a team during production of presentation documentation including concept boards, architectural renderings, etc.
Assist design studio with finish selections, samples, and construction specifications.
Develop technical drawings and related project documentation from schematic design through to construction documentation.
Assist Project Manager and Principal during construction administration duties
Communicate between staff and consultants to coordinate project tasks/goals/related items.

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Applicant should meet the following criteria:
Possess an NAAB accredited degree in Architecture.
Have a burning desire to support a dynamic and diverse team of architects, designers and consultants in creating inspiring and impactful work.
Minimum 5 years experience in Commercial and/or Residential design.
Relevant experience in the project phasing and documentation requirements including construction documents and specifications.
Proficiency in Revit & AutoCAD
Working knowledge of SketchUp, as well as multiple Adobe suite programs (Acrobat, InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop).
Possess knowledge of interior finish materials and systems
Possess knowledge of construction detailing
Ability to manage multiple responsibilities and deadlines while contributing to multiple projects simultaneously
Strong critical thinking, leadership, and communication skills required
The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding regarding the components and process required to deliver innovative, yet realistic developed design solutions that satisfy our Client's stated functional; visual; and financial goals. They should take initiative, communicate effectively working within a team and demonstrate successful problem-solving skills.

DISCO is a legal tech software company focused on improving the practice of law by automating the parts of the practice that can be automated so that great lawyers can focus on tasks that really do require human legal judgment. To date, we have substantially disrupted the legal tech market with a lawyer inspired consumer-grade interface and a cloud-enabled technology platform that offers unprecedented performance and cost savings. Our objective is to own the legal tech market and become the leader in legal as Salesforce has done in the sales technology space. We are building a unified technology platform for the practice of law, composed of 7+ products to be released over the next 10 years.

Thoughtful product planning and product design are core tenets in our "product first" business strategy and culture.

Your Impact


As a Senior Product Designer for DISCO, you'll design compelling digital tools that are intuitive, thoughtful, delightful - and at times magical - to improve the practice of law. You will synthesize insights from users about key outcomes and workflows in partnership with other designers, product managers, and engineers. You also will iteratively refine your designs on the basis of usability testing with internal and external subject matter experts.

Designing a great user experience requires someone that is a strong communicator and facilitator to extract the best ideas. At DISCO we expect a humble yet confident approach to design.

What You'll Do
Work within an agile two-pizza team - a product manager, a designer, and engineers - executing on the delivery of crucial features.
Prototype ideas at various levels of fidelity and test them with representative users so you can iterate towards excellence.
Collaborate with other designers and developers to implement, and maintain DISCO's design system.
Communicate your designs and their underlying rationale clearly to clients and other team members through artifacts including site maps, journey maps, storyboards, and usability test reports.
Lead workshops and design sprints.
Work with engineers throughout the development process to ensure that the correct product, with all of the fine details, gets built to design specifications.
Things You Might Work On
Synthesizing and simplifying complex workflows, often involving hundreds of lawyers collaborating on millions of documents.
A visualized human communication network computed by AI.
Defining enterprise-wide analytics and dashboards that inform legal strategies and ongoing data management policies.
Who You Are
7+ years of experience in software UI design creating artifacts including low- through high-fidelity mockups, interactive prototypes, and journey maps.
5+ years of experience designing the software UI of enterprise-level B2B or B2C applications that support users who are performing complex, technical tasks.
5+ years experience as an embedded designer within cross-functional teams.
Prior experience translating your early design concepts through to released product in partnership with functions including engineering, domain/subject matter experts, and product management.
2+ years experience in planning, conducting, or participating in UX generative and evaluative research to discover user needs, define workflows and use cases, and iteratively refine prototypes. Representative research activities include contextual inquiry, semi-structured interviews, and scenario-based usability testing.
Have experience working on an Agile team consisting of product managers and engineers.
Holder of a degree or certification in design, human-computer interaction, human factors/ergonomics, software engineering, or experimental or cognitive psychology; or have equivalent experience in product design and user experience principles and methods.
Owner of an online portfolio that represents your (non-confidential) latest and greatest work including an example of a product design flow with a high level of craftsmanship.
Even Better If You
Have a balanced mix of interaction design, information architecture, visual design, usability testing, and prototyping skills.
Work independently, are a self-starter, and take proactive ownership of projects and tasks while effectively collaborating in a team environment.
Have experience using Figma.
Have experience in designing user interfaces for search.
Have experience with HTML/CSS/JavaScript or other coding frameworks.
Leverage tried and true practices, but when necessary customize or invent a new standard.
Bring a holistic end-to-end and user-centered view to problem solving, yet know how to isolate specific design issues and opportunities.
Have led or have been part of a design sprint and understand how to go wide before honing in on a solution.
Have a design super-power, we can always leverage illustration, animation, typography, hand-lettering, event speaking, etc.
Understand how to apply scientific thinking to your work, transforming business problems and user insights into designs that people find delightful and even magical.
Enjoy meeting users of your products to discover insights and refine your designs.
Demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
About DISCO


DISCO is a recognized leader in legal technology. Founded in 2012, DISCO's mission is to create great technology to modernize the practice of law. Our solutions apply artificial intelligence and cloud computing to help lawyers and legal teams improve legal outcomes for their clients. Corporate legal departments, law firms, and government agencies around the world use DISCO for ediscovery, case management, compliance, disputes, and investigations.

DISCO has raised more than $135 million in venture capital and is using this investment to apply our unique combination of world-class engineering and deep legal expertise to build products that will transform the practice of law. We have an office in London and continue to expand our presence outside the United States.

Are you ready to revolutionize the practice of law? Join us!

Why Join DISCO


We intend to build a multi-billion dollar business and think you should come along for the ride because:
We were the first movers to a cloud-based platform that has caused mass disruption within our market.
Our CEO is a true market visionary. He graduated with a computer science degree at the age of 15 and followed with a JD from Harvard Law School at the age of 19. His unparalleled insights into the fundamental issues in legal and the potential of technology and artificial intelligence to change our market at its core provide the guiding light for DISCO's long-term strategy.
We believe that product delivery professionals including product managers, product designers, and engineers differ from one another by at least a factor of 10. We believe that product delivery professionals including product managers, product designers and engineers differ from one another by at least a factor of 10. At DISCO, we only hire the top 1%. We pay them well and also include equity, which means , pay them well, and with equity, everyone has effectively been getting a raise each and every day. Given our product-focused mindset, product professionals are very much stars of the show. Given our product first mindset, product professionals are very much stars of the show. Our logo, the circle and square, represents the best lawyers and the best product professionals in the world.
We measure product delivery velocity by dollars of revenue per line of code, vs simply lines of code. We hire many more product managers and designers per engineer than most companies to drive a very thoughtful and deliberate product design and development process that ensures we are going to make money when we ship products. We hire many more product managers and designers per engineer than most companies to ensure that our engineers have a disambiguated product intent when they are building.
As a rule, we don't commit to external product delivery dates as we believe that unnecessarily constrains our creativity from both a product and technology point of view.
At DISCO respect isn't earned; it is assumed. Good humans inherently treat everyone respectfully. This is a very important concept at DISCO.
Given the high caliber of talent, the cutting-edge cloud-based technology stack, and thoughtful and novel product and design approach, you'll find yourself learning and growing at a rate you've not likely experienced in your career. Given that we only hire professionals that are passionate about their craft, you'll truly enjoy building a great software product and get in the best "career shape" of your life.
We use the "2 Pizza Team" organization design where small autonomous teams own a piece of a product or platform and ship software at rates comparable to a very lean and scrappy startup. We achieve consistency across these teams in the areas of design, product-wide use cases and technical concerns through a strategically focused set of overlay functions.
Finally, while we're an incredibly fast-growing organization, as a rule, we do not work crazy long hours. We believe in continuous product delivery, continuous product planning and design, continuous regular sleep schedules, continuous regular vacation, and continuous fun if you're passionate about your craft.
Perks of DISCO
Open, inclusive, and fun environment
Benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, as well as 401(k)
Competitive salary plus stock options
Flexible PTO
Free catered lunches every day, as well as free snacks and beverages
Opportunity to be a part of a company that is revolutionizing the legal industry
Growth opportunities throughout the company
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At MassMutual, were passionate about helping millions of people find financial freedom and this passion has driven our approach to developing highly interactive digital experiences for our customers. The Digital Experience team, part of MassMutuals Customer Experience organization, is comprised of collaborative, cross-functional, product centric groups who like to have fun, challenge each other, and are energized to create innovative solutions that exceed the changing needs of our customers.

To help us achieve our mission, we are hiring a Senior Product Designer to join our team.

What great looks like in this role

Passionate designer, always looking for the most innovative solutions that delight and surprise our target users while always keeping their needs in mind.

A great communicator that becomes a trusted partner of product managers and business stakeholders with the ability to influence the product evolution as a user advocate. Technical enough to understand limitations and reasonable trade-offs with our development teams while not antagonizing. Able to work on a 2-3 different design problems at the same time while coming up with fresh ideas without sacrificing attention to detail

Great collaborator who thrives on feedback and respectfully critiques others work. Mentors junior members.

Objectives of this role
Develop engaging design solutions for different digital products
Understand business objectives and how to balance with user needs
Work closely with digital product, technology and QA to successfully deliver new content and functionality
Daily and monthly responsibilities
Conducts competitor analysis using an established framework
Identifies select analytics to base design optimization
Develops design direction of medium size feature
Develops design direction of medium size feature
Mines existing data to develop user profiles/journeys with guidance
Develops high-level design concepts
Generates detailed designs with robust annotations
Designs for different form factors, with focus on 1-2 platforms
Contributes to pattern libraries
Use data for design decision with guidance from more experienced designers
Identifies testing needs for own design work and identifies optimal testing approach with support from in-house research team
Skills and qualifications
Minimum 4 years experience
Authorized to work in the United States with or without sponsorship
Bachelors degree is required
Exposed to a variety of design problems with deep knowledge in one type (e.g. workflow, ecommerce, account experience)
Skilled in the creation of detailed wireframes, app maps, user & feature flows, and information architecture deliverables.
People-focused design mentality. Constantly looking to hone design instinct through user feedback. Supports minimum viable product development process with rapid prototyping and iterative design techniques.
Passionate for learning new software design technologies and trends.
Ability to switch between sketching concepts, updating flows or polishing the designs that represent the big-thinking work.
Experience contributing digital pattern libraries/style guides to communicate consistent, cross-platform design.
Robust understanding of different platform design form factor
Embraces change and ambiguity as an opportunity for design to lead product development with new features and user goals.
Ability to estimate work and function independently with minimal oversight
Incorporates many elements of storytelling. Can skillfully present work and articulate why recommended approach is the desired solution
Preferred qualifications
Leads portions of workshops that support the design development process with cross-disciplinary team members and business partners
Identifies issues with technology and bring to the attention of design lead or team lead with recommended solutions
Familiar with a variety of user methods; actively participated in 2-3 of the following:
Exploratory research in the early stages of concept development to identify users needs, motivation and frustrations as well as comparable tools
Heuristic analysis of digital experiences
Concept validation to ensure design ideas are moving in the right direction with early testing
Usability testing to make sure users are able to successfully accomplish their tasks with the proposed design
A/B Testing to strategically identify optimization opportunities
Working at MassMutual

A career at MassMutual means you will work alongside exceptional people and be empowered to reach your professional and personal goals. Our employees are the foundation of what makes MassMutual a strong, stable and ethical business. We seek and value unique and varied perspectives and experiences because we believe we are stronger when all voices are heard. We invite you to bring your bright, innovative ideas to MassMutual as we continue to help millions of Americans rely on each other.

Have you ever tried to hire a plumber? How about a house cleaner? If you have, chances are it took you way longer than it should. In the era of instant-everything, it's crazy that you still have to waste an entire afternoon researching, calling and vetting local service professionals whenever you need one. The market for hiring them is huge — $1 trillion in the US alone — but the process is inefficient and largely offline.

Thumbtack is transforming this experience end-to-end, building a marketplace that matches millions of people with local pros for almost any project. In making these connections, not only do our customers get more done every day, our pros are able to grow their businesses and make a living doing what they're great at.

These customers and pros come from all walks of life and every zip code in the country. We want our team to reflect that. If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply. We challenge ourselves every day to make this a place where you can thrive just the way you are, so we can build a product that does the same for our customers and pros.

About the Design Team


We're a tight-knit team of product designers, researchers, and product writers working closely with engineers and product managers to research, explore, and iterate on well-crafted user experiences that are innovative, engaging, and delightful. We collaborate regularly through design reviews, work sessions, and presentations to inspire and influence the direction of the product and company as a whole.

About the Role


As a Product Designer, you'll work collaboratively and iteratively to turn complex problems into intuitive user experiences. You'll own projects from conception to launch and measure success through data and user research. You'll play a key role in roadmapping, feature design, and the quality of our products, and your work will impact both user and business goals.

Responsibilities
Design intuitive, human-centric flows and experiences on web, iOS, and Android
Collaborate closely with fellow designers, product managers, and engineers
Use research and qualitative data to guide design and development decisions
Analyze the success of your solutions and iterate
Contribute to the visual design of our patterns and design system
Present work and use design to build alignment and influence product direction
Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the product and executive teams
Must-Have Qualifications


If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.
4+ years of experience
Portfolio with a history of impactful projects that showcase your design process
Strong UX, interaction, and visual design skills
Human-centric approach to designing products
A bias for action and tenacious focus on how your work impacts users and the business
Strong cross-functional collaboration and communication skills
Fluency in commonly used design software and related tools (Sketch or Figma, Adobe CS, etc.)
Nice-to-Have Qualifications
Experience leading / mentoring other designers
Experience with helping set product strategy through methods like design sprints, quarterly or yearly planning, and team brainstorms
Experience setting a vision for a product experience
Experience designing for a two-sided marketplace
Prototyping skills (using Invision, HTML, CSS, Framer, Principle, etc.)
Ability to write and edit HTML, CSS and Javascript
Conceptual understanding of popular front-end frameworks like Angular and React
More About Us


Thumbtack is a local services marketplace – one of the largest in the U.S. – that helps millions of people hire local professionals. With hundreds of unique service categories, customers can find a Thumbtack pro for almost anything: landscapers, DJs, personal trainers, even piano teachers. And in making these connections, we empower local pros too. Helping them get new customers and make a living doing what they're great at.

Founded in 2008 and headquartered in San Francisco, Thumbtack is backed by over $400 million in investment from Sequoia Capital, CapitalG, Tiger Global Management, Javelin Investment Partners and Baillie Gifford.

Ascend Learning; LLC (www.ascendlearning.com) is a leading provider of technology-based educational, curriculum and assessment solutions for high-growth careers in a range of industries, including healthcare, fitness and wellness, and insurance and financial services. BoardVitals brings together content from major publishers, universities, and top healthcare professionals, creating the largest training ecosystem in medicine. As a member of the Design Team, the designer works closely with our Marketing and Product teams. The ideal candidate is a reliable Designer with a solid understanding of design principles. Additionally, you should be knowledgeable in areas that include visual design. In collaboration with the Design team, you will help guide Marketing and Product designs from ideation to finish. As a result, you are equally motivated by sharing your ideas and design decisions as you are receiving constructive feedback.

Responsibilities
Translate marketing and product requirements into simple and easy to use designs
Collaborate with Marketing on sales
Ensure the mobile and desktop experiences
Help promote UI/UX best practices and contribute to the working design style and guidelines
Communicate the value and mission of BoardVitals in design, icons, and illustration
Comfortable with consistent collaboration and feedback
Requirements
A strong portfolio of work designing across a range of digital platforms
2+ years of relevant work experience
Able to work quickly without compromising quality
Proficiency in Adobe CS software, Sketch, and other prototyping tools
Familiarity with basic HTML, CSS, and Javascript is a plus
Education& Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Communication Design, Human-Computer Interaction or related field

The Senior UX/UI Designer is a key member of our product team, producing results independently and collaboratively with a cross-functional team. S/he will own the user experience and the look/ feel across a portfolio of products. Using research, data and best practices, s/he will understand the business needs and translate these into artifacts such as mockups and prototypes to assist the team in building out working software. The Senior UX/UI Designer will ensure experiences are intuitive and engaging for users across devices and will also contribute to product road maps, drive future concepts, establish UX and UI standards and processes while managing junior designers.

Responsibilities Include:

UX/UI Leadership
Stay current with trends, best practices, and methodologies in areas of UX, information architecture, UI design
Implement user experience practices such as usability testing, user surveys and other customer feedback mechanisms
Own product engineering user experience and user interface design framework and templates
Develop assets and artifacts to support consistent and repeatable designs across portfolio of products
Familiar with developing personas and sitemaps
Product Team Member
Collaborate with a cross-functional team in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Work with product owners to understand business needs/priorities and work with engineers on interface implementation.
Solid skills and understanding of web design, user experience principles (UX/UI) and related tools.
Plan and conduct user research, competitor analysis and usability testing
Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes that can lead to intuitive user experiences.
Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelors Degree Information Technology or related field (additional experience may substitute)
7+ years of experience as a User Experience Designer, Interaction Designer, Information Architect, or similar UX-related role (additional education may substitute)
7+ years of experience creating prototypes or highly detailed wireframes for complex web applications (additional education may substitute)
An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating relevant experience

About Burns

Burns is a nationally respected provider of specialized engineering services, bringing highly-technical, sought-after engineering expertise to complex transportation and critical infrastructure projects.

Railroad& Transit Team

For more than 50 years, we have helped the rail and transit industry implement proven, time-tested and fail-safe systems. UX Designer
Ever wonder why the products you order arrive in an oversized box filled with air pillows? Packsize ensures that every product can ship in the smallest box possible. Our custom packaging solutions save time, money, and the environment.

We face interesting challenges every day, and not just with boxes! We are a technology company that understands the importance of being at the front of new and innovative technologies to solve those challenges. Our software drives measurable differences in our customers success. Our solutions are industry leading and used at both small and very large enterprises around the world.

What UX Does
UX Designer is vital to the success of our customers and our products. We are looking for a UX Designer who envisions how people experience our products and brings that vision to life in a way that feels simple, refined, and just right. Some of the complex challenges are creating software interfaces that enable human-machine interaction that is intuitive, accessible, and easy-to-use for customers all around the world.

We are looking for a UX Designer to join our cross-functional teams of Product Experience Owners, and Software Engineers who are focused on the customer experience, deciding which problems to solve and how to solve them. Our teams are relentless in pursuit of the right solution. We are open to ideas never thought possible and do not settle.

Your Experience
You have a well-defined UX process and understand UX best-practices, methodologies, and heuristics. You are comfortable defining and evangelizing the desired outcome and bringing others along. You have great attention to detail, and ask specific questions, understand nuance, and challenge conventional wisdom. You are comfortable owning the user experience and interacting with customers, C-level executives, and other stakeholders.

You care about your customers, have empathy for them, and work to both understand and solve their problems

Using user research and human-centered design to uncover customer problems and validate solutions

Use experimentation and hypothesis methods in approaching, validating, and solving user problems

Preparing for and conducting user interviews and focus groups both on-site and remotely

Analyze both qualitative and quantitative data to deliver the best user experience possible

Translate requirement documents into user flows, wireframes, prototypes and high-fidelity mockups that produce intuitive user experiences

Design experiences for operators in the warehouse space who spend (on average) 60% of their day in the product

Fine-tune user personas based upon new findings during customer interviews (both on-site and remote)

Continually be looking for ways to evolve our product to better meet the needs of our users

Maintain a pattern style guide to promote consistency across all applications.

Create icons and custom graphics as needed

Work closely with product management, sales, operations, product marketing, and the development team to ensure accurate product delivery

Inform and inspire internal and external team members and stakeholders

Present product enhancements in regional and national Sales Meetings

You continually are seeking to improve your craft

Competencies
4+ years of experience designing intuitive and beautiful digital products

Experience with and proficiency in design and prototyping software (Sketch, Invision, etc.)

Significant experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps

Design experience in the industrial space is a plus

Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript and design limitations

Strong graphic design and visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction

Experience in creating easy-to-use designs that display holistic thinking

Acute attention to detail

Physical Demands and Working Conditions
Travel outside of the office is minimal, but may be required on occasion.

Typical office working conditions.

You will own projects end-to-end–from idea conception, research, and wireframing, all the way to visual execution, marketing, and development support. Your main focus will be crafting creative, delightful, and intuitive experiences into new features and delivering those to our community–broadcasters and viewers alike. You are the voice that always puts the user first. You constantly look for ways that we can accomplish our objectives through experiences that are enjoyable and meaningful for real people.
What you'll do:
Design user interfaces and flows that demonstrate a high level of craft and thoughtfulness about the holistic product experience. Explore ideas at high-fidelity from initial concept to a series of pragmatic design deliveries. Present well-rationalized solutions, comfortably discussing pros and cons of any approach.
Own features and experiences end-to-end. Provide solutions for the ideal case, edge cases and transitional states in your work. Connect your work to product goals and look for new benefits to your solutions along the way. Be the main point of contact and guide for engineering in the path to a high quality user experience.
Develop, demonstrate and drive design principles and guidelines. Find inventive ways of solving problems while using innovations by teammates, and push your patterns to scale for other uses as well.
Dedicatedly keep product and engineering informed of design progress and solicit input throughout the journey. Our engineering and product partners provide us with information to help us make better design decisions. Actively engaging them in concept development, iteration, delivery and implementation quality is a key part of this role.
Delight the user and deliver user value. How will you balance our design principles with our company goals and find creative ways to embody them in the work?
Who you are & What you've done:
5+ years experience working directly with engineers and designers in product design roles. You demonstrate fluency with Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, or other design and prototyping tools.
A passionate designer with strong foundations. You've built outstanding consumer products in the past and possess strong visual and user interface design skills, as well as user-centered design principles.
You have an affinity for consistency, color-use, typography, and a keen eye for subtle details. You know when to push the boundaries of the interface guidelines. The details matter, and you are committed to getting it done right!
An effective communicator. You share your design thinking by stating upfront the design goals and user flows you are solving for. You convey your opinions to peers respectfully, candidly and with clear expertise.
You possess a natural tendency to take initiative and own projects. You learn through critiques, look at any problem from many angles and always seek an excellent outcome that meets constraints, needs and your high standards.
You are consistently looking to develop new skills, adopt new tools, and continuously hone your craft to stay on the cutting edge of product design.
We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Caffeine. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to better understand the needs and interests of our diverse, global community. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and are an equal opportunity employer.

Job Description

Next Century Corporation (a CACI company) is Driven by Something Deeper. We were founded in February 2002 in response to the events of September 11, 2001. Since inception our goal has been to provide the solutions which have the power to save lives, promote freedom, and improve our world in exponential ways. Over the past ten years our team has had the privilege to be part of the concept definition, architecture, and software development of a suite of tools that have revolutionized one of the IC agencies operations. We were part of the original team to start this effort. Today that team of 300+ (including our teammates) is still supporting a suite of highly integrated (deep linking) tools used by intel analysts around the world. Some tools have tens of thousands of unique users each month.

The above success and efforts are now being recreated with another of our IC customers. Once again, the Next Century team is helping to lead the early prototyping, architecture, and software development of new analogous apps to support this customers mission. Much trailblazing work needs to be done, including the development of standards (data tagging, etc.), compliance rules, and analyst-facing apps. In addition, machine learning and analytic platform development will be key.

Joining our team could be a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity giving you the opportunity to be part of reshaping the way our customers perform their mission. We will give you the opportunity to explore your talents and partake in life-long learning. Our team shares a passion in developing cutting-edge solutions that protect our nation. Our leadership team places emphasis on: the importance of balancing work and life, reaching career goals, embracing trust, honesty, fairness within the workplace, and more.

More About This Position

We are looking for a UX Designer to join our growing team of six (6) designers. You'll have the opportunity to shape products alongside other industry experts while educating others about the values of design. This role is a good fit if you're a self-starter that can execute projects end-to-end with little direction and can work well with ambiguity.

What You Will Get to Do

The UX Designer will take ownership of user research, interviews, and surveys, and translate the findings into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, mockups, and prototypes. The UX Designer will also design the overall functionality of the product and continuously iterate to ensure the best user experience.

Responsibilities:
Leading the design of products
Conducting and managing customer research and usability studies
Working directly with engineers to provide product specs and assets
Working with other designers to conceptualize and iterate on designs
Designing mockups and high-fidelity user interfaces
Conducting usability testing and gathering feedback
Developing wireframes and prototypes around customer needs
Communicating design ideas and prototypes to developers, designers, SME's and leadership
Researching conceiving, sketching, and prototyping
Following a user-centric design approach and rapidly testing and iterating
Improving the user experience related to core functionality and new features
Required Qualifications
Requires a Bachelors degree
A Minimum of 5 years of directly related experience
An active TS/SCI with Polygraph is required to being employment.
Must have a portfolio to be submitted and reviewed during the selection process
Required Skills and Experience:
Expertise in all facets of User Experience.
Experience with Adobe XD, Sketch, Photoshop, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Angular, and React.
Experience working across teams to include developers
Experience with media production, communication, and dissemination techniques and methods. This includes alternative ways to inform and entertain via written, oral, and visual media.
Experience identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models.
Experience Analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design.
Experience troubleshooting and determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it.
What We Can Offer You:
Weve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.
Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.
We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nations highest priorities.
For over 55 years, the principles of CACIs unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.

Job Title: Content Designer, Technical Learning and Development
Job Description:
Tuesday, January 14, 2020

This position will assist in all aspects of user support for the Nationwide Multi-State Licensing System & Registry (NMLS), as well as any applications or systems with which it interfaces. This position will also provide learning and development support for CSBS and SRR projects enabling organizational efficiencies and alignment. Duties include producing high-quality documentation that is appropriate for its intended audience. These audiences include state regulatory agencies, industry firms and individuals, CSBS staff and call center representatives. In this capacity, the individual will play a key role in improving the productivity of over half of a million people.

Support for the NMLS utilizes a variety of references and support materials. The Technical Content Developer will produce accurate, concise, and usable content in a variety of different types, including business processes, how-to articles, knowledge articles, overviews, online help and others. Utilizing XML-based authoring tools, the Technical Content Developer will assist in meeting the information needs of our members and staff. Active participation on operational project teams collaborating with business analysts, user working groups, system developers and business partners is critical to ensure seamless navigation support through system implementations and enhancements.

Essential Functions

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable an individual with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Other duties may be assigned to meet business needs.

Develop structured content solutions to support content requirements.

Create and edit content using XML and authoring tools, such as oXygen.

Produce technical documentation and knowledge management articles and maintain a knowledge base of accurate and approved content.

Consistently apply content development standards, style guidelines and best practices across all resources.

Develop and update process documentation.

Update intranet and internet resources as assigned.

Proofread and copyedit content for proper use of grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines; ensure quality and accuracy of documentation.

Assist with process of converting existing content into a structured content environment and maintaining effective workflows to provide manageable, consistent content.

Collaborate with staff to transfer knowledge about best practices, tools and other aspects of the structured content environment.

Assist staff in learning and mastering structured content tools, techniques and processes.

Ensure documentation development is completed per project schedules.

Coordinate information for multiple projects and implement efficient knowledge solutions.

Participates in cross-departmental teams focused on product and process improvement.

Integrate content development systems with existing technologies and adapt processes to align with them.

Maintain and enhance a content infrastructure that supports excellence in content development, re-use and searchability.

Utilize and maintain the operational framework of content management and related development tools, processes and schemas.

Proactively identify and address opportunities for continual improvement to enhance the quality, efficiency and flow of content systems and processes.

Additional Responsibilities

Contribute to the advancement of best practices across the Learning & Development team.

Develop technical writing strategies for design documentation, project input, user guides, reference materials, tutorials and online documentation.

Conduct training sessions for users as needed.

Create recorded demonstrations of system processes and functionality as needed.

Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual should possess the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed and meet the amount of education, training and/or work experience required.

Education and Experience

2-5 years’ experience producing user documentation in a software development environment preferred.

Demonstrated experience with developing specialized content using Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA) and in the use of XML authoring tools like oXygen.

Experience with publishing within a ServiceNow environment.

Strong understanding of Knowledge Management and Content Management.

Experience working in an Agile environment.

Working knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, or similar applications to render basic illustrations and screen captures for inclusion in member documentation.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Ability to work independently with some guidance, follow instructions, and update the team on progress; proactively ask questions, raise issues, and follow-up to resolve them.

Attention to detail, excellent organizational skills.

Work with vendors who are consulting and/or providing services.

Editorial skills to ensure use of correct English grammar and adherence to corporate writing/formatting/branding guidelines

Strong written and verbal English language skills (grammar, syntax, usage, and style issues).

Proficient use of common Microsoft Office applications.

Possesses strong communication skills and presents ideas and concepts effectively by email, phone, and in-person.

Builds and maintains strong relationships with key operational contacts.

Collaborates with multiple teams to support development of documentation across entire lifecycle.


Values Instilled Behaviors for Excellence

Member/ Customer Service

Capability to build and value relationships

Ability to prioritize work

Advocate and advance member's goals

Teamwork

Ability to give credit to others

Have a “pitch in” attitude

Learns from successes and setbacks

Respect/Trust

Listens and learns from others

Speaks the truth even when uncomfortable

Ability to honor the expertise of others

Collaboration

Recognizes the contributions of others

Ability to consult and communication effectively

Desires to make others successful

Ownership/Engagement

Ability to preserve through adversity

Willingness to experiment and take risks

Plans ahead and is a forward thinking individual

Leadership Competencies

Achievement Oriented Thinking

Is a solutions-oriented thinker

Has good time management skills

Manages expectations of what is achievable

Change Management

Asks questions and takes ownership for understanding why the change is happening and the risk of not changing actively

Adopts the new habits, monitors own performance and checks self against the objectives and seeks help when they don’t match

Identifies and mitigates obstacles

Self-Awareness

Asks for and openly accepts feedback

Recognizes and understands one’s moods, emotions and drives, as well as their effect on others

Leaves room for doubt – realizes there is always room to grow

Working Conditions

General office

Must be willing to travel up to 25% of the time as needed

Organizational Overview

CSBS supports the leadership role of state banking supervisors in regulating approximately 5,400 state-chartered financial institutions and other financial services providers, including mortgage lenders. Established in 1902, CSBS is the nation’s leading advocate for the state banking system. In the wake of the financial crisis, our work in strengthening the hand of bank regulators and providing vital consumer protections is even more important.

The State Regulatory Registry, a Division of the Conference of State Bank Supervisors, supports a strong state mortgage origination and banking regulatory system to ensure legitimate lending practices, provide vital consumer protections, and instill confidence in both consumers and investors in the housing market. In 2003, long before the recent financial crisis, CSBS brought together an industry-wide coalition of state mortgage regulators, lenders, brokers, and technology companies to lay the groundwork for a uniform mortgage application and nationwide repository of licensed entities. In 2008 the passage of the SAFE Act required all state licensed MLOs to meet professional requirements including pre-licensure and continuing education, as well as pass a standardized test that is now one of the largest certification tests in the country.

Qualia is a digital real estate closing technology company that provides the infrastructure to streamline the home closing experience. The company offers a suite of products that brings together homebuyers and sellers, lenders, title & escrow agents and real estate agents onto one secure shared platform. Qualia was founded in 2015 by Forbes 30 Under 30 Award recipients Nate Baker, Joel Gottsegen and Lucas Hansen. The company is backed by top investors including 8VC, Bienville Capital, Menlo Ventures and Tiger Global and currently processes 15% of all US real estate transactions. Qualia is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and has offices in Austin, TX.

At Qualia, we've been growing our design staff slowly to make sure our team stays world-class. You'll be reporting to our lead designer, who happens also to be the author of Semantic UI.

Our design team is looking for a UX Designer to work with our product and design teams on new feature design in our products.

What You'll Work On
Work with product managers to flesh out new features in our products, translating functional specs into wireframes
Use our design system to create high fidelity mockups and pixel-perfect final layouts for use in our products
Provide guidance to engineers on how to use our design system, and best practices for UI/UX design patterns
Participate in design review before product launch to help make sure everything ships beautifully
Qualifications
At least 2 years working as a Product Designer or UX Designer
Strong portfolio with examples of elegant UX design for large & complex products
Solid design chops, with a good understanding of hierarchy, negative space, UI affordances and other core UI design principles
Analytical understanding of the product impact of design, and ability to think through the implications of design decisions in complex products
Why Qualia


Our environment is designed to energize and stimulate. We want you to engage during your peak hours. As long as the work gets done, you're free to work whatever schedule suits you.

We make it as easy for our team members to create great work while enjoying a healthy work/life balance. Our benefits package takes care of employees both inside and outside of the office. Each day employees dine together, eating a delicious meal from a local vendor. Our kitchen is stocked with snacks and beverages. We offer a slew of other benefits such as company retreats into the mountains, fun monthly events, great health benefits, a new laptop, and a gorgeous work environment.

Qualia is growing fast. We're building technology that solves real world problems that affect millions of homeowners. Our team is made up of incredibly fun and bright co-workers. We set a high bar, but also value balancing hard work with ping pong, chess, and a good beer.
