Title: Assistant Designer

Reports to: Director of Design/Senior Designer/Designer

Position Summary: Weissman / Dancewear Solutions is a national Recital Costume/Dancewear catalog/web retailer and manufacturer that is experiencing rapid growth. The Assistant Designer is responsible for providing administrative assistance and organizational support to the Design Department, with a primary focus on data management and clerical duties and a secondary focus on design with mentoring. This position includes robust design training under the direction of a Design Mentor for future advancement to design positions. The Assistant Designer will be responsible for design based on skill level and department needs. This position requires close collaborative partnerships with Technical Design, Product Development, Merchandising, Sourcing, and Production.

Responsibilities: Design Team Assistance: Responsible for setting up, and maintaining product and fabric information in the Product Lifecycle Management System and other spreadsheets. Supports team members by running reports and tracking styles through the Design and Product Development departments. Assists Senior Designers and design team with special projects and daily tasks to meet design deadlines. Attends all design related meetings and assist with preparation, note taking, and organization.

Trend and Market Knowledge: Under the direction of the Trend Consultant or Director of Design, selective research projects and trend/event recaps to identify new trends, fabrics, accessories, and techniques. Attends local dance recitals and competitions to analyze current dance trends. Training and learning about the Weissman customer, brands, and competitive landscape.

Showcase Assistance: Prepares samples for Showcase by steaming garments, attaching swatches and accessories, and tracking samples through Product Lifecycle Management System. Works with product development team to ensure all deadlines are met.

Technical Skills: Creates technical flats for design team members. Fits prototypes with Design Mentor and Technical Design partners to maintain the intended design aesthetic. Fits photo samples for photo shoots after completing fit training with technical designers.

Communication: Displays a high level of communication and presentation skills. Uses sound judgement; holds self and others accountable for their commitments and conduct.

Business Analytics: Analyzes sales and assortment along with competitor’s assortments, pricing, and catalog/web presentations.

Quality: Collaboratively works with Product Development team to ensure that all products meet or exceed the customer’s needs and expectations.

Design: Based on skill set and department needs, works closely with a Design Mentor for training in illustration, flat sketching, fitting, and communicating designs that successfully translate relevant industry trends to the Weissman customer. Training on Weissman customer knowledge and competitive landscape. Beginning and learning to deliver creative concepts that have commercial appeal, meet sales and margin targets and have a satisfactory sketch selection rate, survey score, and adoption rate.

Expected Outcomes:

Financial: Assists design team members to ensure planned sales and margin goals are met.

Timelines: Meets all internal design, merchandising, purchasing and marketing deadlines as planned

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Apparel Design

0 to 2+ years of professional experience in Apparel Design

Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

Strong illustration and CAD skills, strong fashion and color design aesthetic, and highly creative

Understanding of garment construction, fit, finishes and industry resources

Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office and Adobe Creative Cloud

Strong work ethic and ability and multitask

Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative team environment; flexible and adaptable to change

Must align in value system professionally and personally with the culture of Weissman

PLEASE FORWARD ME A COPY OF YOUR ELECTRONIC PORTFOLIO. All qualified candidates must successfully complete a pre-employment background check and pre-employment drug screen.

No calls.

To apply, send your resume with cover letter to careers@weissmans.com.

We are seeking a second Product Designer to work alongside our current designer on the Data Visualization team. The products we build use visualizations to tell stories of fraud, risk, consumer preferences, and investment performance as well as inform customers on the benefits of MassMutual's insurance products.

As a product designer at MassMutual, you will be involved in product development, from brainstorming ideas to ensuring design quality. Overview/Position Summary:
Works independently and collaboratively with internal and external partners to develop interior space solutions to meet customer needs. Develops libraries of curated products and solutions informed by commercial furnishing trends and typologies. Will frequently collaborate with Sales, Coordination, and Project Management teams, as well as Design Leadership, Strategic Sourcing and Marketing. Involved in design projects and related tasks from inception to final installation.
Responsibilities:
Meet, develop and maintain a high level of customer and vendor engagement.
Curate product libraries and collections.
Partner and collaborate with Strategic Sourcing Manager and Studio West Ancillary team.
Maintain communication with and markets to Sales and Design teams.
Manage and maintain Ideas Hub.
Provide insights and guidance on ONELOOK.
Partner with Sales on engagements/workshops with customer/A&D.
Participate in RFP responses and interviews, and serve as an expert consultant on RFPs and projects.
Attend industry events.
Assist with design proposals and presentations.
Estimate budgetary hours and manage project hours and time entry.
Perform field verification and inventory.
Conduct product research and data collection.
Uncover customer challenges.
Produce complete design concepts.
Generate, organize and maintain CAD/CET files.
Draw, revise, and plot design drawings and produce space plans.
Select and specify furniture, materials, products and finishes.
Develop floor plans and installation drawings.
Develop validation packages and spreadsheets.
Contact vendors for pricing and information.
Present design concepts to customers.
Perform peer audits when necessary.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s Degree, AA degree or equivalent from a two-year college or technical school will be considered.
Must have at least 3-years’ experience in the Design field.
Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA) or National Architecture Board (NAB) accreditation preferred.
Prior experience with system furniture products a plus.
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Requires the ability to be optimistic, independent, and forward thinking.
Must be a highly creative problem solver with a drive for change.
Must believe in the ability of physical space to have a positive impact on the lives of others and possess an appreciation for Design Principles and Design Thinking Methodology.
Knowledge of state and federal building codes.
Proficient in a variety of software: AutoCAD, SketchUP, and Microsoft office. Also desired is experience with CET Designer, 20/20 CAP, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign.
Requires extreme attention to detail and the ability to work independently in a fast paced, deadline driven industry.
Must have critical and creative thinking ability.
Ability to be socially poised with an outgoing and fast thinking personality to provide exceptional customer service to internal staff and clients.
Good time management skills, ability to multi-task and take ownership for project deliverables.
Willingness to take direction and learn from others.
Ability to draw/sketch by hand.
Complex reading and writing skills, basic math skills.
Physical Requirements
Seeing, color perception, hearing/listening, clear speech, hand and finger dexterity and ability to move distances within and between warehouses/offices.
Must be able to get to project sites. Ability to stand/sit for long periods of time.
Work Environment
Regularly works alone or may work with others face to face, over the phone and through email/text.
Generally, works in an office environment with moderate noise.
Nature of work may require time spent out of the office at client locations or other One Workplace offices.
Periodically works outside and may work around moving objects, dust and dirt.
Job Status
Exempt

Senior Designer

Position Summary:

Weissman / Dancewear Solutions is a national Recital Costume/Dancewear catalog/web retailer and manufacturer that is experiencing rapid growth. The Senior Designer is responsible for the design of costumes or dancewear that is highly creative, brand relevant, and trend appropriate product for the Weissman customer. This individual demonstrates leadership, ability to problem solve, mentor, and foster a team environment. He or she protects the integrity of the brand by delivering product that fulfills the Merchandising strategies and meets the customers’ expectations in quality, design, and functionality. The Senior Designer assumes a greater leadership role with the responsibility to monitor the assortment, style and trend development plan, and fabric usage to ensure design timelines are met throughout the season. Experience and leadership of Senior Designer is at a higher level than Designer. This position requires close collaborative partnerships with Technical Design, Product Development, Merchandising, Sourcing, and Production.

Responsibilities:

Design: Under the direction of the Director of Design, utilizes the assortment plan and design documents to consistently deliver creative concepts that have commercial appeal, meet sales and margin targets and have an excellent sketch selection rate, survey score, and adoption rate. Takes into consideration fabric and trim usage and salability of all designs. Ability to create designs that translate relevant industry trends to the Weissman customer and align with product assortment.

Trend and Market Knowledge: Responsible for researching global and domestic markets to identify new trends, fabrics, accessories, and techniques; ensures product is consistent with market trends while maintaining brand integrity and business strategies. Influences the assortment with key design ideas. Travels to relevant dance events, domestic/international markets, and fabric shows. Attends local and national dance recitals and competitions to analyze current dance trends. Demonstrates an excellent knowledge of the Weissman customer, brand, and competitive landscape.

Fabric, Trim, and Color Development: Assists with the selection of raw materials and colors to be utilized in the design process. Travels and shops domestic and international markets for new fabrics, trims, color inspiration and accessories.

Technical Skills: Works with Direct Reports/Design Assistants to create technical flats of designs with accurate construction call outs. Communicates design details to Pattern Makers and Technical Designers. Fits prototypes and preproduction samples independently with assistance from Technical Design partners to maintain the design aesthetic including silhouette, fit, and styling direction.

Leadership: Manages and mentors direct reports or assigned mentees and completes performance reviews. Maintains work flow and balance throughout the design department. Completes special fit and design projects. Strong work ethic and ability to multitask. Assesses current processes and productivity and suggests enhancements. Ensures adherence to all deadlines and calendar. Creates strong cross functional partnerships with Pattern and Technical Design partners.

Communication: Displays a high level of communication and presentation skills. Ability to communicate creative vision from concept to finished product and present designs to merchants for line consideration. Uses sound judgement; holds self and others accountable for their commitments and conduct.

Business Analytics: Consistently drives sales performance by analyzing sales and assortment along with competitor’s assortments, pricing, and catalog/web presentations. Reviews planning documents and design tools to monitor design progress throughout the season.

Quality: Collaboratively works with Product Development team to ensure that all products meet or exceed the customer’s needs and expectations.

Expected Outcomes: Financial: Designs that consistently meet planned sales and margin goals.

Timelines: Meets all internal Design, Merchandising, Purchasing and Marketing deadlines as planned. Monitors work flow throughout the design department to ensure design goals are met.

Leadership: Successful introduction of new ideas, business opportunities and process efficiencies by confidently selling these ideas/processes internally while listening to and incorporating appropriate suggestions of management, peers and subordinates. Successful development and training of design team members.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Apparel Design

7 to 10+ years of professional experience in Apparel Design

A comprehensive designer skill set which includes excellent illustration and CAD skills, fashion and color design aesthetic, and ability to design highly creative concepts

Strong aesthetic related to the Weissman brands and customer base

Excellent understanding of garment construction, fit, finishes and industry resources

Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office and Adobe Creative Cloud

Prior knits experience preferred

Ability to travel to international and domestic markets

Demonstrated ability to work effectively cross-functionally and to influence ideas internally. Experience with Product Development Process; understanding how to take a design from concept through commercialization

Strong leadership skills, and ability to partner with management cross-functionally

Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative team environment; flexible and adaptable to change

Must align in value system professionally and personally with the culture of Weissman.

PLEASE FORWARD A COPY OF YOUR ELECTRONIC PORTFOLIO, detailed resume and salary requirements. All qualified candidates must successfully complete a pre-employment background check and pre-employment drug screen.

To apply, send your resume with cover letter to careers@weissmans.com.

Job Description:
POSITION OVERVIEW

A rapidly expanding, entrepreneurial technology company, Alarm.com is seeking ambitious, hard working, college graduate with strong academic qualifications, diverse interests, and proven experiences in a dynamic team environment to be a Product Designer. Alarm.com's applications improve our customers' day to day living routines, allowing them to interact with and control their homes. We are seeking individuals who have a passion to create the best user applications for both the mobile and web, and are interesting in working on applications that can directly impact the way people live and interact with their homes.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The Product Designer's primary job responsibilities will include:
Work with business and technology teams to define requirements and drive projects through the entire product lifecycle.
Develop beautiful high fidelity designs.
Advocate for the customer experience and be able to articulate the reasons for your design decisions.
Participate in measuring and assessing usability of deployed applications.
Give and solicit feedback from other members of the organization in order to continually raise our bar for quality.
Participate in "full stack" design development, from initial concept and wireframes to screen-flow diagrams, UI designs, and prototypes.
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's Degree in related field
Background in Human-Computer Interaction
Showcase an online portfolio showcasing real product design work.
3+ years of industry experience in product or interaction design.
Experience with standard industry tools like Sketch, Adobe XD and/or prototyping tools.
You're a good communicator and you can easily work within teams.
Ability to think at a high level about product strategy and vision, and you can demonstrate curiosity and real passion for design and crafting awesome experiences.
Nice to have: You can translate your designs from pixels to code, or at least have some basic coding experience.
WHY WORK FOR ALARM.COM?
Collaborate with outstanding people: We hire only the best. Our quality standards are high and our employees enjoy working alongside other high achievers.
Make an immediate impact: New employees can expect to be given responsibility for bringing new technologies to the marketplace within weeks. You are empowered to perform as soon as you join the Alarm.com team!
Gain well rounded experience: Alarm.com offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and gain a broad knowledge base across multiple areas of the business.
Work with latest technologies: As we continue to lead the industry, we require expertise across a broad spectrum of technologies including short and long-range wireless communication, video surveillance, lighting and HVAC automation, web development, and backend application development and hosting.
Focus on fun: Alarm.com places high value on our team culture. We even have a committee dedicated to hosting a stand-out holiday party, happy hours, and an annual corporate retreat.
COMPANY INFORMATION
Alarm.com, founded in 2000, is a leading technology provider of connected home services, powering over one million residential and commercial installations. Through its connected home platform, millions of people use Alarm.com to help protect and manage the things that matter most their homes, families, and small businesses. Alarm.com connects a wide range of supported devices across the internet of things to provide an integrated connected home experience through an intelligent cloud-based services platform and easy to use mobile app. Alarm.com solutions are sold exclusively through a network of licensed and authorized Dealer Partners. For more information, please visit www.alarm.com.

COMPANY BENEFITS
Alarm.com offers competitive pay and a generous benefits package starting on day one of employment including 100% paid medical for employees, a health savings account option with company contribution, waiver allowance, 401(k) with employer match, paid holidays, paid time off starting at 4 weeks and increasing with tenure and paid maternity/paternity leave. We offer a casual dress work environment, annual company retreat, grocery delivery and in suite bike racks and showers.

Alarm.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer

In connection with your application, we collect information that identifies, reasonably relates to or describes you ("Personal Information"). The categories of Personal Information that we may collect include your name, government-issued identification number(s), email address, mailing address, other contact information, emergency contact information, employment history, educational history, criminal record, and demographic information. We collect and use those categories of Personal Information about you for human resources and other business management purposes, including identifying and evaluating you as a candidate for potential or future employment or future contract positions, recordkeeping in relation to recruiting and hiring, conducting criminal background checks as permitted by law, conducting analytics, and ensuring compliance with applicable legal requirements and Company policies.

DISCO is a legal tech software company focused on improving the practice of law by automating the parts of the practice that can be automated so that great lawyers can focus on tasks that really do require human legal judgment. To date, we have substantially disrupted the legal tech market with a lawyer inspired consumer-grade interface and a cloud-enabled technology platform that offers unprecedented performance and cost savings. Our objective is to own the legal tech market and become the leader in legal as Salesforce has done in the sales technology space. We are building a unified technology platform for the practice of law, composed of 7+ products to be released over the next 10 years.

Thoughtful product planning and product design are core tenets in our "product first" business strategy and culture.

Your Impact


As a Senior UX Designer for DISCO, you'll design compelling digital tools that are intuitive, thoughtful, delightful - and at times magical - to improve the practice of law. You will synthesize insights from users about key outcomes and workflows in partnership with other designers, product managers, and engineers. You also will iteratively refine your designs on the basis of usability testing with internal and external subject matter experts.

Designing a great user experience requires someone that is a strong communicator and facilitator to extract the best ideas. At DISCO we expect a humble yet confident approach to design.

What You'll Do
Work within an agile two-pizza team - a product manager, a designer, and engineers - executing on the delivery of crucial features.
Prototype ideas at various levels of fidelity and test them with representative users so you can iterate towards excellence.
Collaborate with other designers and developers to implement, and maintain DISCO's design system.
Communicate your designs and their underlying rationale clearly to clients and other team members through artifacts including site maps, journey maps, storyboards, and usability test reports.
Lead workshops and design sprints.
Work with engineers throughout the development process to ensure that the correct product, with all of the fine details, gets built to design specifications.
Things You Might Work On
Synthesizing and simplifying complex workflows, often involving hundreds of lawyers collaborating on millions of documents.
A visualized human communication network computed by AI.
Defining enterprise-wide analytics and dashboards that inform legal strategies and ongoing data management policies.
Who You Are
7+ years of experience in software UI design creating artifacts including low- through high-fidelity mockups, interactive prototypes, and journey maps.
5+ years of experience designing the software UI of enterprise-level B2B or B2C applications that support users who are performing complex, technical tasks.
5+ years experience as an embedded designer within cross-functional teams.
Prior experience translating your early design concepts through to released product in partnership with functions including engineering, domain/subject matter experts, and product management.
2+ years experience in planning, conducting, or participating in UX generative and evaluative research to discover user needs, define workflows and use cases, and iteratively refine prototypes. Representative research activities include contextual inquiry, semi-structured interviews, and scenario-based usability testing.
Holder of a degree or certification in design, human-computer interaction, human factors/ergonomics, software engineering, or experimental or cognitive psychology; or have equivalent experience in product design and user experience principles and methods.
Owner of an online portfolio that represents your (non-confidential) latest and greatest work including an example of a product design flow with a high level of craftsmanship.
Even Better If You
Have a balanced mix of interaction design, information architecture, visual design, usability testing, and prototyping skills.
Work independently, are a self-starter, and take proactive ownership of projects and tasks while effectively collaborating in a team environment.
Have experience using Figma.
Have experience in designing user interfaces for search.
Have experience with HTML/CSS/JavaScript or other coding frameworks
Have experience working on an Agile team.
Leverage tried and true practices, but when necessary customize or invent a new standard.
Bring a holistic end-to-end and user-centered view to problem solving, yet know how to isolate specific design issues and opportunities.
Have led or have been part of a design sprint and understand how to go wide before honing in on a solution.
Have a design super-power, we can always leverage illustration, animation, typography, hand-lettering, event speaking, etc.
Understand how to apply scientific thinking to your work, transforming business problems and user insights into designs that people find delightful and even magical.
Enjoy meeting users of your products to discover insights and refine your designs.
Demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
About DISCO


DISCO is a recognized leader in legal technology. Founded in 2012, DISCO's mission is to create great technology to modernize the practice of law. Our solutions apply artificial intelligence and cloud computing to help lawyers and legal teams improve legal outcomes for their clients. Corporate legal departments, law firms, and government agencies around the world use DISCO for ediscovery, case management, compliance, disputes, and investigations.

DISCO has raised more than $135 million in venture capital and is using this investment to apply our unique combination of world-class engineering and deep legal expertise to build products that will transform the practice of law. We have an office in London and continue to expand our presence outside the United States.

Are you ready to revolutionize the practice of law? Join us!

Why Join DISCO


We intend to build a multi-billion dollar business and think you should come along for the ride because:
We were the first movers to a cloud-based platform that has caused mass disruption within our market.
Our CEO is a true market visionary. He graduated with a computer science degree at the age of 15 and followed with a JD from Harvard Law School at the age of 19. His unparalleled insights into the fundamental issues in legal and the potential of technology and artificial intelligence to change our market at its core provide the guiding light for DISCO's long-term strategy.
We believe that product delivery professionals including product managers, product designers, and engineers differ from one another by at least a factor of 10. We believe that product delivery professionals including product managers, product designers and engineers differ from one another by at least a factor of 10. At DISCO, we only hire the top 1%. We pay them well and also include equity, which means , pay them well, and with equity, everyone has effectively been getting a raise each and every day. Given our product-focused mindset, product professionals are very much stars of the show. Given our product first mindset, product professionals are very much stars of the show. Our logo, the circle and square, represents the best lawyers and the best product professionals in the world.
We measure product delivery velocity by dollars of revenue per line of code, vs simply lines of code. We hire many more product managers and designers per engineer than most companies to drive a very thoughtful and deliberate product design and development process that ensures we are going to make money when we ship products. We hire many more product managers and designers per engineer than most companies to ensure that our engineers have a disambiguated product intent when they are building.
As a rule, we don't commit to external product delivery dates as we believe that unnecessarily constrains our creativity from both a product and technology point of view.
At DISCO respect isn't earned; it is assumed. Good humans inherently treat everyone respectfully. This is a very important concept at DISCO.
Given the high caliber of talent, the cutting-edge cloud-based technology stack, and thoughtful and novel product and design approach, you'll find yourself learning and growing at a rate you've not likely experienced in your career. Given that we only hire professionals that are passionate about their craft, you'll truly enjoy building a great software product and get in the best "career shape" of your life.
We use the "2 Pizza Team" organization design where small autonomous teams own a piece of a product or platform and ship software at rates comparable to a very lean and scrappy startup. We achieve consistency across these teams in the areas of design, product-wide use cases and technical concerns through a strategically focused set of overlay functions.
Finally, while we're an incredibly fast-growing organization, as a rule, we do not work crazy long hours. We believe in continuous product delivery, continuous product planning and design, continuous regular sleep schedules, continuous regular vacation, and continuous fun if you're passionate about your craft.
Perks of DISCO
Open, inclusive, and fun environment
Benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, as well as 401(k)
Competitive salary plus stock options
Flexible PTO
Free catered lunches every day, as well as free snacks and beverages
Opportunity to be a part of a company that is revolutionizing the legal industry
Growth opportunities throughout the company
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Description:
The Interior Designer III position entails leading the interior design effort of large and small-scale projects and supervising supporting interior designers. The Interior Designer III has obtained and is maintaining their NCIDQ or Architectural certification. The designer is responsible for developing conceptual design and evolving these concepts in the detailing of interior architectural elements and selection of finish materials and furnishings; the designer will be mentoring other designers in this work. This position coordinates its work with other disciplines in the production of drawings and construction documents which fulfill the design concept, meet the client's expectations and the firm's goals of design excellence, financial viability and quality service. Collegial environment, excellent compensation and benefits package including 401k and choice of healthcare plans.

Job Duties:

Schematic Design and Design Development
Conduct / verify programming with clients (as required by project type)
Work with the project manager and the project lead designer(s) in creating interior environments which serve the client’s goals and responds to their desired spatial needs, image and aesthetic requirements
Develop code compliant designs
Develop schematic fundamental design reports
Select appropriate finish materials and furnishings
Prepare furniture budgets
Develop presentation materials including 3d renderings
Lead and participate in design presentations to the client
Participate in the projects’ in-house design review presentations
Collaborate with lighting designer to develop lighting concepts and initial fixture selection
Coordinate work with other disciplines
Supervise less experienced designers in above tasks
Construction Documents
Collaborate with the design team in articulating design principles that help govern the detailing phase of the project
Execute and enhance the design intent while preparing the construction documents
Work with architecture and the engineering disciplines to ensure a consistent development of the project towards the design concepts established in earlier phases
Develop project and furniture specifications and other technical requirements of projects
Construction Administration
Prepare submittal responses, shop drawing review and construction site visits
Prepare interiors and furniture punch lists
Work with the technical team in preparing construction phase design directives
Supervise and mentor less experienced designers in above tasks


Marketing
Assist market segment leaders and the marketing department in the preparation of design documents and presentation materials
Assist in the development of fees for proposals
Participate in interviews for potential project work
Departmental Tasks
Supervise and mentor less experienced designers
Assist in the development and maintenance of presentation and documentation standards
Participate in the quality assurance process for documentation

Job Requirements:
Bachelor of Fine Arts or Bachelor of Science in Interior Design, Interior Architecture or Architecture
10 years of experience in interior design with emphasis on a specialized area (i.e. healthcare, academics, science and technology, commercial etc.)
NCIDQ Certification
Proficient in AutoCAD, Revit Microsoft Word, Excel, Adobe Suite and 3D modeling software (Sketch up or Rhino)
Excellent conceptual skills and thorough understanding of interior architecture
Polished skills in client design visioning sessions and presentations
Complete knowledge of interior architecture detailing
Comprehensive understanding of finish materials and their application in a variety of project types
Significant experience in delegating work and mentoring less experienced interior designers

Job Description:
About Command Alkon

Command Alkon is bringing innovative technologies and systems to the concrete, asphalt and building materials industry globally. Our technology helps our customers improve the efficiency and quality of the foundation of where we live, work and play. What we do best is combine next-gen technologies with over 40 years of industry expertise. We are not a “here today; gone tomorrow” software company, we will be here for a long time and a good foundation for your career…. like concrete.


The Role

Command Alkon seeks a UX Interaction Designer to champion an intuitive, easy-to-use design of our cloud-based, Software as a Service (SaaS) software application. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, mentally demanding, Agile environment. This candidate is an exceptionally quick learner of the product domain and is adept at rapidly creating the most intuitive and best-in-class wireframe designs while working in cross-functional teams.

The candidate is a brilliant problem solver, powerful evangelist, quick study, self-starter, and excellent communicator with a passion for intuitive, easy-to-use interfaces and the ability to achieve it. The candidate possesses that rare blend of interaction design, problem solving, prototyping skills, and development understanding – a leader in your field.

The successful candidate will have ownership of the user experience, including wireframes, prototypes, and UI testing. This candidate is proficient in building robust, interactive prototypes using Axure.

From brainstorming through implementation, the successful candidate will work cross functionally with members of different product teams as well as with product management.
What You'll Be Doing
Creating intuitive, best-in-class, interactive screen designs (wireframes) using Lean UX methodology
Creating robust interactive prototypes to be used for user testing (Axure)
Defending design decisions, but knowing when to accept other ideas that may be better
Working with product management, development, and executive teams to discuss design decisions
What You'll Bring
Experience designing complex, Internet-based applications (Software as a Service is a plus)
Expert knowledge of user experience principles and a passion for intuitive design
Expert knowledge of Lean UX within an Agile process
Demonstrable fluency with Adobe XD, Axure, Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, or other industry-standard design tools
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Excellent collaborative skills and ability to work well on a team
Comfortable working in a loosely structured, fast-paced organization
Highly professional, with the ability to deliver solid work on tight schedules
Who You Are
Advanced Degree in, human factors (cognitive psychology, industrial engineering, etc.), instructional design, HCI, or equivalent
Degree is creative design or related field
JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SCSS, Bootstrap, or ReactJS knowledge a plus
Why work for Command Alkon?

Command Alkon, voted one of Birmingham’s Best Places to Work in 2016, 2017 and 2018, is the global leader for over 40 years in integrated technology solutions for the concrete and heavy building materials industry because of the committed relationship we have with our employees and our customers. Headquartered in Birmingham, Alabama, Command Alkon has over 600 employees worldwide with offices in Kansas, Ohio, Illinois, Utah, Malaysia, Brazil, Canada, England, France, India and the Netherlands.
For more information about us and our products, visit http://www.commandalkon.com.
Command Alkon strives to be an employer of choice, offering a comprehensive benefit package that includes:
- Employee Recognition Programs
- Casual dress code
- Generous family medical and dental insurance plans
- Company-paid life insurance, short term disability and long term disability insurance
- 401(k) Matching Program
- Tuition Reimbursement Program
- Free soft drinks and hot beverages
Find out more at http://www.commandalkon.com/careers/
Command Alkon is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Who We Are

We’re Unispace and we believe that everyone should work in an environment that inspires productivity, peak performance and delivers well-being. We see that positive work environments foster open, collaborative and supportive cultures populated by highly independent, motivated people. While our core business is strategizing, designing and building workplaces for some of the biggest brands in the world, we know our people are our #1 asset. We look after our people ensuring we provide rewards and recognition, career development and a focus on well-being. If that sounds like an environment that would bring out the best in you, then keep reading!

Company Industry: Technology
Opportunity: The Mom Project is helping to source candidates for the above client who is looking for a Product Designer
Commitment Level: 40 hours per week, onsite, on-site, contract through August 2020


Our Customer’s mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through their family of apps and services, they are building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together.

We are seeking a Product Designer on a contract basis to support their Social Design Team. you will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming the next great product innovation to tweaking pixels right before launch. You will help us design new ways for people to connect and share using the unique qualities of this immediate and immersive new medium.

We are looking for an experienced and talented Product Designer to conceptualize, illustrate, build and deliver innovative interaction paradigms for social experiences for our emerging products. You will be expected to independently sketch, design, prototype and execute.

What You’ll Do:
• Conceptualize and iterate on high-quality designs
• Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the product and executive teams
• Document processes and methodology
• Contribute to defining interaction patterns
• Collaborate with PMs, engineers, art team, researchers and content strategists to oversee the user experience of a product from conception until launch (and then some)
• Give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise our bar for quality

Must Haves:
• Experience crafting web or mobile interactive design prototypes
• Experience using design software like Sketch
• Excellent communication skills
• Experience designing for diverse groups of people
• A positive and collaborative attitude
• A self-motivated problem solver
*Must include a link to portfolio featuring examples of web or mobile interaction design work for consideration

Education:
Bachelor's degree in Interactive Design, UX, or a related field or experience.

Hours & Location:
M-F, 40 hours/week. This position is located onsite at our Customer’s Menlo Park location.

Job Summary

Controls Designer is responsible for providing the necessary documentation along with supporting manufacturing and testing of the controls design for a transformer based on a given set of customer requirements. Utilizing the internal specification derived from the customers’ requirements, the Control Designer creates the transformer control design for an order through the use of design standards and programs. The control design is checked, revised as necessary and released for ordering of materials and production.

PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Reviews Advance orders specifications and writes up questions to be forward to the customer.
Reviews Customers’ specifications and fills in VCE for Controls for their design.
Using the Customers specification, VCE information, and internal standards the Controls Designer creates approval drawings for the customer, shop drawings and bills of material.
Reviews and updates “AS BUILTs” drawings received from Manufacturing, and makes all updates in a timely manner. Sends note to the DE’s and the Engineering Coordinators stating the drawings are ready to print.
Troubleshoots all problems with their designs with the customer and in Operations. Keeps documentation up to date, including Cause Codes in the Nonconformance Program. Backs up other Controls Designer when they are not available.
Provides feedback weekly at Control NCR meetings to Controls Designer with respect to common errors and/or shop practices.
Tracks OCR’s for their Designs and makes corrections per schedule.
Updates TA’s to present company’s procedures and standards.
Supports projects to improve the overall design process of Controls.
Tracks all work times of designs in SAP.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
• Ability to work under minimal supervision for design questions or technical problems.
• Strong work ethic and a Team player.
• Self-motivated
• Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
• Understanding of the function of relays, circuit breakers, PLCs, panel building and other control items.
• Understanding of Microsoft Office Suite
• Working knowledge of CAD design tools
• Understanding of shop methods, industry standards and wiring procedures

The above description covers the principle functions of the job. It is not intended to be a complete listing of all the miscellaneous, incidental or substantially similar duties, which may be assigned during normal or emergency operations.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Required Education / Experience
• Associate’s Degree in Control circuits, equivalent training in the Armed Services or approved equivalent in the industry with minimum 3 years design experience. Or Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering Technology
Preferred Education / Experience
• Working knowledge in designing with E3 wiring program.

We employ approximately 1,200 people throughout the United States and operate manufacturing facilities at our headquarters location in Waukesha, WI as well as Goldsboro, NC and Dallas, TX.

ROLE SUMMARY: Our company is seeking an experienced 3D CAD/BIM Detailing professional that will be responsible for developing detailed drawings in accordance with our company's Plumbing standards. The position carries the responsibility to ensure that the work is implemented effectively within cost, schedule, and accuracy parameters. The position carries the responsibility to ensure completing accurate and coordinated shop drawings as well as assisting the plumbing department with spool drawings and material take offs form the shop drawings.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Design Standards
Works in conformity with company Plumbing Standards and detailing practices. Participates in the improvement of company's Plumbing CAD Standards and detailing practices.
Software Proficiency
Possesses a working knowledge and ability to use software platforms required to produce accurate production level drawing. Has proficiency or shows willingness and initiative to learn advanced BIM tools. Stays up to date on current and future software development to maintain proficiency.
Detailing Proficiency
Establishes drawings and document format required to complete job. Understands and complies with job specific scope and requirements. Generates concise Request For Information (RFI’s) or field questions when questions or discrepancies arise on contract drawings or specifications. Verifies that all drawings are complete to a constructible state. Consistently reviews shop drawings to insure quality and accuracy prior to distribution to the field. Verifies that all RFI’s written are followed through to construction drawings. Modifies drawings as changes occur and expedite changes to field. Creates accurate record drawings from red-lined field markups. Creates clean, usable working backgrounds.
Interdepartmental communications
Communicates with Project Supervision to determine detailing scope. Assists project staff with drawing requirements and priorities. Participates in project coordination efforts and coordinates changes into drawings.
Communication Skills
Communicates effectively and keep open lines of communication with CAD Manager and Field Team. Communicates any outstanding job or departmental issues with the CAD Manager. Participates in department meetings and communicates ideas for improvement.
Job Qualifications and Skills:
Good communication and organizational skills.
A.A. degree in design/drafting or equivalent work experience
Minimum 3-5 years work experience in commercial Plumbing.
Proficiency with software tools including, AutoCAD, Autodesk Fabrication MEP, Navisworks, Revit, MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and other related 3D detailing software tools
Demonstrates and displays honesty, integrity and personal accountability.
Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced work environment
Ability to interface with construction industry professionals with professionalism and credibility
High achievement orientation and work ethic
Problem-solving attitude
Passion for construction industry
Good judgment and common sense
Actively participates in open, honest, and effective communication with company personnel at all levels.
Demonstrates an attitude that fosters teamwork.
Demonstrates forth rightness, the ability to proceed straight ahead, and be frank and candid, with open, honest and in-depth communication – Speak freely.
Deals with issues effectively.
Demonstrates resiliency; quickly recovers from adverse issues.
Develops strong personal relationships and hold peers in our organization personally accountable for their duties and responsibilities.
Accepts change as a necessary process for successful execution of our projects.
Shows a willingness to share knowledge with others.
Always asks for help or assistance when needed.

Product Designer


The Product Designer is tasked with the primary responsibility of driving design and customer empathy for a single team, comprised of one product manager and one or more developers.

The Impact you will make
Work with product ideas from inception to delivery, performing research via analytics and customer interviews, and synthesizing those insights into clear concepts that will help your team turn the idea into a reality.
Collaborate with designers at Kajabi to continuously improve our design process, workflow, and expectation of quality.
Work closely with a cross-functional team of backend and frontend engineers to deliver on new product ideas.
Prototype ideas quickly to validate both value and usability of the ideas, refining prototype through interviewing our customers.
Partner with our Product team to define and evolve our product roadmap.
Write, share, and present what you are learning about design via our blog, books and events.
Attributes for Success
Self-Starter - ability to execute and implement change
Passion for Kajabi's mission
Critical Thinking strategic and highly analytical
Leadership easily move others to action by planning, motivating, organizing and controlling work being done
Goal Oriented naturally motivated to reach goals
Interpersonal/Communication Skills an innate ability to channel different points of view; Able to establish and maintain excellent relationships and credibility quickly; Create team atmosphere with internal staff while achieving key objectives; Excellent consulting skills as well as technical writing and public speaking
Professional provide a good balance of risk taking and judgment; Is aggressive and confident; Able to operate independently of a large staff
Bonus if you have
5+ years Product Design experience in a SaaS environment.
Experience executing a modern product discovery practice
Experience serving small business as your core customer base
Used or implemented a design system
Run and analyzed research through customer interviews

One-On-One Process

The Product Designer will meet weekly with the Chief Product Officer to catch up and discuss their role. The goal of these meetings is to identify areas where the company and individuals can improve, what areas they're needing more guidance on, and where the Kajabi leadership team can lend time or resources to help meet goals. It's also a time to discuss specific expectations and discuss any areas of concern you may have about your job or your team.

Voted one of Austin's best places to work three years in a row, ScaleFactor is on a mission to empower business owners. We believe (and are not alone) that SMBs are the backbone of the economy. Someone with the passion and skills to lend a hand at every step in the process, who can partner with engineering, product management, and other designers to help us craft an application that's a pleasure to use.

LaunchDarkly is a rapidly growing software company with a strong mission and vision carried out by a talented and diverse team of employees. Our goal is to help teams build better software, faster. You'll join a small team from companies like Atlassian, Intercom, and GitHub, and you'll have an immediate impact with our product and customers.

What you'll do:
You'll be the champion for the user. Making sure everything we build feels effortless to use and creates moments of delight
You'll own the look & feel, and user experience of our user-facing application in line with the LaunchDarkly branding
Collaborating closely with other designers, project managers, and engineers you'll rapidly build and iterate in an Agile, experiment-driven product development environment
You'll craft meaningful experiences by delivering UX, UI & IxD

3+ years experience and a solid portfolio with a history of interactive and impactful designs in top-notch products

You are passionate about the experience and equally compassionate about the user
You have excellent prototyping and design tool knowledge and know how to balance design effort, speed and quality

Interaction design
Experience with in-product marketing and delightful moment creation
Persona building and communication
Design systems
About LaunchDarkly:
LaunchDarkly is a Feature Management Platform that serves over 100 billion feature flags daily to help software teams build better software, faster. Feature flagging is an industry standard methodology of wrapping a new or risky section of code or infrastructure change with a flag. Each flag can easily be turned off independent of code deployment (aka ”dark launching”). LaunchDarkly has SDKs for all major web and mobile platforms. We are building a diverse team so that we can offer robust products and services. Our team culture is dynamic, friendly, and supportive.

Job Title: Senior Principal UX Designer - Secureworks - US Remote
Job Description:
About Secureworks

Secureworks® (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a technology-driven cybersecurity leader that protects organizations in the digitally connected world. Built on proprietary technologies and world-class threat intelligence, our applications and solutions help prevent, detect, and respond to cyber threats.  Red Cloak™ software brings advanced threat analytics to thousands of customers, and the Secureworks Counter Threat Platform™ processes over 300B threat events per day. We understand complex security environments and are passionate about simplifying security with Defense in Concert™ so that security becomes a business enabler. More than 4,000 customers across over 50 countries are protected by Secureworks, benefit from our network effect and are Collectively Smarter. Exponentially Safer.™ www.secureworks.com

We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team.

Role Overview

Secureworks is a world-class cybersecurity organization that has just launched RedCloak, a new SaaS cybersecurity platform that will enable IT professionals worldwide to monitor and secure their infrastructure. We’re building a team of elite design practitioners that will build the design vision for this next generation of cybersecurity software.

Our team is small, flexible, and powerful, so we are looking for multi-talented team members that can excel in one role and support in others. We need a Senior UX Designer to work hand-in-hand with Product Management and Engineering to plan out the design in an iterative, fast-paced Agile development environment.

To learn more about this team's work and one of our newly launched products that you support, explorehere.

Primary Responsibilities
Collaborate with User Research to plan testing efforts, interpret test results, and incorporate results into design efforts
Evangelize for the user experience throughout product, engineering, and management teams
Create documentation such as personas and journey maps that represent the users and their problems to the organization
Work with Product Management and Engineering to identify design priorities that will impact the end user experience
Lead a user-centered design process that delivers well-documented, actionable designs in a cadence that integrates with the Agile development team
Conduct user research to inform your team's priorities as well as the designs you produce
Leverage user research and collaboration with Product and Engineering to develop design documentation such as wireframes
Collaborate with Visual Designers to develop prototypes, visual designs, and interaction specs that communicate the details of your designs throughout the organization
Contribute to the ongoing refinement of our UX Design System
Work with engineers and QA to ensure our designs are implemented in the best way imaginable
Base Qualifications
Minimum of 5 years of experience as a UX designer for enterprise web applications with a strong command of design best practices
Minimum of 3 years leading meetings for diverse stakeholders with both technical and non-technical backgrounds
Minimum of 2 years working with interactive data-dense applications
Minimum of 3 years rapid proto-tying, modern wireframing, prototyping tools
Preferred Qualifications
Strong Agile project management skills including the ability to manage multiple concurrent projects
Demonstrated experience in one or more additional disciplines of UX Design such as: Information Architecture, Visual Design, Content Strategy, or Prototyping
Proficiency in Figma
Experience working within and contributing to a structured design system
Knowledge of cybersecurity

Job Description:
BigCommerce is disrupting the e-commerce industry as the SaaS leader for fast- growing, mid-market businesses. We enable our customers to build intuitive and engaging stores to support every stage of their growth.

Who is BigCommerce

BigCommerce is a US-based product company, headquartered in Austin, Texas, and has offices in San Francisco, California, Sydney, Australia and London, England.

BigCommerce is the world's leading cloud ecommerce platform for established and rapidly-growing businesses. Combining enterprise functionality, an open architecture, app ecosystem, and market-leading performance, BigCommerce enables businesses to grow online sales with 80% less cost, time and complexity than on-premise software. BigCommerce powers B2B and B2C ecommerce for more than 60,000 brands, 2,000+ mid-market businesses, 30 Fortune 1000 companies and industry-leading brands, including Assurant, Ben & Jerry's, Paul Mitchell, Skullcandy, Sony, and Toyota.

Our mission is to power unrivaled ecommerce success at every stage of our customers' growth. We equip growing businesses with the world's most effective platform for creating beautiful stores, attracting customers wherever they shop, and generating sales. Online businesses using Bigcommerce can outsell and outperform those on other platforms.

Visionary investors that back our vision and mission forward include SoftBank Capital, General Catalyst, GGV Capital, Goldman Sachs, AMEX Ventures, and Telstra.

Location: San Francisco, CA

About the role

Product designers at BigCommerce are part of the entire product development process, from concept to launch. They work closely with product managers, UX researchers, and engineers to understand the customer problem, iterate on solutions, and ship finished designs to customers.

We are looking for a product designer who can cultivate an understanding of customer problems and craft experiences that will enable our merchants and their businesses to flourish and succeed. You will develop designs for products and features that support merchandising and analytics teams, enabling our merchants to better build and optimize experiences for their own shoppers. This role offers a unique opportunity to work on products that will enhance the BigCommerce ecosystem and greatly impact our merchants' businesses, enabling them to grow and succeed.

What you'll do
Collaborate closely with product management and engineering to identify product direction, feature set and behaviors for your product area.
Cultivate an understanding of your target user problem set, competitor solutions in the market and trends in e-commerce to help effectively advocate for your design solutions.
Create flows, sketches, prototypes, wireframes, and high fidelity mockups to communicate concepts, facilitate discussion and solicit feedback among your team and stakeholders.
Execute design across the entire product lifecycle and product launches.
Work iteratively with engineering to ensure a high-quality implementation and user experience.
Represent the design team in team discussions, advocating for superior design quality and effective usability across the user experience.
Collaborate with designers across the organization to determine appropriate use of patterns and contribute to evolve them, ensuring our solutions are consistent and familiar.
Partner with product management and user research to plan and execute testing and validation of your design concepts and product rollouts.
Work collaboratively with design leadership to inform and improve processes, tooling and culture.
Lead by example - do great work and share what you've done with others at BigCommerce.
Who you are:

You are excited at the prospect of solving complex problems, and work enthusiastically to come up with elegant solutions that are familiar and promote ease of use. You have no qualms expressing your ideas in marker or mockup, to facilitate conversations with product managers, engineers and stakeholders, along with gaining understanding from your target users. You explore widely, but drive to consensus, seeking out feedback from stakeholders and users, taking it as a set of signals that present you with an opportunity to always iterate and improve your designs and the way you work.

You are:
Collaborative. You understand that solving problems for our users is a team sport.
A systems thinker. You understand how to define guidelines with both the structure and flexibility needed to make all functional areas of the product desirable and usable.
Self-driven. You have superior organizational skills, integrity and great follow through on tasks. You don't get overwhelmed easily.
Naturally curious. You have a desire to learn about technology, design, ecommerce, your users, basically anything that will make you a better designer.
Pragmatic. You appreciate the latest design trends but can easily filter out what is and isn't useful to your audience. You can look at your design solution and determine what is integral to the experience and what are 'bells and whistles'.
Motivated. You're innovative, creative and constantly looking for ways to tweak and optimize to make things better.
Fun! You're flexible, fearless, and excited to help build something awesome.
A utility player. You're willing to help out wherever needed.
Skills & Abilities:


2-4 years experience working as a product designer for a SaaS (software as a service) or other enterprise / large scale digital property
Demonstrated execution of end-to-end design process from discovery to delivery, with artifacts showcasing information architecture, user experience, and interaction design
Demonstrated excellence in delivering large-scale, integrated solutions for SaaS or complex enterprise applications
Ability to multitask, working on several projects at once with careful attention to detail.
Strong English verbal and written communication skills
Experience using analytical tools like Google Analytics, Fullstory or other event tracking tools
Experience designing and prototyping in tools like Figma
Proven experience working in an Scrum or Agile framework
Have a strong passion for (and experience in) building complex enterprise-level software
Data visualization skills are a plus
Diversity & Inclusion at BigCommerce
We have the opportunity to build not only a great business, but a great company, with soul. Our beliefs and commitment to diversity and inclusion are a central part of achieving that.

Our dedication to diversity and inclusion is grounded in two things: a moral belief in the dignity, value, and potential of every individual, and a practical belief that diverse, inclusive teams will create the best outcomes for our customers, partners, employees, and company. We welcome everyone to be a part of our journey.

Current BigCommerce Employees: Please use the internal job board to apply for openings

MetroStar Systems is looking for a Visual Designer to create modern, responsive user interfaces that inspire interaction. Job Title: Systems Designer - All Pro Integrated Systems
Job Description:
General Description: The Systems Designer is responsible for the design of integrated audio, video and lighting systems. The Systems Designer will provide technical input, suggest technical alternatives, and develop cost estimates. The Systems Designer works closely with the Salesperson and the Project Manager to ensure the project design meets client expectations and that project deadlines and budget parameters are met. The Systems Designer must maintain a comprehensive knowledge of A/V/L systems to develop technical solutions and conceptual design specifications that meet customer requirements.

This position is located in the Texas vicinity and will require some travel.

Essential Job Duties:

 Schedule meeting or phone call with Salesperson within 24 hours of task assigned
 Discuss project with Salesperson in order to understand complete scope of project
 Meet with or contact Salesperson to review expected design
 Set up initial design package in Inxsql within designated time frame
 Issue Inxsql quote within designated time frame with a “C#” account assigned to it
 Deliver Inxsql quote to Salesperson via SRC
 Once proposal is accepted, Designer must be notified with a Letter of Intent
 Once letter of Intent is received, proceed with project drawings and Technical Scope of Work documents
 Responsible for meeting with Salesperson and Customer to review and approve prints
 Send design to drafting for initial draft
 Red lines done and returned to drafting for corrections, repeat this process as needed
 Signed contract must be reviewed upon receipt
 Must have knowledge of any design issue once contract is signed and prior to prints being completed
 Responsible for completed prints being reviewed and signed off on by Design Manager, Salesperson and Project Manager if possible
 Attend on-site meeting with Customer, Salesperson and Project Manager as needed
 Designer must return prints to drafting for “prints release”
 Designer to request Project Manager to be assigned at production meeting
 Oversee the ordering of equipment after meeting with Salesperson and Project Manager
 Responsible for insuring that all designs have “APS release for Construction Drawings”
 Designer will communicate progress of project with Project Manager and Salesperson
 Participate in periodic site visits and walk-thru
 Responsible for communicating any type of quality control issues observed from walk-thru with Project Manager
 Send and receive direction from job contact via RFI’s with necessary information from Project Manager
 Coordinate with Project Manager for on-site programming and system finalization and tuning if needed
 Assist with training customer on the use of the system if needed
 Attend final walk-thru with Salesperson, Customer and Project Manager
 Responsible for reviewing American Express bill and all related project expenses weekly and communicating with Salesperson and Project Manager
 Complete as-builts and close out documents in coordination with Project Manager
 Coordinate and maintain communication with Project Manager on all phases of the project
 Must be aware of any and all change orders on the project and assist Salesperson with facilitating the changes
 Responsible for ongoing training and continuing education to keep current with A/V/L equipment, technical information and design trends
 Other duties of a similar nature and level may be assigned.

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

 Excellent customer service skills, and the ability to work effectively with diverse groups
 CTS and CTS-D certifications are desirable
 Considerable knowledge of all types of professional audio, video, and lighting equipment, controls and gear
 Strong written and oral communication skills
 Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks
 Considerable knowledge of Microsoft Office Products including Windows, Word and Excel
 Ability to plan, organize and implement to ensure projects are completed by a specific date
 Basic skill level in AutoCAD LT
Competitors: Guitar Center, Sam Ash Music, Musician's Friend

Job Description:
Job Title: Senior Graphic Designer
Department: Marketing
Reports to: Head of Global Marketing
FLSA Status: Exempt
Date: February 14, 2020
Requisition#: 20-0003
SUMMARY OF THE ROLE:
Clements Worldwide’s mission is to enable people and organizations the freedom to live and operate anywhere in the world. Our global teams work together to provide the right insurance solutions to meet the unique needs of our customers, bringing peace of mind to expatriates around the globe.

With true entrepreneurial spirit and agility, our small but growing marketing team oversees the entire Clements Worldwide global brand articulation. We continue to grow with a business model committed to customer centricity, outstanding customer service, an exceptional user experience, and a distinct brand voice. We are looking for a talented, creative rockstar who can produce high quality, engaging assets in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment.

Projects range from promotional and product marketing campaigns, branding projects, landing pages, ad units, video assets, print collateral, and more. You will be responsible for managing the daily activities and coordination of branding and presentation design projects. You’ll report to the Head of Global Marketing and work closely with a talented team of digital marketers. If you are an experienced graphic designer and have an interest in leading the development of impactful graphics for a dynamic marketing team, Clements Worldwide is the place for you!

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (includes, but not limited to):
Create visually compelling, high quality, branded marketing and advertising collateral for our digital campaigns, email campaigns, printed materials, digital advertising, package and label design, and internal communications.
Manage workload and creative projects from concept to completion, communicating with all necessary in-house teams to keep projects on schedule and meet delivery deadlines.
Provide proficiency in the development, design, and coordination of client proposals, presentations, branding, marketing, and business development design projects and materials.
Closely collaborate with other creatives and stakeholders at all levels of the company to ensure that the look and feel of the brand is consistent across all communication channels and products.
Responsible for developing and complying with firm branding guidelines, departmental procedures and standards, internal client preferences and instructions.
Bring our products to life and engage audiences through visual storytelling. Develop ideas independently and participate in brainstorming and creative concepting with a team.
Be strategically minded by executing a range of options for testing themes and positioning.
Take advantage of Clements Worldwide’s data driven environment by considering key metrics in a way that helps optimize design across channels in a clear and measurable way.
Work with the marketing and sales teams to refine our on-site experience, making it both creatively inspiring and results-driven.
Envision, design, and produce a full range of high-impact print and digital collateral to enhance readability, draw the reader into the content and distinguish Clements Worldwide in the marketplace.
Ensure accuracy and currency of published graphics; Coordinate with team members, and both internal and external clients effectively and professionally.
Manage all document formatting, including creating and utilizing Macro Enabled Templates in MS Word
REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, Marketing or related field; OR equivalent work experience.
Minimum 5 years of experience creating digital assets for web, display, mobile, print, and other mediums.
A strong design portfolio with diversity of projects within.
Experience working with teams in a professional services or large matrixed organization.
Advanced experience in multiple software packages.
REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES:
Ability to strategically interface and brainstorm with other teammates regarding the visual display of information; Ability to grasp the substance of business issues being communicated and then re-articulate visual options that enhance and clarify audience understanding.
Ability to produce large volumes of work consistently and accurately.
Exercise judgment and project management skill to balance priorities and communicate to teams to meet and exceed project deadlines and commitments.
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign, MS PowerPoint, Word, and Excel.
Willingness and ability to create elegant, designed “feel” in programs such as PPT and Word that were not written primarily as design vehicles.
Proven skills and educational training in typography, layout, composition, color theory, and information design.
Self-starter with strong work ethic and ability to manage own time and take initiative.
Professional client service manner and ability to interact with all levels of management.
Speed and agility; Ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure, developing creative design within tight deadlines.
Comfortable embedding with client service teams in ‘war room’ environments to develop and design materials in real-time.
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL ALSO HAVE:
Proposal design, development, and production experience
Ability to manage content on SharePoint.
Fluency in digital media apps
Mobile app development
UX/UI experience
TOOLS:
Microsoft Suite
Adobe Creative Suite
Adobe PDF
SharePoint
WordPress
Drupal
HubSpot
TO APPLY:
Please send a resume to hr@clements.com; include “Senior Graphic Designer" in the subject line of the email.

Posting Title
Senior Product Development Industrial Designer

05/18/2020

Job Description
The Senior Industrial Designer will be instrumental in bringing hundreds of well-designed products to market. The Senior Industrial Designer will be involved in designing and developing products under all of Harbor Freight’s internal brands in categories such as power tools, automotive, welding, generators, outdoor power equipment, and more.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Work with product experts, field testers, and industry professionals to generate concepts which fit the visual brand language of a variety of Harbor Freight’s internal brands while ensuring designs are both aesthetically-pleasing and highly functional.
Develop and refine these concepts to ensure they are manufacturable, ergonomic, high in quality, and that every detail adheres to the brand identity for which it is being designed.
Work closely with dozens of suppliers to ensure they are able to manufacture our desired designs at the level of quality we expect. This will involve working with both internal and supplier engineers to ensure internal component-stacks and mechanisms function properly with the housings and exterior components of the product being designed.
Collaborate closely with product testers, quality engineers and product experts to improve and iterate prototypes. Suppliers help us create many of our functional prototypes, but you will be directly responsible for constructing ergonomic and visual-validation prototypes using our in-house 3D printers.
Give presentations to large groups of people explaining the benefits and drawbacks of potential designs. These presentations often require the creation of presentation-specific material such as photorealistic renderings and detail shots.
Work with engineers and designers from dozens of vendors to guide them through the design of products.
Work with the Structural Packaging and Packaging Graphic Design teams to ensure that the premium products being designed are packaged in an equally premium fashion.
Regular attendance is an essential function of the job.
Scope
Supervises Staff – No
Decision Making – Yes
Travel – Up to 10%
Auto req ID
68651BR

State
CA

City
Calabasas

Requirements
Qualifications – Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Industrial Design, Product Design or a related degree.
5 years or more of work experience as an Industrial Designer (experience in tools is preferred).
A portfolio and/or website showing exceptional quality work. This should contain multiple products which have been mass-produced and should show a diverse product range and skillset. It should showcase your ability to design effectively in both 2D and 3D.
Strong 3D modeling ability, preferably in CREO Parametric or some version of Pro-Engineer.
Strong sketching ability and the ability to quickly translate ideas visually.
Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator and KeyShot.
Skills
Deep understanding in manufacturing processes and their respective benefits, drawbacks and limitations. This includes knowledge when designing for: injection-molding, co-injection-molding, insert-molding, die-casting, lost-wax-casting, forging, progressive-die-stamping, deep-draw-stamping, turning, extruding, milling and a variety of other manufacturing methods.
Highly advanced 3D CAD skills.
The ability to quickly ideate and find creative solutions to complex problems.
Strong verbal (including public speaking) and written communication skills.
Physical Demands – Environment and Work Conditions
General office environment requiring ability to:
Stand, walk, sit for extended periods of time
Speak and listen to others in person and over the phone
Use keyboard and read from computer screen and reports
Lift up to 25 lbs.
About Harbor Freight Tools
In 1977, when Harbor Freight Tools was started as a small family-owned business, we made a commitment to provide working people with great quality tools at the lowest prices. And for over 40 years, Harbor Freight Tools has done just that. From hand tools and generators, to air and power tools, from shop equipment to automotive tools, Harbor Freight offers more than 5,000 tools and accessories at quality levels that match or exceed competing brands, but at prices that are up to 80% less.

We're not your typical retailer. We're a team of high-achievers, who have a passion for excellence and continuous improvement and obsess about getting things done. We're also equally committed to doing the right thing and giving back to our community. And for us, collaboration is the golden rule. We're a 40 year-old, $4 billion company with over 30 million loyal customers and growing. If you are looking for a not so ordinary and highly rewarding career opportunity, we would love to talk with you.

Delivering Value to the Hardworking Since 1977
Competitors: The Home Depot, Lowe's, Northern Tool + Equipment
