The Principal Interaction Designer is a master craftsperson in their discipline. They dive into gnarly, ambiguous problem spaces and bring back processes, techniques, and a level of quality that exceed expectation. They can fly solo if need be but often work with other designers to lead and influence by example. The person in this role has extensive, applied experience with design methodologies with every aspect of the traditional discover, design, deliver process. This person is very comfortable collaborating with other creative design and non-design disciplines.
Why We Need This Position
As principal interaction designer, you will be a part of TEAGUE’s evolving legacy as we fuse the gap between the physical and the digital to help our clients bring innovative products and services to market. This means you are a designer with strong chops with GUI design but have experience working beyond the screen. In keeping with TEAGUE’s motto “thinking through making”, you are as quick as you are clever at simulating experiences to test hypotheses, understand the user perspective, and persuade stakeholders. Your rich experience designing for people and technology will extend, challenge, and add new dimensions to TEAGUE’s established physical design prowess. As a principal interaction designer, you will have significant influence over what interaction design means at TEAGUE at how it will meet—or better yet, exceed—our clients’ objectives.
Who We’re Looking For
You are an experienced, dynamic, tech-savvy, solution-oriented designer that is constantly looking for challenges to broaden and deepen your skill set. When you wield tools, processes, and techniques, people pay attention due to your expertise. While you are always on the lookout for new, experimental techniques, you also know when to apply best practices for a fast, optimal result. You always have strong, clearly-articulated rationale for every design decision.
In this role, you would work alongside ACD/CD’s to steer the course of projects and guide clients. On any given day, you may find yourself producing wireframes and flows at appropriate fidelity; leading design reviews with clients; planning and executing design research; informally training TEAGUE designers on advanced interaction design skills; prescribing the right kind of design process for a project; producing advanced simulations to demonstrate flow or nuanced interactions and motion; presenting new tools and processes to the studio; and documenting detailed design for communication to team, clients, and developers.
Personality-wise, you are a proactive learner, eager to expand your skill set and cultivate capabilities with auxiliary skills related to your work. You are confident in your identity as a designer and general approach to design. You’re comfortable presenting to clients—even when it was interaction design work done by other members of your team. You are an established member of the design community, passionate about your industry, and keen to grow and share your skills.
What We Just Said, Now in 4 Bullet Points (a.k.a., Essential Qualifications):
Skills and Experience: 5+ years’ related work experience and a Bachelor’s Degree in a creative discipline required. Expert knowledge of and extensive experience with usability principles, interaction design methods & artifacts, user research methods & artifacts, UI patterns, and design terminology; expert knowledge of human interface guidelines of major operating systems (iOS, Android, OS X, Windows, etc.); expert proficiency with applications for communicating and prototyping information architecture, flow, and interaction of services and interfaces (eg. Sketch, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Axure RP, Apple Keynote, etc.); deep understanding of major players and platforms in technology space; strong presentation skills; and an ability to sketch and whiteboard to communicate effectively with colleagues and clients
Passion: Being a master craftsperson that is always testing and expanding the limits of their skill set.
Role: Being an expert influence of craft with clients and in the studio, working synergistically with other team members to deliver innovative solutions to clients
Personality: Creative, driven, collaborative, inquisitive, opinionated, tech-savvy, self-motivated
DOE – Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package offered.
At TEAGUE, we value diversity. We search the globe, literally, to find and attract top talent from diverse backgrounds.
TEAGUE is an EEO/AAP employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Join our Winning team as a Product Designer

When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with like-minded people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” is taken to new heights. Everything from annual company outings, to monthly new hire happy hours and being a dog friendly work place. And don’t forget about the gear! Every day you will see CARFAXers walking around the office sporting CARFAX t-shirts, hats, backpacks and more. Are you looking to join a company you’ll be proud to show off? If so, take a detour from the daily grind and apply today!

At CARFAX we’ve been creating revolutionary products for more than 30 years. We’re looking for someone to join our team with a passion for creating a consistent, engaging, and delightful experience for our portfolio of websites and mobile app offerings. We seek an inspiring designer with proven expertise in blending user-centered design methodologies and flawless execution to create digital experiences that are intuitive and delightful to use. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, desire to be part of a dynamic creative team, this may be the perfect job for you.

As a Product Designer Designer, you will:
Collaborate side by side with product and marketing managers as well as developers across the business to design high-quality digital products and user experiences.
Use creative research methods and available data to inform design decisions and evaluate the effective of the designs.
Design high-quality, thoughtful interfaces that balance aesthetics and usability.
Use prototyping tools to demonstrate interactive designs that captivate our users.
Enjoy working with agile development teams on applications, and helping our product manager focus on realistic deliverables.
Take pride in listening, communicating, and collaborating exceptionally well.
Are familiar with possibilities and the limitations of current development approaches for web applications and native mobile applications.
Illustrate a firm grasp of the user centered design process (Strategy, Research, Design and Testing), and be able to lead the product team through the various stages when applicable.
In a given week, a Product Designer might be:
Leading a whiteboard session with the rest of the project team (product manager, developers, etc.) to brainstorm designs.
Creating user workflows or information architecture for a complex new feature.
Evaluate the usability of a proposed feature or product by testing a prototype with users.
Facilitate workshops with the product team to help evaluate which product concepts to build out.
To be considered for this role, you will need:
Have 3-5 years of experience designing mobile and web interfaces.
Have a degree, certification, or equivalent work experience showing aptitude with digital product design.
Have prior experience designing native mobile apps (iOS and Android).
Be proficient in using design tools such as the Sketch, Invision, and Adobe Creative Suite.
Have an online portfolio of UX/UI work samples you can share with us.*
*Please Note: an online portfolio is required for consideration.

TEAGUE combines technology expertise with design and a deep understanding of human behavior to deliver what’s next for our clients. The Global Design Studio (GDS) is a tight group of designers and technologists within TEAGUE’s Seattle-based HQ. We work with Fortune 500 companies, exciting startups, and everything in between to identify and realize physical and digital products and services. Our job is to push boundaries every single day.
The Interaction Designer role demands a passion for untangling complexity, identifying requirements, and designing information systems and user interfaces. This role should have a strong interest in user research, prototyping, storytelling, product strategy, and visual design.
Why We Need This Position
TEAGUE lives by the quality of our designers. Without smart, dedicated, and imaginative, creators, we’re simply not able to deliver on the wide array of spaces in which we work.
Who We’re Looking For
You are a designer looking to hone your craft by experimenting with design methods in wildly different contexts from one project to the next. You are endlessly curious about people and technology, and it’s a little scary how quickly you pick up on new ideas. Your approach to interaction design is resilient and faceted, because you understand digital screens are only one of the ways people interact with the world.
You know user research, stakeholder workshops, and your designerly intuition is how meaningful products and services are identified and reborn. You are adept at connecting the dots from research and can simultaneously entertain multiple, different potential solutions and schema. You also know when it is time to make decisions and start doing.
You believe in the power of iteration, critique, and collaboration. When faced with ambiguity, you rapidly sketch a breadth of potential solutions as a sense-making activity. You understand that communicating design—and its rationale—is just as important as the design itself, so you are building a tool belt of different techniques for visualizing potential solutions: sketching, wire-framing, storyboarding, prototyping, coding, motion graphics, data visualization, and so on.
What We Just Said, Now in 5 Bullet Points (a.k.a. Essential Qualifications)
Experience: Bachelor’s degree in a design-related major or professional experience equivalent; Master’s degree a plus; 1+ years of professional experience, including experience designing user interfaces for information products and services
Skills: Design visualization (e.g., Sketch, Illustrator, Photoshop, etc.) skills required; GUI simulation tools (e.g., Principle, Axure, InVision, etc.) required. Presentation tools (e.g., Keynote) required. Writing skills required. Video and motion tools (e.g., Premiere, AfterEffects) a plus; Programming and coding skills (e.g., HTML/CSS/JS) a plus.
Passion: Build a new and better world through expert design
Role: Wield interaction design skills to identify and realize new products and services
Personality: Driven, creative, collaborative, disciplined, self-motivated
DOE - Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package offered.
At TEAGUE, we value diversity. We search the globe, literally, to find and attract top talent from diverse backgrounds.
TEAGUE is an EEO/AA employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

About Strava

Strava is Swedish for "strive," which epitomizes who we are and what we do. We're a passionate and committed team, unified by our mission to connect athletes to what motivates them and help them find their personal best. And with billions of activity uploads from all over the world, we have a humbling and audacious vision: to be the record of the world's athletic activities and the technology that makes every effort count.

Strava builds software that makes the best part of our athletes' days even better. And just as we're deeply committed to unlocking their potential, we're dedicated to providing a world-class, inclusive workplace where our employees can grow and thrive, too. We're backed by Sequoia Capital, Madrone Partners and Jackson Square Ventures, and we're expanding in order to exceed the needs of our growing community of global athletes. Our culture reflects our community – we are continuously striving to hire and engage diverse teammates from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives because we know we are a stronger team together.

About This Role

Strava Design is looking for an experienced and passionate digital product designer who wants to help us with our mission of motivating the world to be more active. Come be a part of a team of designers passionate about creating beautiful and inspiring design experiences that help athletes train, connect, and stay motivated. As a Senior Product Designer you will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from leading discovery of the next great product innovation to tweaking fit and finish right before launch. You will be expected to utilize your full range of product, interaction and visual design skills in this role.

What You'll do
Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something useful and valuable for our millions of athletes around the world.
Design flows and interfaces that are incredibly simple, effective, and elegant.
Validate ideas and interactive prototypes with users
Contribute to user and competitive research
Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the product team.
Partner with PMs, engineers and other stakeholders to oversee the user experience of a product from conception until launch as well as versioning out additional ongoing iterations.
Give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise our bar for quality.
Produce detailed documentation of interaction models and UI specifications.
What We're Looking For
An awe-inspiring portfolio of desktop and mobile digital experiences with descriptions of your process, role, and contribution. We want to see how you think and approach problems—the rough stuff—in addition to high-fidelity finished work.
Proven experience delivering end-to-end (from inception to shipping) applications and software within a cross-functional team environment.
Ability to think at a high level about product strategy but also act–with speed and precision–to deliver the tactical pieces to realize it.
Excellent communication and visual design skills.
Experience conducting user research and validating prototypes
Experience designing for diverse groups of people highly desirable (international audiences, multi-language localization, accessibility for people with disabilities, etc).
Knack for beautiful motion design.
Bachelor's degree in Design, Visual Communications, or equivalent degree.
5+ years relevant experience in design of digital products that have been released to market.
Candidates must share a portfolio to be considered for the role. This is a full-time position at our San Francisco office.

Backed by Sequoia Capital, Madrone Partners and Jackson Square Ventures, Strava is expanding in order to exceed the needs of our growing community of global athletes. By joining our team, you will help push Strava forward in fresh, innovative ways. You will engage in interesting and challenging work that will improve the lives of our athletes every day. And in the same way that Strava is deeply committed to unlocking the potential of our athletes, we are dedicated to providing a world-class workplace where our employees can grow and thrive. Join us!

Strava is an equal opportunity employer. In keeping with the values of Strava, we make all employment decisions including hiring, evaluation, termination, promotional and training opportunities, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, physical handicap, mental disability, medical condition, disability, gender or identity or expression, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, marital status, height and/or weight.

Demonstrated attention to detail and commitment to high quality work, with a strong focus on internal/external customer satisfaction.

Industry certifications in instructional design, curriculum development, performance improvement, project management, and content specific certifications as appropriate (e.g. CPLP, CPT, PMP, etc.) preferred.
Lean, six sigma, or other process improvement methodology experience. Certification is preferred.

Commerce, Retail industry and/or supply chain experience is a strong plus.

Ideal candidates for the Architectural Sales position will have the ability to read plans, experience with shop drawings, and a background in the construction field; however, if you are organized and have experience selling products (in an office environment), we can teach the architectural functions to the right candidate. We are accepting applications for various levels of positions.

LOCATION: Santa Monica, CA
TITLE: Sr. Product Designer
REPORTS TO: VP, Product Management

As one of healthcare's most widely adopted messaging platforms, the TigerConnect product fosters communication and workflow optimization within the clinical space, uniquely modernizing care coordination among doctors, nurses, care teams, and patients. TigerConnect is seeking an exceptional Sr. Product Designer to lead product design across our web and mobile products. This experienced designer will be a key player in helping us maintain and advance the user experience we are widely recognized for.

This Sr. Designer should be a UX enthusiast and responsible for collaborating with product and engineering partners to design products that are intuitive and delightful to our customers. This individual should be an excellent communicator, have high attention to detail, and is fluent with the latest design language/guidelines. Here at TigerConnect we value creative, self-driven individuals who truly care about the work they produce and the people they work with, come join us!

What You'll Own:
Design intuitive, elegant, yet simple experiences with user personas and functional requirements in mind.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and other cross functional teams to plan and execute on designs based on team feedback, customer feedback and data driven research.
Own multiple projects at different phases from inception to completion.
Own UX and persona research and translate into actionable improvements.
Own UI/UX roadmap to continuously advance the product.
Subject matter expert on latest design language/guidelines/patterns.
Subject matter expert on latest design tools/process/system.
What You've Accomplished:
5+ years of product design experience, designing web and mobile apps (experience at a high-tech, product-driven SaaS/software company preferred)
BA/BS degree in Design or related degree/certifications.
An extensive portfolio, showcasing a foundation in user interaction, visual interface, typography, and responsive design. Please include it with your application
What You'll Bring to the Table:
Excellent written, verbal and visual communication skills to articulate concepts, feedback and rationale.
Proficiency in one or more of these tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe Suite (XD), Invision, Zeppelin, Overflow) is preferred.
Extensive knowledge of native iOS and Android design (iOS Human Interface Guidelines and Google Material Design)
Experience with user research, user needs evaluation, and developing user-driven solutions.
Familiarity with HCI (Human Centered Design) is a plus.
High level of attention to detail.
Critical problem solving skills; able to think strategically, logically, and articulate your solutions.
Who We Are:

TigerConnect is healthcare's most widely adopted communication platform uniquely modernizing care collaboration among doctors, nurses, care teams, and patients. TigerConnect is the only solution that combines a consumer-like user experience for both clinical and patient communication with serious security, privacy, and clinical workflow requirements that today's healthcare organizations demand. TigerConnect accelerates productivity, reduces costs, and improves patient outcomes.

Trusted by more than 6,000 healthcare organizations, TigerConnect maintains 99.99% verifiable uptime and processes more than 10 million messages each day.

It is recognized as a top Cyber Security Company to Know, one of the 5 Sizzling Silicon Beach Startups to Watch by Entrepreneur, Best Tech Startups in Santa Monica (2019 & 2020) and a Best Places to Work in Healthcare 5 years in a row (2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019). TigerConnect currently has over 150 employees with offices in Santa Monica, San Jose, and Shanghai.

Why We're Different:
Prime office space in the major tech ecosystems of California - Silicon Beach and Silicon Valley - each complete with a loaded fridge and tons of other perks (think rock climbing wall, food trucks, yoga, happy hours & more)
An opportunity to work closely with a proven executive team, board, and serial entrepreneurs (www.tigerconnect.com/about)
A fun environment that embraces a "work hard-play hard" culture
We have team members that love what they do and are willing to go the extra mile to help clients, support the company's rapid growth, and ultimately optimize healthcare workflows
This is a full time opportunity with a competitive salary, medical benefits, and 401K matching plan
TigerConnect is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About Route

Route is a one-click premium shopping experience for online ordering, and the only way to view all of your online orders, from any merchant, in one place. Online shoppers can insure and visually track everything they order online in one centralized app. E-commerce merchants from boutique brands to household names can add Route to their website empowering one-click solutions for their customers for shipping insurance, visual package tracking, and one-click claim handling. With offices in both Silicon Slopes, Utah (HQ) and Santa Monica, California, Route embodies a creative lifestyle partnered with innovative tech to build a one of a kind global brand.

About the Role

Route is looking for a Motion Graphics Designer to join our team and focus on crafting sophisticated animations for consumer-facing performance marketing and email campaigns. Your involvement is critical in all phases of the design process, including concept development, storyboarding, animation, graphic design, and production. Creatives will span a variety of mediums and types, including animated ads, social videos, product demos, & static assets.
You will act as both a hands-on producer and a strategic, conceptual leader on each project.
Collaborate with the Growth Team on a range of design and animation deliverables, ensuring all graphic elements and layouts follow Route's design standards.
Contribute to the creative direction of new product launches and planned marketing initiatives
Design and edit video pieces that strongly communicate product goals and concepts
Deliver high-quality assets in multiple formats depending on creative briefs.
Manage deadlines and execute creatives on-time and on-task
QA and review of final output and source files
Act as a technical/tactical resource for the creative teams
Assist and guide other Designers in their professional development; foster innovation in the Performance Design team.
Who You Are
You have an incredible eye for detail and mastery of Cinema 4D, After Effects, and Adobe CS.
You are a curious person and a strategic thinker.
You're able to quickly understand the business and identify potential creative opportunities.
You have a test-first mentality, and understand the ins and outs of A / B testing creative and doubling down on winning concepts.
You're able to work effectively with others in a collaborative team environment.
Can work independently with minimal supervision
Stay current with production tool and technology advancements
A versatile player. You add value at ground zero and 30,000 feet.
Communicator. You understand the power of storytelling.
Gritty. You understand that your experience is valuable and can blend intuition with data to explore new concepts.
What You Need
BA in Motion, Graphic Design, or a related field.
4-6 years of experience as a Motion Designer for consumer products or consumer-oriented marketing campaigns.
A reel/portfolio of commercial work demonstrating an exceptional design and narrative aesthetic produced for client-oriented projects.
Proficient in Cinema 4D, Octane, After Effects, and Adobe Creative Suite.
Experience as a motion artist with an agency or product technology company.
Exceptional portfolio, showcasing sophisticated animation, concept, strong visual design, color, layout, and typography.
Ability to generate a diverse array of designs and animations in response to a design brief.
Comfortable working in a large variety of styles.
Ability to multi-task and work effectively under pressure with careful attention to detail.
Benefits:

Route offers an array of benefits including generous salaries, stock options, 100% healthcare coverage, and an unlimited PTO policy.

Route is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We embrace diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

We are looking for a driven, inquisitive, and creative problem solver to join as Product Designer, working on Digit's mobile and web apps. You will be redesigning the way humans interact with their personal finances to help improve our users' financial lives. This role reports to the Founder/CEO, and is based in San Francisco, CA.

If you're passionate about making a meaningful difference in people's lives in partnership with a small, smart, fun, mission-driven team, we're excited to meet you.

Push the boundaries of what we deliver in terms of design quality. We care deeply about both product strategy and execution, and you will be involved in raising the standard for both.

Highly-attuned product sensibility and strong user empathy

18 weeks parental leave
Fertility benefits
Catered lunches with unlimited snacks and drinks

About Digit:
Digit automates the day-to-day work of managing money so you never even have to think about it. We want to eliminate the stress and anxiety people feel about their finances while helping them build a solid foundation for the future they're trying to achieve. Our technology combines machine learning, behavioral psychology, and natural language interaction to provide a personal assistant you can trust to work toward your goals while you spend your time and effort on what's most important in your life.

Company Description

Turnitin is a global SaaS company dedicated to ensuring the integrity of education and research and supporting the development of original thinking skills. As the academic and research landscape evolves, Turnitin stays ahead of trends through advancements in technology and deep partnerships with education leaders, institutions, and practitioners. Turnitin’s proprietary content databases — built over 20 years — provide an unparalleled repository of 1+ billion student papers, best-in-class scholarly content from top publishers in every major discipline and in dozens of languages, and 70+ billion current and archived web pages. We promote honesty, consistency, and fairness across all assignment types and subject areas so that educators can help students do their best, original work

Job Description

Turnitin is looking for a designer to help expand and grow the Gradescope assessment platform. You’ll play a key part in shaping not only the Gradescope product, but also the team’s strategy, roadmap, and how they work together. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with people from Engineering, Growth, Product Writing, Research, and more! Projects tend to start and end with our users, so you’ll also be learning from instructors, students, and admins all along the way. You’ll take all these perspectives coupled with your unique view to help bring about a product that seems to take on a life of its own.

The Gradescope platform team is a small, collaborative group that are passionate about improving assessment in higher education. We care deeply about our users and work proactively to make and keep them happy. We iterate often and wear multiple hats, always striving to deliver value for our users. We take pride in building reliable, high-quality software that provides an intuitive and delightful user experience.

Gradescope is an online assessment platform that enables instructors to grade everything in one place, including paper-based exams, online homework, and programming projects. We use cutting-edge technology and features like flexible auto graders and AI-assisted answer grouping to make grading faster and more equitable. Gradescope was founded in 2014 at UC-Berkeley and joined Turnitin via an acquisition in October 2018. Gradescope is used to grade over 1 million students’ work per year at hundreds of leading higher-ed institutions, and we’re growing quickly.

What you’ll do:
Work with the AI team to build new ways of helping scale instructors’ abilities
Collaborate closely with engineering to help build great user experiences
Learn from and partner with other Turnitin designers, researchers, and teaching staff
Actively define and scope new features across the Gradescope product
Build out design flows, prototypes, sketches, written documentation, and high-fidelity visuals to aid in communication with engineers
Improve your team’s work by receiving and giving feedback with other designers and teammates
Ultimately, you’ll be focused on what you do best and have many opportunities to grow in new directions
Who we’re looking for:
You care tremendously about hearing from users and using their feedback to help guide your work
You’re proactive in collaborating with others in addressing gaps in the user experience or internal processes
You can work well in a small, cross-functional team, and communicate effectively with different business functions.
You welcome feedback and are always looking to learn and grow.
Qualifications
2+ years of experience designing for the web or mobile platforms
Great written and verbal communication skills to communicate your decisions, process, and tradeoffs
Skilled in being able to identify small decisions that have a positive impact
Ability to comfortably coordinate multiple projects simultaneously
Additional Information

***Please include these in your application:
A link to your portfolio showing how you design for user needs and iterate on those ideas based on user feedback, engineering constraints, and stakeholder desires
Your CV or LinkedIn profile
A couple thoughts about why the Gradescope product is interesting to you
No agency submissions

Turnitin, LLC is committed to the policy that all persons have equal access to its programs, facilities and employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, creed, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital or veterans status.

Hello, World! Codecademy has helped over 45 million people from around the world upgrade their careers with engaging, accessible, and flexible education on programming and data skills. We provide over 200 hands-on interactive lessons ranging from Python to R to Javascript and everything in between. Our learners have gone on to start companies, new jobs, and new lives thanks to what they've learned with Codecademy, and we're thrilled to be working to take that impact to the next level.

Codecademy was started in 2011 by two college students in a dorm room at Columbia that were frustrated by the huge gap between education and employment. A few years later, we are a rapidly growing, diverse team of 75+ in SoHo, NYC. We've raised over $40m in venture capital funding from top investors including Union Square Ventures, Kleiner Perkins, Naspers, Y Combinator, and more.

If you want to help build a business that impacts tens of millions of people each year and helps them lead better lives, join us!

As a product designer at Codecademy, you'll be involved in the product development process from start to finish. From brainstorming entirely new features to designing usable flows and beautiful interfaces, you'll exercise your full range of product, interaction, and visual design skills on a daily basis. You'll enjoy a high level of ownership of the features you work on. You'll partner with engineering, community, and data analysis to build and iterate on various design challenges in our product. We're looking for someone who sweats the details and is ready to tackle any design challenge that comes up between concepting and launching a product. Your work will empower millions of people worldwide to learn how to code and create something. Together, we can redesign education and create the best online learning experience.

What you'll be doing
Collaborate with product, engineering, curriculum, data science, and marketing to create new features, understand their impact, and continue to elevate the learning experience at Codecademy
Partner with Product Managers to ensure we strike the perfect balance between product strategy and Learner needs in everything we ship
Utilize and contribute to on our design system, Gamut, in collaboration with engineering and design peers
Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into congruent scenarios, usable flows, and simple, intuitive interfaces
Advocate for the Learner in every part of the product you touch and be their voice within the product development process

What you'll need
A human-centered design process that produces thoughtful and engaging product design work
Excellent verbal communication skills and ability to soundly discuss design decisions
Demonstrated history of shipping complex, solutions-oriented product design work
Strong graphic design foundations mindful of typography, color usage, visual hierarchy, etc.
Maintain a Visual design point of view while being able to work within a structured product design system
Understanding of how a design would be implemented in code (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Experience performing and analyzing UX research - Proficiency with Sketch, the Adobe Suite, and prototyping tools
A passion to continually learn and help others in their educational pursuits

Nice to have
Illustration skill set
Experience designing with code
Comfortable using motion design tools both for prototyping and product assets
Experience using Abstract in your workflow

At Codecademy, we are committed to teaching people the skills they need to upgrade their careers. Codecademy aims to educate a richly diverse demographic of users with our product and in order to accomplish this, we believe our team should reflect that rich diversity. Our company celebrates diversity in all of its forms-- race, gender, color, national origin, marital status, sexuality, religion, veteran status, age, ability, disability status-- and works to create an inclusive workplace where people of all backgrounds and beliefs are empowered to better their futures.

YOUR EXPERIENCE:

Skills, Personal Attributes, and Attitudes:

Understanding of the latest technologies and platforms to produce technically achievable solutions

Experience using UX design and documentation tools including prototyping, persona creation, journey mapping tools, etc.
Organized, self-directed and comfortable working on multiple projects with tight deadlines
Strong understanding of the digital and technology landscapes. Aware of the latest trends but not dictated by them.
Good collaboration and communication skills and the ability to respond positively to shifting priorities and demands
Communicate, defend, and build consensus around UX architecture
Be detail-oriented and thorough in your approach to design
WHAT YOU’LL GAIN
At Integer, we believe a diverse organization is a successful one. We’ve created a diverse, inclusive work environment that celebrates and supports unique individuals and cultures. Job Description:
Revit MEP Designer/Engineer, GBSD, Utah (229352)

Requisition ID: 229352

Project Information:

Bechtel NS&E is on the Northrop Grumman Corp. team preparing to deliver the U.S. Ground Based Strategic Deterrent (GBSD) system of inter-continental ballistic missiles and launch infrastructure. GBSD is a vital U.S. Air Force program designed to modernize the nation’s aging force of inter-continental ballistic missiles, which make up the ground element of the nuclear deterrent. As part of the Northrop Grumman GBSD nationwide team, Bechtel will provide launch system design, construction, and integration.

A major contractor for the United States and allied governments, Bechtel has handled such efforts as chemical weapons demilitarization projects, missile-defense, infrastructure, base operations, procurement and project management, and restoration and recovery spanning half a century. We use our expertise to help our customers securely and effectively transform mission delivery.

We invite you to join our team for this very interesting opportunity!

Position Overview:

Note: This position starts in Reston, VA., then transitions to Roy, Utah. By applying to this position, you are agreeing to the location transition.

This position is for a Revit MEP Designer/Engineer who will prepare Revit 3D designs associated with DOD and USAF projects. The successful candidate must have strong organizational and teamwork skills, proven problem-solving abilities, can-do attitude, and the desire to innovate designs. This role will specifically support the USAF Ground Based Strategic Deterrent (GBSD) program Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD) phase. The GBSD program is the weapon system replacement for the Minuteman III missile systems. Our team is supporting Northrop Grumman and the USAF’s nuclear deterrence mission to modernize this ground-based leg of the nuclear triad.

Responsibilities:

This position is responsible for direct production of design work by Bechtel as well as for coordinating the scope and integration of work.

Job Responsibilities (include but not limited to):
Building layout in 3D Revit model environment (walls, elevations, doors, windows),
Modeling of piping, HVAC and equipment (MEP) in a 3D Revit model environment,
Preparation of drawings/documents for Floor plans,
Assist with coordination of 3D model activities, i.e. input, interference reconciliation, etc. with other physical related disciplines,
Interface with stress and pipe support engineers, construction, and suppliers during the preparation of designs for the purpose of model/space control, etc.,
Perform coordination review of specifications and other documents prepared by others.
Candidate should possess a knowledge of OSHA, NFPA and piping codes
Hands-on experience using Revit Architecture/MEP and drawing generation
Knowledge & application of International Building Code, ASME B31.3 for piping, plumbing codes and ASHRAE standards
Minimum Qualifications:
Hands-on experience using Revit MEP, Architectural, drawing generation, view templates, design options, and phasing
Designer - AA/AS degree or certification in an engineering curriculum or drafting/design with 6 years’ experience or in lieu of degree a high school diploma and a minimum of 10 years related experience
Engineer - BS degree in engineering with 5 years of experience
Possess active security clearance or ability to obtain security clearance.
US Citizenship required
Preferred Qualifications:
Previous Bechtel project experience
Previous DoD/DoE, USACE, NAVFAC, USAF, or NASA project experience
Shaping tomorrow together

Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Oil, Gas & Chemicals; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live.
www.bechtel.com

Job Title: Senior User Experience Designer | IoT & Hardware
Job Description:
Sonos is looking for a Senior UX designer to join our hardware UX team in Santa Barbara. In this role, you will work as a core member of the team that delivers premiere home theater experiences at Sonos, including setup and configuration experiences, on-product UI, and sound and light feedback from our home theater products and the broader Sonos experience platform. Driving and executing against the roadmap and company strategy, youll work closely with colleagues in design, research, product management, software development, user documentation and copy writing to create simple and engaging experiences from concept to final product.

About You:

You're an experienced and talented UX designer with a portfolio of engaging consumer products. You've established a track record of delivering delightful user experiences, and you're looking for a unique new challenge to refine your craft as a product designer and grow your experience at the intersection of hardware and software. You have the interest and aptitude to grasp the underlying architecture of a complex system and translate it into simple and engaging user experiences. You are experienced enough to understand the energy, adaptability and organization that you need to bring to the early stages of an ambiguous program and the relentless attention to detail needed to responsibly partner through development, product launch and beyond. You prototype, test, and refine your ideas in innovative ways and constantly engage your partners in the process. You execute with relentless attention to detail, but can also work strategically and identify long term goals. You are a system thinker, adept at making products that work cohesively across multiple platforms. Through your strong communication abilities you always ensure there is alignment across all disciplines and amongst all partners.* Work closely with cross-functional teams including design, product management, Development, test, and research to design, test, refine and document simple and compelling user experiences, ensuring alignment with the overall Sonos strategy and product or feature requirements
Go deep to understand the technical landscape of the Sonos system and identify opportunities to deliver the best experience possible.
Provide detailed design specifications for new product experiences and iterative improvements to the Sonos platform. Ensure that specifications are detailed and watertight without becoming overly complicated.
Leverage and refine the overall Sonos UX design landscape, using existing toolsets and design libraries, while continually contributing to improving how we work.
Collaborate effectively over distance, understanding and adapting to what it takes for a distributed team to be aligned and effective.
Occasional travel to other Sonos offices for key team collaborations, project kick offs, or team offsites.* You have designed and shipped digital products that are both pleasurable and easy to use
Bachelors degree in a related discipline, such as user experience design, industrial design, HCI, user interface design,graphic design
5+ years of experience in user experience design and/or user interface design, preferably in the IoT space or for experiences that sit at the intersection of hardware and software.
Deep experience working with software engineers in the Agile process and delivering the UX specification work needed for complex setup and configuration experiences
Experience and appetite to engage with the tools needed to get the job done, including Sketch, Zeplin, Abstract, Framer, Flinto, JIRA and Confluence.
Appetite for finding new ways to prototype hardware and software experiences to get at the crux of key problems, mitigate risk, and identify the best experience possible early within a program.
A current portfolio available for viewing demonstrating the detailed work needed to ship products.

Who we are

Collaborative.
Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe
what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota
is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality
solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking
for diverse, talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.

Toyota’s Information Digital Services Department
is seeking a Product
Designer to be responsible for the entire Toyota Financial Services enterprise
data architecture and development lifecycle process that translates business
requirements into functioning software systems, services and solutions aligned
to a Factory or and Digital Information Officer’s Application Portfolio or
specific portion of the application portfolio.
This role will require a strong knowledge of data life cycle and
application development, database design and systems implementation as this
role is an "enterprise data architect" crafting technical solutions
to complex business needs.

What you’ll be doing
Integrate the data and technical system
changes across the entire application portfolio
Oversee development of data and technical
changes and validate and implement the data and technical changes provided by
the vendor.
Act as liaison with the vendors, factories
and product owners and end users to create and finalize end-to-end technical solutions.
Supervise and provide guidance to factories
product designers and other domain Architects on the team
Review/approve systems
documentation as changes/enhancements that are planned to deploy to ensure
accuracy need to communicate and coordinate with key business stakeholders on
business process changes, requirements definition (e.g., BRD, FRD), testing,
end user acceptance criteria, operational readiness, and change management are
crucial responsibilities of this position
What you bring
Four-year College Degree or higher: (BA or BS) or equivalent experience
Experience as a Solution Architect and as a Software Engineer
Experience using the .Net framework, J2EE framework, and Open Source Development
Experience developing software for mobile devices using emerging technologies
Experience developing software for internet web applications and portals
Experience with performance architecture, tuning and debugging distributed systems.

The Challenge


We are a rapidly growing UX team focused on crafting innovative end-to-end designs and customer experiences for a global customer base with millions of users around the globe. Our work and vision define Qualtrics as the Experience Management company. We are looking for designers in Seattle, Provo, and Krakow to join our passionate group of builders. Our leaders and customers expect and encourage us to push the boundaries of what an enterprise product could be, envisioning across all platforms to directly impact the product roadmap and our customer's goals.

What Success Looks Like in the Role


Your product UX design vision sees 1-2 years into the future and evolves by listening to customers and ideating ground breaking solutions. You identify and surface UX issues and opportunities ensuring that they are closed out. Leading collaboration across software development, product management, and product marketing you create fluid, intuitive user experiences that scale seamlessly across desktop, mobile applications and push into paradigms such as voice.

A Day in the Life
Spend time with a customer learning from them what would make Qualitics integrate into their workflow and improve the quality of their work.
Build high fidelity wireframes of a multi-variant workflow that inspires users in a research study in how it simplifies the customer journey.
Partner with your Engineering and Product leads on a product roadmap that pushes the boundaries of what it means to be the market leading Experience Company.
Develop a new standard in how core design patterns are shared and documented ensuring that engineers around the globe can seamlessly tap into the patterns allowing them to independently build with confidence.
Attend a UX team critique - inform and support the work that is being presented by your team members and help inspire junior members of the team.
Translate data from a usability study and translate it into concrete user interface design improvements and get them prioritized into sprint planning so customers see an immediate impact.
Integrate the latest standards in interaction design and trends in user design into the product to create the most intuitive and easy to use enterprise product in the market.
Your Background


You are a customer advocate, you grow and mentor other designers, and you live to see your designs fully executed in products. You have a clear history of crafting user experiences for web and apps that inspire brand loyalty. You have a proven track record of rigorously applying user-centered design processes and methodologies to product development and are enthusiastic about solving complex user interface problems. You have experience with data visualization and a deep understanding of what it takes to build responsive web applications. From data modeling to UI transitions, design systems to pattern definition, your diverse set of skills delivers consumer quality with enterprise power.

Requirements
5+ years as an information architect, user experience or interaction designer.
Bachelor's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or related field such as Graphic Design, Industrial Design, Visual Arts, or Computer Science. Master's preferred.
Have shipped and maintained multiple products and features with an online portfolio that showcases this work and your process.
Ability to work cross functionally and influence stakeholders with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Knowledge of web accessibility principles and experience in building for accessibility.
Proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Sketch, Figma, and Invision. Abstract, Photoshop, Framer, Origami, and/or Principle are a plus.
Working knowledge of Github and Jira is highly preferred.
About Qualtrics


Qualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, manage, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 10,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure that can open many doors! If you're searching for a company that's dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!

Collective Health's mission is to transform people's healthcare experience from confusing and complicated to empowering and trustworthy. We're looking for a Product Designer to help plan, define and design various areas of our award-winning products.

You will work with a talented team of dedicated engineers and product managers in all phases of the product development process and will collaborate with design peers in our other offices. You and your team will also drive collaboration and partnership with end users - ensuring we're developing a best in class product that is both beautiful and functional.

What you'll do:
Be a steward of great product design by ensuring solutions meet our high visual and interaction design quality standards
Collaboration with engineers, product managers and other designers to ensure designs drive desired UX, business, and technical outcomes
Create innovative and creative design solutions that turn complexities into elegant, efficient user experiences
Build relationships with end users and stakeholders by listening to needs, inviting collaboration on planning and strategy development and communicating timely updates
Plan, lead and execute user research, both ethnographic and usability studies
Consistently exhibit empathy and understanding of nuanced needs of different audiences and adapts their communications as needed
Evangelize best design practices and finds opportunities to elevate confidence in our work across the larger company
Your skills include:


Portfolio demonstrating: shipment of multiple products successfully; strong skills in applying interaction design patterns to solve complex workflows; strong skills in: visual, information hierarchy, layout, composition, and typography
Experience leading product design from opportunity development, to concept, to shipment
Strong visual and verbal storytelling skills to present
Highly skilled at prototyping at multiple levels of fidelity and helps elevate prototyping skills and utilization across their team
Ability to design and document user flows and design components at a system level
Confidence in user testing tools and methodologies and ability to translate insights into actions
2-5 years professional experience designing user friendly products for web and mobile
Preferred BFA or MFA in a fields of interaction, graphic, industrial, or service design
Experience working on complex enterprise software preferred
To apply we require a strong portfolio that showcases your breadth and depth of experience. Please supply either a link or upload directly.

Associated Bank is looking for a talented Senior UX Designer
to join the rapidly growing Design team. In this role, you will have the
opportunity to work directly with other design team members on diverse
projects. Your role will initially focus on visual and interaction design on

Job
Summary
The core responsibility for this role is to distill highly complex business
processes into clean, understandable solutions, working with members of the AB
Labs team as well as our cross-functional partners, program management,
mentoring junior UX Designers, and executive sponsors to lead end-to-end
internal and external software initiatives. This role will require a candidate
to empathetically and persistently meet with users and stakeholders to gather
requirements and validate design decisions, deliver design assets and user
stories to engineering teams within tight deadlines, and communicate with
Development & QA on expectations of final solutions. Team collaboration and
buy-in are critical to success you must be able to galvanize a broad range of
opinions around a shared and common goal as well as represent the AB Labs team
in presentations to stakeholders and leadership.

Applies subject matter
knowledge to design engaging and useful applications that serve a wide
variety of digital experiences, focused on how the product feels for
end-users. Responsible for digital user experience to maximize brand

Proficiency
in design software including Sketch and Photoshop. And experience with prototyping
and wireframe creation tools such as Sketch, InVision, Axure, iRISE, etc.,
and mentors junior and new UX Designers.
Communicate
design decisions with key stakeholders while advocating for the end-user.
Strong
visual design skills and the ability to work and collaborate with other
designers.
Time
spent exploring new modern trends, tools, design patterns, design systems,
architecture, best practices and many other UX/UI related topics.
Conducts
and interprets research of end-users perceived value and usability (i.e.,

You are a highly motivated interface designer with an
appreciation for business and development. You believe in the power of design
thinking to solve real business problems that bring value to end users, and

even if you hated it, you understand the basics of component libraries and

skills and knowledge. Clark from Invision is currently staring back at you from
your inbox.

Job Description:
Current Living Spaces Employees: Please apply via your internal Workday Account.

Living Spaces is a growing home furnishing brand and we continue to open new locations. We know in order to stay current with the times and trends, we have to perpetually update our look and selection. What has truly sustained our growth — from 1 to over 20 locations, from 100 employees to over 2,000, from a humble home furnishings store to a widely recognized and respected lifestyle brand — are the talented individuals who have taken us there. We are looking for innovative, driven, and passionate professionals to join our team so we can reach even greater heights together.

We believe that a great team member experience leads to an even better guest experience. That is why we place a huge emphasis on building a great culture within our teams. Our ideal candidate will have natural talent: meaning, they possess the capacity and commitment, along with an openness to being coached around skills that will ensure they delight and exceed the expectations of our guests in all areas of Living Spaces business. We also believe in our team members taking ownership of their performance and how that contributes to the overall success of their role.

Position Summary
This position’s primary responsibility to service in-store guests with a selling strategy that follows the guidelines of our Guest Engagement Model, while emphasizing the Interior Design. Will service any influx of scheduled design appointments made in-house, through our Commercial business channels, or via appointment setting technology by analyzing collected information pertaining to the project’s requests/constraints
Position Description


Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Greet and engage guests and execute sales proficiency using Living Spaces Guest Engagement Model and supporting behaviors
Determine guests’ goals and requirements of their design project
Provide relevant design advice, product knowledge, and product recommendations
Present customized room designs, including sample fabrics, furniture, tables and accessory recommendations
Maintains current knowledge of merchandise lines; product features, benefits and availability
Master product knowledge and brand design inspiration
Processes customer transactions in the Point of Sale system
Completes required training in the expected timeframe, and participates in ongoing learning opportunities
Actively support and contribute to the store team with the goal of helping the entire team delight guests and achieve revenue targets
Ensure that the stores is “Grand Opening” ready by completing the daily task list and style guides
Ability to work weekends and most holidays
Able to work in a fast-paced environment
Qualifications


Education/Experience: Associate degree (A.A. or A.S.) or equivalent from a community college or four-year college in interior design. 1-2 years experience in a customer service, retail, or furniture store environment. Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual must have experience in Microsoft Office programs. Knowledge of design software programs is a plus.

Certificates and Licenses: Vocational certificate or degree in interior design. Must successfully complete the internal certification program at Living Spaces.

Job Description:
Make a difference

Ciber Global wants you. Come build new things with us and advance your career. At Ciber Global you'll collaborate with experts. You'll join successful teams contributing to our clients' success. You'll work side by side with our clients and have long-term opportunities to advance your career with the latest emerging technologies.

Could it be you?

Are you a UX Designer who is creative, inquisitive, thoughtful and passionate about understanding users? Do you LOVE Pittsburgh, PA?

Collaborate with an excellent team of business users to create human-centered design approaches. You'll solve problems like Sherlock Holmes and set a large baking client apart in the marketplace. Your days will be exciting as you lead projects to develop vision and strategy, execute research, prototyping, testing and carrying concepts through delivery.

What experience do you need to have?
You have 5 or more years of experience with UX Design?
You'll bring a mix of visual artistry?
You know how to make complex projects feel simple?
You love collaboration?
Yes? READ ON

Here's what the UX Designer with do...
Manage and lead feature development, contribute to early product definition.
Designing and directing UI creation, info architecture, interaction designs, visual design
Create user flows, wireframes, prototypes, high fidelity mockups, detailed UI, visual design specifications
Work to understand users. Develop/work from user profiles for task analysis, creating user scenarios and user stories
Define product direction and focus, collaborate with product managers, leadership to make hard decisions prioritization
Be a champion for user testing partnering with researchers getting solutions in front of customers.
Conduct scrappy, around-the-office user testing on your own as required
Partner with strategic product management and technical teams to support product launch and iterative improvement
Here's the experience needed to be successful in this role...
5 years user experience design, interaction design, information architect or similar role.
Must have an online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating user-centered design solutions from the ground up and UI design expertise.
Solving for multi-platform UX challenges, complex workflows, scalable, user-friendly design solutions.
A variety of design and prototype tools like Sketch, Axure, Invision, Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign (must have at least 2-3 tools)
Bachelor's Degree or Associate + experience from top design school (HCI preferred).
What will set you apart from other applicants...
Experience with user research/fieldwork.
A variety of methodologies including 1:1 interviews, moderating group conversations, facilitate ideation sessions or running live prototype sessions.
Synthesizing research findings into insights and creating design solutions.
*MSJA
At Ciber Global our consultants have access to a comprehensive benefits package. Benefits can include Paid-Time-Off, Paid Holidays, 401K matching, Life and Accidental Death Insurance, Short & Long Term Disability Insurance, and a variety of other perks.

Ciber Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Find a purpose

Embrace emerging technologies, create inventive solutions and meet intriguing client challenges. Be a part of something bigger working on teams that make a difference and transform business.

Move ahead

No matter where you are in your career, you can work to move to the next level. You'll work hand in hand with top-tier talent and be part of a team focused on the technologies that lead the way to exciting technological changes.

Full timeThe Senior UX Designer works on a core team that serves as a consulting resource for the highest-visibility business application and platform projects. This individual must have a strong foundation in user-centered design methods and the ability to communicate design decisions effectively to senior stakeholders and team members alike. Our designers are involved in all aspects of the design process from context-based research to storyboarding and presenting mockups to internal clients. Success depends on close collaboration and partnerships with end users and subject matter experts, as well as product and technology counterparts.

This individual will take ownership of a domain to envision and craft conceptual frameworks, interaction design and the overall user experience of new products and major enhancements – ensuring that it is all optimized for efficiency and clarity. Works closely with development teams, product owners and end users to synthesize our ideas and needs into user-focused designs. This individual must be able to understand constraints quickly and be able to both produce and communicate creative design solutions.

Primary Responsibilities:
Ensures effective involvement of end users in early product definition, rapid evolution of design concepts and formal evaluation and usability testing.
Conducts contextual inquiry with end users and documents findings for collaboration with internal stakeholders.
Creates storyboard and workflow documents that communicate the overarching experience of multi-step interactions.
Generates low and mid-fidelity concept mockups to solve identified user needs.
Instills a disciplined approach to developing a consistent, rational user experience.
Works with partners and stakeholders across the organization to support the development and productization of design ideas.
Supports design decisions with research, data and best practices.
Serves as a mentor and coach to less experienced designers.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements:
Proven track record of applying common User-Centered Design practices and tools to solve tough design problems.
Familiarity with Agile and Lean UX methodologies.
Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Ability to quickly and iteratively build interactive prototypes to validate designs.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, Human Factors, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred.
Minimum 5+ years of experience in web user interaction or user experience design, ideally in complex data, collaboration, workflow, and document management products for enterprise users.
Experience working on enterprise software for legal, tax, or accounting professionals a plus.
A demonstratable portfolio of work required.
Special Requirements:
Candidates may be required to pass a test for this position.

At AstraZeneca we work together across global boundaries to make an impact and find answers to challenges. We do this with the upmost integrity even in the most difficult situations because we are committed to doing the right thing. We continuously forge partnerships that help pursue world-class medicines in new ways, combining our peoples exceptional skills with those of people from all over the globe.

Product Designer

Advances in digitalization, data and advance analytics are changing industries at pace with the pharma industry showing signs of movement

The Digital Health Market will grow exponentially over the next 3 years, with new applications in digital showing in phase 3 studies significant benefits for patients including overall survival in Cancer

AstraZeneca would like to leap frog in this area and has prioritized digital in R&D as a critical strategic area of focus by 2025, as part of the overall company strategy.

Digital Health R&Ds ambition is to transform healthcare, powered by digital, science and collaborations,
to deliver the healthcare outcomes and experience that patients care about the most.

The Digital Health R&D journey incorporates 3 key stages:
Stage 1 foundational, reimagine how we work, by maximizing the use of digital, data and analytics transform processes within R&D to gain significant benefits on speed of the portfolio (goal 9 months acceleration) productivity (goal -20% reduction in cost per patient per year) quality at source, patient experience and probability of success.
Stage 2 advanced, redefine clinical trials and digital health to improve overall patient experiences and outcomes, example redefining patient populations, remote clinical trials, patient apps to reduce/manage adverse events and improve patient outcomes (OS), using data from EHMr and RWE instead of control arms, and through PROs and continuous patient monitoring, creating new end points enabling studies in earlier stages of disease (ctDNA changes) prolonging significantly patients lives
Stage 3 future-readiness, reimagine healthcare, examples, AZ as a healthcare provider beyond medicines for certain indications (example: Breast Cancer, proving monitoring, predictive analytics and therapies for improved outcomes), full integration of Multiomics (imaging, genomics, proteomics ) to better predict and significantly improve patients health
As we look to strengthen our delivery capability, we are creating a new team specifically for this journey. The Digital Therapeutics Product Designer is a key part of the foundations of our new team.

In this role you will help guide the overall design direction through sketching, collaborative team involvement, tools and processes, etc. Youll be responsible for ensuring product delivery that aligns with modern interaction and visual design principles and best practices. Youll help to facilitate dialog around needs, pain points, journeys, and key features and assist the design team in developing interaction models and conceptual frameworks of experience. As a designer, its key that you bring a sense of empathy for those youre building for and help the team to focus on the complete experience by thinking beyond individual screens to understand what people are trying to accomplish (what are the triggers, outcomes, etc.). You love designing with data, uncovering creative opportunities, and are capable of focusing on the smallest detail and levelling up to the 30,000-foot view. Its key that you know how its all connected. Its one thing to make new designs, its another to solve complex business problems tied to existing technology and systems. Here at AZ, we build solutions, not just screens and we share and keep feedback early and often. We help teams think about divergent possibilities and learn not to fall in love with our first ideas.

Ideally, this person would be located in one of our core locations: Cambridge, UK. Gothenburg, Sweden. Gaithersburg, MD. New York, NY. We will consider candidates in other locations, but we highly prefer the person to be in one of those locations.

Primary Responsibilities for this role will include (but not limited to):
Create useful, intuitive and desirable product designs (web & mobile) for the patients, partners, and/or employees of AZ.
Define the interactions for products, including things like Navigational Structures, Task Completion, Interaction Models, and Information Design
Develop Wireframes, Prototypes, Animations, and Storyboards to communicate your design
Work with Product Discovery person to create concept & usability test plans
Iterating designs based on feedback from Concept & Usability Testing
Work with Design Lead, Product Manager, Engineers, Business Analysts, and project managers as part of our internal design process to ensure successful implementation of design
Who You Are
Ability to get beneath the surface of what people say they want to truly understand what they need.
A portfolio that demonstrates your ability to empathize with your audience and leverage that empathy to create useful, intuitive and desirable solutions.
Ability to demonstrate and justify what drove your design decisions
In depth understanding & expertise of basic design principles
Expertise with at least one of the following tools: Sketch, InDesign, OmniGraffle, Illustrator or similar tool.
Views feedback as a gif
The ability to demonstrate successful web & mobile project work
Outstanding written & verbal communication
Background in Pharmaceuticals or Healthcare is big plus.
Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Essential
Minimum 3 years of experience in Product Design
Ability to get beneath the surface of what people say they want to truly understand what they need.
Extensive experience with user interface design patterns and standard UCD methodologies across multiple platforms
Exceptional design skills, production value and attention to detail
Strong experience with current design and prototyping tools (Sketch, Invision, Principle, Figma, Framer, etc)
Exceptional communication skills, including the ability to gather relevant data and information, actively listen, dialogue freely, verbalize ideas effectively, negotiate tense situations successfully, and manage and resolve conflict.
In Depth experience building global digital products and understands the nuances of developing culturally customized solutions.
A Bachelor's degree in Cognitive Psychology, Anthropology, Graphic Design, Fine Arts, Liberal Arts or related field. Equivalent work experience In lieu of degree, is acceptable.
Desirable
Experience working successfully in a highly matrixed work environment.
The ability to step back and see the big picture as well as dive in a obsess about the details.
Ability to translate complex topics in simple, non-technical terms that are meaningful to the business
Strong understanding of modern software development practices and has some technical knowledge / skills (doesnt get overwhelmed when an engineer starts talking about technical details)
