Production Designer, Brand | Creative | Events
Creative | Events is looking to add a Production Designer to their in-house team. The Brand | Creative | Events team is part of the larger Corporate Marketing department and as such supports across its 15+ products and brands. You’ll work collaboratively with other Creatives, Brand Strategists and Project Managers and work on a wide range of projects and initiatives.
Responsibilities and expectations:

Play a critical role in production, design and editing across collateral development, digital and print advertising, corporate communications and identities, social assets and trade-show deliverables
Manage multiple projects while consistently producing top quality work
Develop strong, productive relationships with designers, writers and project managers
Buy in and play an active role in promoting a culture of innovation and teamwork
Actively contribute to creating a fearless, accountable, collaborative, open and thriving environment

What an ideal fit looks like:

You’ve graduated with a Bachelor’s in Graphic Design or another relevant field
Your portfolio shows a strong foundation in graphic design and advertising
You have a strong working knowledge of the Adobe CC Suite (specifically AI, ID, PS)
You’re well versed in layout design, typography and the digital and print file production-ready process, as well as logo/identity development and photo manipulation
Possess strong design thinking skills and ability solve design problems
You’re a pro. You manage your creative time well and are used to pivoting back and forth across projects
You’re confident about establishing yourself as a production expert
You pride yourself on your killer work ethic and positive attitude
Others describe you as eager, a great communicator and good listener
You’ve got a clear understanding of overarching branding fundamentals
You have 2-4 years of professional experience in a similar role and are ready to take the next step

Brand books/guidelines experience a plus
Packaging experience a plus
Animation experience a plus
PowerPoint design experience a plus

Phenomenon is an independent company in Los Angeles. Up on the 28th floor in Miracle Mile, we're a crew of creative thinkers who enjoy getting (and solving) some of the most interesting problems out there. From partnering with brands in need of transformation to startups in need of formation, we're more than an advertising agency to our clients. We're a non-traditional partner that believes that everything is solvable. Alright, that's our elevator pitch, now about the gig:

We're currently looking for a Sr. Designer who brings bold and creative ideas, ambitious design and strategic thinking into their work everyday. Someone who can work closely with cross-functional teams of strategists, experienced innovators and writers to execute integrated design work for a roster of highly regarded clientele.

Candidates should be curious, collaborative, kind, ego-free, and obsessed with finding solutions.

Odd, Hybrid.

Your daily responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Bring brand strategies to life through various creative expressions across identity, packaging, branding, print and digital mediums.
Collaborate cross-functional teams to bring big design ideas to life.
Lead/Mentor other designers and freelancers to get projects from initial ideas to concept development to final implementation.
Present strategic creative design vision to Design Directors and Creative Directors.
Inspire agency by sharing the latest and most innovative design insights and references.
Partner with strategy to get a deep understanding of customer and customer experience.
Be articulate, confident and assertive in presenting big ideas based on design strategy and the creative brief.
Desired skills and experience:
3-5 years of hands-on design firm or ad agency experience.
Bachelor's degree in design preferred but not required.
Highly refined design sensibilities, with an awareness, understanding and interest in contemporary design trends.
High level of expertise in the Adobe Creative Suite, Google Apps, Keynote and Sketch.
Expert understanding of core disciplines of graphic design, interaction design or general knowledge of motion graphics.
Exceptional portfolio of relevant work graphic design.
Solid understanding of brand identity systems.

Baker electric has a new opportunity within the Renewables Engineering team! This is a flex role, alternating at fixed intervals between pre-sale conceptual design work and post-sale formal engineering and plan set drafting.

When supporting the sales and estimating team, you will create preliminary PV system designs and documentation based on guidance from the sales lead and/or RFP documents, primarily using Helioscope and proprietary electrical design tools. When working on projects under contract, you will create detailed PV module and balance of system equipment layouts, single line diagrams and DAS diagrams, primarily using AutoCAD and the same proprietary electrical design tools.

Baker Electric’s Renewables group focuses primarily on net metered commercial, industrial, municipal and federal solar and energy storage opportunities. Systems typically range from 30kW to 2MW in size, may be roof, carport and/or ground mounted and are in Southern California.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

While working pre-sale, you will make system design recommendations through consideration of the technical challenges associated with any given project site that are buildable, code compliant and consistent with Baker Electric’s engineering standards.
Typical pre-sale deliverables:

Preliminary PV module layouts for use in sales proposals and RFP response packages
Preliminary electrical designs, specifying equipment, feeders etc., for use by estimating
Energy production reports using Helioscope

Supporting the sales team is a fast-paced role with regularly shifting priorities, calling for an individual capable of balancing level-of-detail against the amount of time available before the work is due. The right candidate also has excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a strong ability to convey technical concepts in a concise manner to sales, estimating and prospective clients.
While working post-sale, you will generate detailed electrical and architectural drawings for permit acquisition and use during construction, per the requirements of the contract documents.
Typical post-sale activities:

Generate a 2D CAD model of existing conditions
Detailed PV module layout for coordination with racking vendors, carport subcontractors and structural engineering partners
Writing engineering subcontractor scope of work documents
Drawing single line diagrams and generating supporting NEC calculations
Coordinating the electrical drawings with the structural drawings provided by our partners
Responding to building department plan check comments
Construction support
Post construction as-builts

EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION:

Minimum one-year experience engineering commercial PV systems which have been permitted and built
Bachelor’s Degree in engineering, construction management or another technical field
Ability to quickly read and understand architectural plans and electrical diagrams
Working knowledge of current NEC, CBC, CFC and other codes pertaining to PV/ESS engineering
Minimum two years of AutoCAD experience, with an understanding of layers, line weights, transparency, dimensioning and scaling, blocks, xrefs, etc.
Experience using Helioscope or PVSyst
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, with above average capability in Microsoft Excel

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience working for a design-build contractor and/or as a construction project manager
Field experience as an installer, electrician, commissioning agent, or similar hands-on role
Basic understanding of BlueBeam for PDF markup, and Salesforce or other CRM
NABCEP certification

WORK ENVIRONMENT / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Standard office environment. Individual will frequently be required to stand, walk, sit, talk, and hear. Occasionally may have to lift boxes full of materials for purposes of setup of programs, typically 25 pounds or less. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS:

Baker Electric, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from all individuals regardless of race, religion, color, sex, pregnancy, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability or status as a Special Disabled Veteran, Vietnam Era Veteran or other qualifying veteran, political affiliation or belief. Baker Electric, Inc. is committed to building and maintaining an inclusive environment.

The information contained in the job description is for compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and is not an exhaustive list of duties performed by this position. Additional duties are performed by the individuals currently holding this position and additional duties may be assigned by the Supervisor or his/her designee.

Job: Engineering
Primary Location: United States-California-Sunnyvale-US-CA-Sunnyvale
Schedule: Full-time
Requisition ID: 200057

Description

Joining Intuitive Surgical means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority.

Description of Position:

The da Vinci system pushes the frontier of human-machine interaction by fusing many technologies into a core product experience technologies such as 3D immersive vision, real-time haptic interface and robotic manipulators. Interaction Design is a key role at Intuitive Surgical, with responsibilities that cut across multiple technical disciplines to create products that make customers experience of using technically complex surgical devices safe, easy to learn, and confidence-inspiring.
The Sr. Interaction Designer works collaboratively with engineering teams to help develop new products in the da Vinci product line, including robotic systems, instruments and accessories. Interaction designers employ a user-centered design process to develop physical and digital user interface concepts, to iterate and converge on designs that delight our users.
Roles and Responsibilities:
1. Design world class physical and digital interfaces. Maintain superior design standards and methods from brainstorming through prototyping and implementation. Ensure a thorough understanding of the problems being solved by working with human factors, clinical development, and the engineering team.
2. Participate in user research and user testing activities. In collaboration with human factors engineers, develop a strong understanding of the user through ethnography and other techniques. Participate in the validation of product usability through informal and formal testing with representative users.
3. Contribute to the visual language of the product. Collaborate with visual designers to produce beautiful and functional interfaces.
4. Contribute to design documentation, risk analysis and testing. Write user interface specifications that communicate design intent to engineering and that can be verified by testing. Consider safety risks in light of potential use errors and design mitigations for those risks.

Qualifications

Skills/Job Requirements:
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in product design (in-house, agency, or freelance)
• Preference for Bachelors or Masters degree, in Interaction Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, or an engineering discipline
• Proven record of bringing products to market that contain complex user interactions, especially products with physical interactions that are not solely web- or software-based
• Proficient in the use of current design tools and software applications, with strong experience with prototyping tools
• Possess a strong aesthetic sense and at least some artistic skill
• Passionate for delivering the best possible experience to the user
• Ability to travel up to 10% of the time
We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer.
We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

The Discord family is looking for a graphic designer with one or two hands for the creation and finalization of a large range of creative projects, which includes developing conceptual sketches to high-quality final work that resolves the communication challenge of the task. A portfolio showcasing relevant work
Solid vector illustration skills
Strong fundamental design skills, including knowledge of typography, composition, and color
Self-motivated individual with the drive to create design concepts with minimal oversight and evolving them over the course of the project, while still being able to take creative direction from managers and clients
Up to date with current design technologies and trends
Can provide multiple creative solutions to problems
Great attention to detail, while having open mind for creativity
Brand guideline creation experience a bonus
Deep understanding of sarcasm

Qualifications
4+ years of design/production experience with an ad agency or in-house design team; ideally in tech or gaming industry.
Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design (preferred)
3+ years experience with designing digital media formats using Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop. Sketch a plus.
Working knowledge in website / digital design using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS for browsers and mobile devices preferred, but not required.

Company Overview

7Summits is the leader in community-driven digital transformation solutions that empower customers, enable partners, and unleash employees. Our proven approach combines strategic consulting, user-centered experience design, and deep technical expertise to improve clients business processes through collaboration and automation.

Our Salesforce Lightning Accreditation recognizes our suite of solution accelerators, including Community Lightning Bolts and Lightning Components. These proprietary tools help clients implement high-quality solutions faster.

7Summits is a Salesforce Platinum-level Consulting Partner, a two-time recipient of Salesforce Venture funding, and is recognized by industry analysts and observers as a standout digital solutions provider.

Position Overview

Were looking for the best and brightest minds in user experience to join our growing team. Youll work on cutting edge social interactive experiences for top brands alongside some of the most passionate people in the industry.

Responsibilities
Key responsibilities this role is expected to effectively demonstrate are as follows:
Work with teams to help define strategic vision and business drivers and how to achieve them through the user experience.
Define and facilitate experience-related client workshops such as journey mapping, empathy mapping, design sprints, etc.
Establish audience empathy by conducting user research, uncovering goals, developing audience needs matrix and manifesting it in personas.
Explore and create conceptual models, flows, sitemaps, and navigation schemes.
Establish experience principles and iteratively create highly usable and engaging interactive prototypes.
Present experience concepts to clients and peers and effectively communicate the value of the solution.
Conduct variety of validation exercises to enhance the experience.
Perform heuristic and competitive analyses.
Perform industry research; uncover trends, platforms, and technologies related to user experience.
Provide UX leadership during all phases of the project life cycle.
Develop and mentor to junior team members.
Skills and Requirements
Basic skills and requirements needed to perform in this role are as follows:
Bachelor's degree required and/or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of direct experience in UX field delivering user value through amazing research, structure and interface design.
Agency experience or ability to work on multiple engagements/clients at the same time.
Deep hands-on understanding of user centered design principles including strategy, research, audience empathy, interface design and rapid prototyping, evaluation, nurture.
Advanced skill-set with interface prototyping tools for desktop and mobile (e.g. Adobe XD, Sketch, Axure, and others).
Great Portfolio of UX deliverables: case studies, flows, site maps, personas, stories, wireframes, prototypes, etc.
Impeccable attention to detail and strong analytical skills.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively to diverse audiences.
Excellent prioritization, organization, and time management skills and ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to consistently deliver projects and customer value.
Ability to work independently and handle change and shifting work priorities.
Travel requirements are in the range of 25-50%.
This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship.
Big plus if you have
Hands-on experience with Salesforce.
Experience with Service Design and Experience Mapping.
Understanding of modern social business paradigms.
Natural project leadership and consulting skills.
Competencies

7Summits is for self-starters who love what they do! We are passionate about unleashing peoples potential to create, compete and innovate in entirely new ways. Thats why youll find us relentlessly exploring, innovating, and building the best solutions for our customers.

7Summits is for communicators who are comfortable in a world where personal and professional collide. Our employees build relationships regardless of where they are located around the globe.

7Summits is for consultants who are focused on driving business value for our customers. Our employees provide expertise and deep insights that lead to business transformation.

7Summits is for creative thinkers who acknowledge that no two business problems are the same. Our employees keep an open mind and look beyond the obvious to uncover bespoke solutions.

7Summits is for collaborators who understand that everyone succeeds together. Our employees accept personal accountability for their own outcomes and help others meet their goals.

7Summits is for trailblazers who are curious and perform well amidst ambiguity. Our employees experiment, acquire new skills, and are open to making and learning from mistakes.

By applying to this position, your application is automatically considered for the range of Product Design/UX roles we have at Wayfair. If we think you might be a fit, a recruiter will reach out to learn more about your background and discuss relevant positions in more detail.

Who We Are:

Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 14 million items across home furnishings, décor, home improvement, housewares, and more.

Our Product Design/UX teams partner with Engineering, Product Management, Analytics, and business leaders across Wayfair to ensure we're building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, and measurable ways.

Our Product Design/UX organization includes a variety of teams solving interesting problems:
Storefront, our consumer-facing technology team, is tackling a wide array of fascinating, incredibly difficult problems - like helping a massive, rapidly growing global customer base efficiently find the perfect products from our catalog of >10M items (with the majority of traffic on mobile), building 2-sided marketplaces to connect consumers with interior designers and contractors, and leveraging A/R and Computer Vision to help customers visualize products in their space.
Our Supply Chain technology team ensures the right products are in stock, in the right places, at the right time, with the right cost profile to enable valuable delivery experiences for our customers, and differentiated value for our suppliers and carriers. We power availability, speed, and cost reduction across the value chain, from forecast to home delivery and post-delivery services.
Our Operations technology teams drive the development of the world-class software products that power Wayfairs transformation of retail for home. These teams create new and innovative services for customers and build the backbone of Wayfairs pricing, merchandising, and enterprise operations. Whether on desktop, mobile web, app, or any of our proprietary internal platforms, we leverage data, user-centric design, machine learning, and Agile to achieve operational excellence, fueling company growth
What Youll Do:
Collaborate with product managers, developers, content strategists, user researchers, and other designers to execute design concepts that deliver on brand goals, business goals, and are technically feasible to implement
Utilize design thinking principles to build engaging customer experiences that solve goals with elegant simplicity
Conceptualize and create pixel-perfect design mockups from sketches, wireframes, and other UX deliverable that represent your design thinking capabilities
Drive a sense of urgency in the team to deliver work, emphasizing the use of lean tools and techniques
What Youll Need:
Expertise in producing relevant deliverables including an online portfolio that demonstrates an unfailing advocacy for the user, highlighting: detailed site maps, user flows/task flows, user journeys, page flows, taxonomies/folksonomies, paths to purchase, wireframes, annotations, and prototypes that represent interaction recommendations, etc.
Strong skills in, and understanding of, modern design processes, including design tools like Sketch, Abstract, Invision, Framer, UXPin, and Creative Suite
Passion for building functional and engaging user experiences with a strong customer-centric focus
Ample experience collaborating across multiple stakeholder groups, communicating with diverse audiences, and balancing/negotiation priorities
Bachelors degree or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of professional UX experience
Interested in learning more about Wayfairs Experience Design team? Check out our Medium: https://medium.com/wayfair-design

Wayfair is one of the worlds largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, were reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If youre looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then youll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. Were a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair - and world - for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. Thats why were proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Job Description:
Forward is redesigning the way we deliver healthcare using all the technologies healthcare has neglected: sensors, mobile, and AI. We were founded in January 2016 by former executives and engineering leaders from Google and Uber. We are funded by some of the world's best investors and entrepreneurs including Founder's Fund, Khosla Ventures, First Round Capital, Eric Schmidt (Google/Alphabet Chairman), Marc Benioff (Salesforce Founder), Joe Lonsdale (Palantir Founder), Joshua Kushner (Oscar co-Founder) and Garrett Camp (Uber co-Founder).

You can read our story here and some recent press: New Yorker, TIME, USA Today, Forbes & TechCrunch.
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Work with experienced designers from places like Uber, frog, and IDEO
Use technology and great design to create novel, immersive experiences in our care clinics, on mobile, and on the web
Own entire projects that help make healthcare efficient, personalized, and delightful, while working alongside cross-functional teams of physicians, engineers, and operators
Your work will directly contribute to saving and improving people’s lives - for real :)
WHAT YOU’RE GOOD AT:
Design thinking - You’ve probably been a product designer, or you’ve worked extensively in UI, UX, and IX and are excited to put those chops to work on building the best healthcare experience available.
Product passion - From wireframes and mood boards to mobile feedback visuals and pixels in clinic exam rooms, you care about installing what you design into our users’ healthcare experiences.
Impact - You’re deeply mission-driven and you think there’s more to life than designing games or adorable photo filters. Although we concede those are cute.
Entrepreneurship - You’re a self-starter who loves to own things end-to-end. You don’t ask for permission - you’re too busy making things happen.
Building good teams - Not managing them, building them. You know how to make those around you better and feed off their energy. You take care of your teammates.
WHY JOIN FORWARD?

We don’t want to just move dollars around the healthcare industry - we want to rebuild it and fix it. All of it. You’d be a major part of the story behind one of the most ambitious startup attempts of the past decade and you’d work with a team of people who want to use their talents for good.

About Kiva

Kiva (kiva.org) is an international nonprofit with a mission to expand financial access to help underserved communities thrive. We run a global marketplace platform to crowdfund microloans for financially excluded entrepreneurs, farmers and students around the world. Our organization combines the culture and technological passion of an internet start-up with the compassion and empathy of a non-profit to create impact and opportunity at global scale. Since 2005, we have raised more than $1.4 billion in loan capital for 3.6 million borrowers in 95 countries. Our lenders fund over $13 million in loans every month. With offices in San Francisco, Portland, New York, Nairobi, and Bangkok, Kiva's team includes 100+ employees and 400+ volunteers worldwide. Our team is growing as we pursue exciting new opportunities to create a financially inclusive world.

Role overview:

At Kiva, we're broadening our focus and building new products that will create economic opportunity and enable agency and choice through financial inclusion across the globe. As a Senior Product Designer you will be a key member of Kiva's Design Team.

Reporting to the Head of Design, you will incubate and grow our existing Kiva initiatives, such as Kiva.org, the Kiva Android and iOS apps, and Protocol. Your work at Kiva will enable people across the world to do good and help each other. This role requires a high level of collaboration with our Engineering, Product, and Growth Marketing teams. We're looking for curious, thoughtful, collaborative people who want to live their values.

This is a full-time position that can be remote or located in San Francisco at our new HQ.

Key responsibilities include:
Partner with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to design user experiences from conception to launch
Create innovative experiences by delivering UX solutions, designs, and specifications
Engage with Kiva users, plan and execute research studies, and leverage data and evidence to make confident design decisions
Participate in all aspects of the design process to frame problems, research use cases and users, define insights, share your vision, prototype and produce launch-ready assets
Support the engineering team through regular collaboration and delivery of production-ready assets and specifications
Lead broader design initiatives, such as creating future visions for upcoming products, services, and features
Preferred qualifications:
5+ years experience designing best-of-class digital products - ideally consumer products, nonprofit, and/or financial services
Experience across the full product development spectrum: from ideation and strategy to hands-on implementation
Comfort in navigating problems and opportunities autonomously and independently
Strong strategic thinking, collaboration, and communication skills
Comfortable with cross-functional collaboration between Design, Product, Engineering, and Marketing
Strong customer focus: ability to conduct user research and translate insights from customer interviews, usability tests and site metrics into actionable design solutions
Excellent verbal, written, and visual communication skills; willing to provide and receive constructive feedback as a part of the creative process
What We Offer
An opportunity to improve real lives, solve hard problems, and change the world
Friendly, supportive, and adventurous environment with a team of engaged colleagues
A comprehensive, industry-leading benefits package
Opportunities to connect with and learn from colleagues and partners around the world
A diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is an integral part of Kiva's culture. We actively welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a great place to work. Join us and help us achieve our mission!

We will only accept applications directly from candidates. Kiva will not be responsible for any recruiting agency fees, absent a formal agreement.

POSITION OVERVIEW

Alarm.com is seeking an Instructional Designer to join our rapidly growing team. They will focus on designing online training modules and other digital learning content, partnering with subject matter experts to keep content relevant and updated, and continuing to help develop our current training offering. The ideal candidate will be comfortable creating digital learning content, writing storyboards and scripts, leading design and development meetings with subject matter experts, working in an iterative design process alongside eLearning developers, and have a can-do attitude.


RESPONSIBILITIES

The Instructional Designers primary job responsibilities will include:
Designing eLearning content and modules
Designing other digital content as required
Working closely with subject matter experts throughout the company in order to conduct needs assessments, identify actionable learning objectives, design learning experiences, create assessments that measure learning, and design metrics that can measure business impact
Creating storyboards/scripts and production-ready content for video or web-based training programs and advising on production
Partnering with internal teams to produce high quality eLearning content
Collaborating with other members of the Digital Learning Team and Training Team to brainstorm, problem-solve, and review each other's work
Working with subject matter experts on other teams to produce scripts, content, and timelines
Partnering with the creative team to create new assets for courses
Producing quality digital learning content, including course design documents, course outlines, course descriptions, PowerPoint slides, video scripts, diagrams, interactive exercises, and assessments
Designing measurement instruments and creating advanced learning activities questions for quizzes and certification exams
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's Degree
2-5 years instructional design or equivalent experience
Experience applying instructional design models (ADDIE, SAM, etc.) in a production environment
Understanding of structured writing techniques, modular content development and the instructional development lifecycle (analyzing needs through evaluating, and maintaining courses)
A track record of designing and creating compelling, training courses for audiences that include customers and employees
Strong communication, writing, design, and project management skills
Strong interpersonal skills; can interact professionally with varied audiences
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced team environment while seeking input from others
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Intermediate knowledge of creating and editing images
Proficient in MS Office tools
WHY WORK FOR ALARM.COM?
Collaborate with outstanding people: We hire only the best. Our quality standards are high and our employees enjoy working alongside other high achievers.
Make an immediate impact: New employees can expect to be given responsibility for bringing new technologies to the marketplace within weeks. You are empowered to perform as soon as you join the Alarm.com team!
Gain well rounded experience: Alarm.com offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and gain a broad knowledge base across multiple areas of the business.
Work with latest technologies: As we continue to lead the industry, we require expertise across a broad spectrum of technologies including short and long-range wireless communication, video surveillance, lighting and HVAC automation, web development, and backend application development and hosting.
Focus on fun: Alarm.com places high value on our team culture. We even have a committee dedicated to hosting a stand-out holiday party, happy hours, and an annual corporate retreat.

com, founded in 2000, is the industry leading technology provider of interactive security solutions. Alarm.com's products and services are offered exclusively through a network of over 5,000 licensed and authorized Security Dealers. Alarm.com's headquarters are located in Vienna, VA. Coffman Engineers is seeking a Piping Designer with 3+ years of 3D piping design experience using Hexagon PPM CADWorx. The successful candidate will develop drawings in conformance with project specifications, scope of work, design parameters, codes, and industry practices, and have a working knowledge of: process piping and piping systems; Piping and Instrument Diagrams (P&IDs); Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs); Piping Material Specifications; and valve and instrumentation types and uses.

Associates CAD degree or engineering course work preferred.
3+ years of progressive experience in industrial / oil and gas piping design.
Proficiency in CADWorx is required.

Experience working with Industrial facilities, oil and gas producers, pipeline operators, and / or refiners.
Knowledge in developing piping specification databases, 3D assemblies/parts, and templates per client standards/requirements, using CADWorx, is preferred.
Ability to correctly dimension and prepare piping plans, elevations, sections, and isometrics in accordance with project requirements and P&ID’s and field information.
Knowledge of system P&ID’s and ability to create and modify client P&ID’s to meet requirements.
Experience in preparing isometric drawings including BOM’s from piping plans, sections, and elevations.

Quizlet’s mission is to help students (and their teachers) practice and master whatever they are learning. Every month more than 50 million active learners from 130 countries practice and master more than 300 million study sets on every conceivable topic and subject. We are developing new learning experiences by modeling how students learn and drawing upon knowledge acquisition, retention, and pedagogy in cognitive science. We are always seeking to help students master any subject by optimizing study efficiency and engagement.

The Subscriptions team is core to Quizlet and drives business growth for the company. We take pride in keeping Quizlet free for anyone to use. Free access is made possible by our growing base of upgraded users (both students and teachers) who pay to access our premium features such as offline studying and custom creation tools.

Come help us scale one of the fastest growing and highest quality consumer learning brands, as we develop innovative simple-to-use study tools that help students everywhere.

The Role

As a Senior Product Designer on the Subscriptions team, you would work with a diverse cross-functional team to enhance the feature set and capabilities of our Go, Plus, and Teacher subscriptions, making them indispensable to our students and teachers. You’ll define what value propositions we should focus on to make our user’s lives better and to grow our subscriptions revenue dramatically.

You will be involved in every step of design, including research, ideation, mapping user flows, creating mockups and designing high-fidelity UIs across our website and native apps. You’ll bring your voice and ideas to our small, talented design team, helping to shape the future of design at Quizlet.
What you'll be doing
You’ll own large design initiatives from beginning to end
You'll partner with product management and engineering leads to define the product vision and strategy for Quizlet’s Go, Plus and Teacher subscriptions.
You'll bring clarity to ambiguous problems through user research, rapid prototyping, and in-product testing.
You'll design flows and experiences that are simple and elegant.
You'll constantly push yourself and the team to raise the design bar at Quizlet through a culture of feedback and open communication.
You'll build empathy and user insight for our users and their needs
Preferred Qualifications
You have 4+ years of design experience, working primarily in large-scale consumer web products
You have strong end-to-end design skills, including UX, UI, IxD, visual design and prototyping skills
You have experience identifying new-to-world features and delivering business results
You have experience thinking at a high level about product strategy and vision (not just “How it should look” but “What we should build.”)
You have experience building and shipping web and mobile features
You are comfortable working on a cross-functional team in a fast-paced startup environment with imperfect information and limited resources, employing a mindset of rapid prototyping and iteration


We hope you are excited about everything you read so far. We highly encourage you to apply for this position, even if you feel you do not meet all the requirements. Quizlet is always looking for amazing folks that believe in our mission and can contribute to our team in various ways - not merely candidates that fit a certain mold.

Quizlet's Team Culture

We are here to make education better and more accessible. We strive to improve the lives of students and teachers at every stage and in every setting. We have a bias for action, take initiative, and hustle to deliver results. We make informed decisions whenever possible but are unafraid to take calculated risks on great ideas to promote learning. We embrace challenges and see effort as the path to mastery. We’re constantly seeking opportunities to learn and we embrace curiosity. Quality matters at Quizlet, and we hold the bar high on everything we do. We sweat the details and take personal accountability and pride in anything that carries the Quizlet name. We speak up, jump in and work with each other to fix problems, and never say "that's not my job." We treat each other with honesty and respect, encourage vigorous debate, and seek critical feedback. We value diversity, humility, transparency, and collaboration as the best paths to our success — as individuals, as a team, and as a company.

Quizlet’s success as an online learning community depends on a strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. We are actively working to build a team that is representative of the diverse communities we serve, and an open, inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive. As an equal opportunity employer and a tech company committed to societal change, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Come join us!

Position Description


Dynetics, wholly owned subsidiary of Leidos, seeks an experienced User Experience (UX) Designer to support ongoing work for our Department of Defense customers as well as commercial entities. The UX Designer will be involved in planning meetings, customer interactions, collaborative design sessions, and research events. The UX Designer will work on the User Experience team to fulfill all usability requirements. Direct communication with project leadership, customers, end users, and software developers occurs on a daily basis. We follow an Agile software development process.

Basic Qualifications


Candidates must possess and demonstrate a strong working knowledge of user-centered design methods and processes as well as skills in conceptual thinking. Candidates must have the communication skills to elicit and understand the customer needs, motivations, and behaviors and translate findings into deliverables. Candidates must be fluent in modern user experience needs and able to design every stage of an interface from wireframes to high fidelity mockups to supporting developers during implementation.

Candidates should also be versed in user-experience research techniques, such as interviews, observation, focus groups, and surveys. Candidates must demonstrate strong working knowledge of the Adobe software, preferably Illustrator, Photoshop, and XD.

A strong portfolio and three years of experience are a minimum.

Other Qualifications


Experience with Agile Scrum as well as an understanding of modern software structures are a plus. Experience in a wide array of media is a plus. A BS or AS degree is a plus.

Security Requirements


Candidate must be a US Citizen and possess (and be able to maintain) a Final Secret Clearance or meet the eligibility to obtain (and maintain) a Secret Clearance.

Who we are

SoFi is a digital personal finance company whose mission is to help its members achieve financial independence to realize their ambitions, whether that be to buy a house one day, start a family on their own terms or be debt free. We aim to be at the center of our members financial lives, and to help every member Get Their Money Right®. By joining SoFi, youll become part of a forward-thinking company that is transforming financial services by embracing technology to build innovative loan products, investment tools, and more. One of the fastest growing fintech companies, weve grown from 250 employees in 2015 to over 1,500 employees today, and are well on our way to reaching 1 million members. With offices across the US, we offer the excitement of a rapidly growing startup with the stability of a seasoned management team and some of the best talent around. As an employer, we strive to hire employees who are committed to both our companys mission and our desire to build the best culture in the world. If you are driven, passionate about what you do, and excited about the SoFi mission, we would love to hear from you.

The role

Our product and design team are designing for the future of personal finance. Interested in helping people achieve their life goals? Want to shape the future of how people manage, discover, assess, sign up and use financial services products to get their money right? Have an entrepreneurial mindset and a focus on creating multi-platform experiences to aid people in decision making? We would love to speak with you. This role is focused on a new business at SoFi, called Lantern, and leading design to create new ways to help people get their money right across every life stage. Our mission is to help our members find their path to financial independence by providing them with the tools, resources, and guidance they need to get there. We're building machine learning (ML) driven experiences that empower people to be proactive in finding solutions to get their money right and we are seeking a hands on design leader who is passionate about creating better financial solutions for people. This is a great opportunity to help shape the evolution of these capabilities for years to come.

At SoFi, youll become part of a new kind of finance company whose ambition is to help our members achieve financial independence and reach their goals. We aim to be at the center of our members financial lives, and to help every member get their money right. We created student loan refinancing, addressing the biggest financial challenge of a new generation through a modern approach to lending and personal finance. Next we expanded our products and services across loans, wealth management, and insurance. SoFi Moneya modern take on a checking or savings account--is our newest innovation and disruption to the financial services industry. SoFi has achieved significant growth, with ambitious plans ahead, but to continue this growth we need great talent. And that starts with you.

What youll do:
Define the overall design strategy for new SoFi line of business and drive the creation and evolution of the experience across multiple platforms
Lead the product design process and cross-functional team through concept to production
Partner with product managers from conception of product through finalization, including working closely with engineering team to implement high quality designs
Work closely with Product Managers, Engineering, Marketing, and Business Development to effectively communicate the value of user-centric design
Understand the users deeply across consumer segments through user insights and lead product design to drive measurable outcomes
Challenge previously-established thinking patterns, and discover new ways of problem solving all while being a clear and effective communicator
Collaborate with other designers across SoFi products
Lead and inspire the UX vision for a new line of business
What youll need:
8+ yrs experience successfully shipping products and features from start to finish
Expert knowledge of best practices in UI / UX and information architecture across iOS, Android and responsive web
Expert understanding of current design tools (Primarily Figma, but also Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, Invision, UserZoom)
Strong time management, planning, and collaboration skills
Strong understanding of how to use data analytics, user testing and research to inform and validate design decisions and focus on constant improvement
Strong presentation skills, able to effectively communicate design solutions to engineering, product, marketing, business, and executive leadership
Experience working in an Agile development environment using tools like Jira and Confluence
A portfolio URL or PDF to submit with application with examples of mobile and responsive web product design
Nice to have:
Experience working on personal finance, data visualization, ecommerce, and social experiences
Experience working with remote teams and stakeholders
Why youll love working here
Competitive salary packages and bonuses
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits
Generous vacation and holidays
Paid parental leave for eligible employees
401(k) and education on retirement planning
Tuition reimbursement on approved programs
Monthly contribution up to $200 to help you pay off your student loans
Great health & well-being benefits including: telehealth parental support, subsidized gym program
Employer paid lunch program (except for remote employees)
Fully stocked kitchen (snacks and drinks)

Hamilton Porter is a leading nationwide technical recruiting firm, that has the privilege of being able to offer an amazing full-time salary paid job opportunity, to a Principal to Senior level UI/UX Product Designer. Our client is an early-stage start-up with a SaaS business model that has the potential to unlock some legal and driver side issues, currently plaguing reputable industry market leaders such as Uber and Lyft. We have devised a business model, that will empower both the drivers and the passengers, while all together bypassing the legal ramifications that are currently getting Uber and Lyft vetoed from many regions. The mission is to provide hard-working drivers with the information, freedom and tools they need to control their own destiny and earn a sustainable living, while giving riders greater choice so that they can find affordable travel while feeling safe and secure.

Huge opportunity to own the Design efforts supporting both the Android and iOS Mobile Product offering, as well as being able to design Web and ongoing digital, and print marketing. End goal would be to help scale all design efforts for a product offering with a large user audience, establish best practices as design expert, and eventually grow the design team within the company.

5 years of relevant experience

Senior Product Designer

Rocket Insights (part of Dept) is looking for designers who want to build great products with great teams. Our philosophy is to hire smart, client-facing employees who can both build products right (design elegant user experiences) and also build the right product (understand and execute on our client's business goals).

About Us

Rocket Insights is a fast-growing, tight-knit group of experienced designers and engineers who love building products with like-minded folks. We have recently been acquired by Dept, an ambitious, high-flying agency who is going to build a worldwide brand.

We focus on building great products with clients that we enjoy and respect. Our work has improved people's lives, been seen by millions of users, featured in the app stores, had books written about it, featured in the press, received awards and, most importantly, brought delight to users.

We believe that:
Great UI/UX is critical; aesthetics, animation, simplicity, copy, and speed.
Software quality is a top priority; usability testing, design reviews, best practices.
Collaboration and great communication are the keys to any successful project.
Success comes from constantly learning/evolving peer reviews, conferences and practice.
A healthy work/life balance (aka getting home for dinner) is important.
What will your day be like?

At Rocket every day is different. People rarely get bored because things move fast and we work hard. Here are some of the activities that make up the day of Rocket designers:
UX Research - You'll do user and market research to understand target markets, direct and indirect competition.
Usability Testing - You'll test your designs with real people through usability testing to ensure that it really works for both our clients and their users.
UI Design - You'll design complex apps that are making a material impact on the world and will be seen by millions of users.
Prototyping
Design Sprinting
Member of Agile Team - You'll be a part of agile software development practices and peer/UI reviews.
Talking with Clients - You'll interface with clients. We estimate about 80% hands-on design and 20% client interaction.
Peer Review - Both learn new things from other Rocketeers as well as improve how we do things
About You
You have multiple years experience designing software user interfaces used by lots of people.
You have multiple years experience with design tools like Sketch, Invision, Figma, etc.
You're a natural problem-solver, a self-starter, and willing to take initiative.
You enjoy talking to clients and are good distilling technical information for a variety of roles within a business.
You have some business experience and understand multiple types of business models.
You have opinions about what makes a well-designed product
Are you a UI or UX Designer?

Another thing we believe is that designers don't distinguish between UI and UX. We expect our designers to execute on both the user interface level as well as the user experience level. They are inextricably linked. You don't focus on one over the other. If you've been focused on one your whole career you're likely not a fit for us. If you naturally find yourself doing both, talk to us!

Good Traits to Have
No ego - You realize design is about solving human and psychological problems, not solving artistic aspirations.
Business-minded - You understand that great design solves for the business as well as the user.
Articulate - You can communicate ideas clearly and succinctly.
Entrepreneurial - You like designing and building cool and new things.
Self-aware - You recognize your own strengths and weaknesses in real-time and can adjust accordingly.

Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Seamless, HBO, Disney, Urban Outfitters, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale – each month, tens of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 2 billion active users through Braze.

Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Mobile Marketing Platforms in 2019. The company has also been named on the Forbes Cloud 100, Inc. Magazine's 2019 Best Places to Work, and Crain's 2019 Best Places to Work in NYC lists.

What We're Looking For


Do you work well with teams? Have you had productive collaborations working with other designers? Do you challenge assumptions and receive constructive feedback well? Are you an exceptional verbal or visual communicator?

Product Designers at Braze have the freedom to work on all aspects of the user experience, including user research, user flows, wireframing, diagramming, interaction design, rapid prototyping, design documentation, visual design, and animation. But we never work alone. Each designer's success is dependent on the support of a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, user researchers, and a team of designers always willing to help. We are currently looking for user-centered designers that work well in highly-collaborative environments, and possess an intense attention to detail and execution.

What You'll Do


You will be working within a cross-functional product team dedicated to building a sophisticated, and easy to use, experience for message creation. While you may be working on vastly different phases of the product development process from week to week, your ability to communicate effectively — in whatever format you are most comfortable with — will always be required.

What You Have
2-3 years of product design experience working within a cross-functional product team
Prior experience at a SaaS business (preferably B2B)
Excellent visual and verbal communication skills
Experience conducting research and/or partnering with user researchers
Comfortable with ambiguity, and learning through experimentation
A portfolio showcasing the ownership of the end-to-end design for a highly complex product or a problem space
What Captures Our Attention
Experience with email or SMS marketing
Familiarity with a technical language (HTML/CSS)
What We Offer
Competitive compensation that includes equity
Flexible time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave
Free daily lunch, including snacks and beverages
Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture
In addition, this position is exempt under the provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act.

If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.

Believing that diversity fosters innovation and strengthens our skills, we're working to build a culture of equity and inclusion so everyone has a level playing field. And, as one of the country's fastest-growing firms of our size, we attract passionate, creative people who truly believe in our transformational mission. At Otak, we're forging stronger connections between people and their communities.

Demonstrated time management skills to keep project assignments on schedule and achieve set objectives

Advanced verbal and visual communication skills
Why work at Otak?

When you work at Otak, you aren't just joining a firm you're joining a community. We believe our best work happens in a culture of collaboration and inclusion, where the expertise of diverse individuals can thrive in a foundation of teamwork. The work environment we create is built on a simple concept: working on interesting projects with interesting people. However, we don't just believe in cultivating our own community; we're also committed to enriching the communities around us with smart, creative solutions. We know our employees make an investment in us, so we're committed to making an investment in them. Seasoned experts and young professionals work together to encourage personal growth and skill development at all experience levels. Plus, we're expanding and we're dedicated to developing an internal infrastructure with the strength and talent to support that growth.

Otak employees have a progressive mindset and sustainable community perspective. We encourage our staff to volunteer in their communities by giving them an option to earn extra vacation time for their volunteer hours. Otak combines the best of a small firm mentality with strong collaboration across disciplines with the plentiful opportunities to work on exciting projects offered by a growing firm. We also encourage life balance and foster a fun work environment. Our Northwest sensibilities are reflected in our commitment to sustainability and diversity. And believing that diversity fosters innovation and strengthens our skills, we embrace a culture of inclusion and equity in our company and in our communities.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability. We will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with a disability where appropriate.

Sound like a place you'd like to spend some time and advance your career? Join us! Please apply online and include your portfolio (or a link to your site), and a cover letter that sells your skills with your resume.

The Senior Interaction Designer is responsible for leading design projects by utilizing their conceptual skills, industry experience and imagination to bring creative excellence to our client’s digital products. This is a position that will require exceptional problem-solving skills, a drive to innovate and the ability to come up with innovative solutions that balance user pain-points and business needs – all with a positive, collaborative attitude and good sense of humor. This role demands in-depth industry and design knowledge, as well as experience in consulting and user research. In addition, excellent communication and leadership skills are essential to effectively present concepts to cross-disciplinary teams and external clients, suppliers and creative partners across global locations.
Why We Need This Position
Innovation is one of the founding principles of TEAGUE. Without dedicated, imaginative and technically savvy creators, we’re, well, simply not able to do what we do best. Which is why we need people like you, who see the world as a place full of possibility, with the creative mind, innovative approach, and concrete design skills to imagine something new and the passion and know-how to make it real.
Who We’re Looking For
As a senior designer, you are creative, curious, and solution-oriented. Your deep understanding of how to create meaningful experiences for the user will serve you well as you dig deep into a client’s business in order to recommend products and/or features that will help achieve their goals, all while improving the experience for the user. Innately curious, you are well versed in all project phases, including research, concept creation, wireframing, prototyping and user testing. You’re also prepared to participate in requirements-gathering activities, workshops, and product definition exercises and then able to synthesize that data into applicable insights that drive the experience strategy and product design. Finally, having researched, tested, and synthesized your findings, you’re able to generate and evaluate a wide range of solutions and make recommendations in a timely manner. This could involve creating personas and journey maps that represent user needs and help identify opportunities; generating detailed user flows, defining the information architecture and content strategy, and designing wireframes that bring your strategy to life. You’ll be able to articulate the design rationale to maintain the design intent as concepts progress through the down-select process. In addition to working on the projects themselves, you’ve got an eye for the big picture and are able to define and implement best practices and suggest new approaches for the design process as a whole. Finally, you’ve got a passion for your industry and are up to date on industry trends, materials and technology, design tools and processes.
Personality-wise, you’re a strong collaborator who is comfortable partnering with multi-disciplinary design teams, including visual designers and developers. And you know how to work effectively with clients, whether you’re working side by side with them to drive product definition and design strategy or creating and delivering compelling presentations to them. You’re unflappable in the face of competing priorities and model grace under pressure while balancing the needs of multiple clients while meeting deadlines and project commitments. If you’ve got an innovative mind that thrives on a challenge, a glass-half-full approach to problem-solving; a dynamic personality capable of navigating a wide range of collaborative situations; and enjoy the prospect of building the future of aviation, have we got a job for you.
What We Just Said, Now in 5 Bullet Points (a.k.a. Essential Qualifications)
Experience: 5+ years’ experience, including significant experience designing mobile apps, websites, web applications, and/or desktop software; some experience in a consulting environment preferred. demonstrated experience using a strategic approach to solve design problems; able to analyze and synthesize complex design challenges in order to support an informed, creative process; advanced understanding of design process including divergent (brainstorming), convergent (concept-selection), and detail-design phases
Special skills: Advanced knowledge of Sketch, Axure, or Omnigraffle; Illustrator, Photoshop; advanced knowledge of prototyping tools such as InVision, Marvel, Proto.io; advanced knowledge of project management framework and process
Passion: Collaborating with others to create meaningful experiences for users
Role: Working with multi-disciplinary teams across a variety of digital products
Personality: Creative, collaborative, self-motivated, energetic, problem-solver, enthusiastic, open-minded, flexible, curious, diplomatic
DOE - Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package offered.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime.

At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of our 15,000 employees across the world.

We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us?

We are looking for an exceptional digital designer with UX experience to support Wantable’s strategies in a way that resonates with consumers and offers a world-class customer experience.

It is our goal for this role to turn into a full-time permanent position, and we are willing to invest the time necessary to make sure you are an exceptional fit during the contract phase. It is our hope you are looking for the same. There is enough work for 2 designers, but we just want one exceptional person - we believe that’s you.

This role will work in tandem primarily with Wantable’s Creative Director, Content Director & Storyteller, Copywriter, Marketing, IT as well as various other teams. This role’s mission is to:
Create and execute a cohesive brand position and customer experience
Create with graphic consistency and quality across all channels without sacrificing performance & UI/UX for aesthetic
Drive iterative marketing approach with creative + copy across a wide range of physical and digital channels supported thru data

WANTABLE’S PERSONALITY:
We’re a fast-moving company, with a vision and roadmap to be a leading next-generation eCommerce company. We are committed to achieving this goal through passion, hustle, hard work, and most importantly through exceptional customer service. The ideal candidate for this role is flexible and agile, resilient, and one who strikes a balance between thoughtfulness and decisiveness but above all else thrives in an ever-changing environment.

HOW WE WORK AT WANTABLE…
Care: Make genuine, one-of-a-kind relationships
Communicate: Be real, honest, and uplifting.
Support: Be a coach, team player, problem solver + gamechanger.
Grow: Listen. Learn from data. Be nimble, flex!
Show up: Go above and beyond with products, style, and service.
Create a ripple: Enrich the lives around us.

60% of the time you will:
Create and execute a cohesive brand position and customer experience
Create with graphic consistency and quality across all channels without sacrificing performance & UI/UX for aesthetic
Drive iterative marketing approach with creative + copy across a wide range of physical and digital channels supported thru data

30% of the time you will:
Create and execute compelling direct response ads and emails
Retouch images, organize digital assets or other more mundane tasks

10% of the time you will:
Work on the bigger picture projects and interact with all levels of management to drive Wantable to the next level.

Required Skills & Experience
5+ yrs experience in digital design and formal design training with exceptional conceptual, analytical and design skills including websites, e-mail, digital display, programmatic, video, social media and print
An unparalleled understanding of Web production and the capabilities within digital channels, plus expertise in Adobe Creative Suite (and video production is an added bonus)
Deep knowledge of the digital space to include site UI/UX, direct response (social and programmatic platforms, email marketing, mobile)
Deep knowledge of responsive techniques and device landscape
Strong knowledge of typography, image manipulation, illustration and animation
Deep understanding of direct response marketing design and layout
Experience in A/B Testing and how it relates to design deliverables and iterative design
Resilient, ambitious, overachiever, flexible, humble, kind and shows initiative
Dedication to graphic consistency and quality across all channels without sacrificing performance & UI/UX for aesthetic
Team player with strong communication & organization skills and a can-do attitude
Must be able to work independently and is a strong problem solver
Mastery of eCommerce metrics and a data-centric approach.
Fashion/Retail Industry a plus and/or previous experience working in retail or eCommerce company.

As a Visual Designer in the eBay product design group, you will help to drive the future state of our product design language working (within the Payments domain team / across all domains experiences) in collaboration with the leadership team, design leads and working closely with our product & brand partners. Your key responsibility is to craft a compelling design vocabulary, mood & visual style for eBay. Visual Designers are specialists with a passion for typography, iconography, layout, color, motion, sound, 2D, 3D, AR & VR. Your focus will be to help drive, adopt, and maintain the new core design primitives (typography, iconography, radius (shape), color, sound, depth, motion, layout, navigation) for eBay web, mobile, and tablet experiences. It will be the Visual Designers responsibility to align very closely with brand to help shift the narrative and bring brand through the core product design experience. This will allow the product experience to inform the brand expression and create a holistic CX across everything eBay executes. The Visual Designer will also need to work closely with engineering to ensure quality control and to ensure pixel-perfect execution. The Visual Designer will be responsible for adopting, scaling, maintaining & helping to drive the shared core component systems and for updating the product design playbook or style guide for companywide use. You will work closely with design leaders, product management, brand, marketing, and engineering to successfully go from early stage product concepts to launch. You are a very creative visionary that can translate business needs into a fantastic customer-focused solution. You must be responsive, flexible, and able to succeed within an open and collaborative peer environment. The ideal candidate for this position will be at ease visualizing an experience in the abstract and then being able to drive that vision into solid design deliverables. Visual Designers are visual storytellers that can produce great visual concepts and deliver those concepts in high fidelity with the highest-quality fit and finish. They know how to execute dynamic designs that translate into motion and can storyboard their ideas to help direct motion designers to execute a vision. They can discern what is good design and clearly articulate why. They are our tastemakers.

Visual Designers employ humanist design methods to craft superior UX, usability, & legibility. They develop and maintain highest design standards and act responsibly in their execution of these standards, as well strive to continuously innovate and improve. They may manage other Visual Designers and/or vendors. They interact with the relevant business, development, project/program management groups, other designers and executives to succeed. While our Visual Designers are passionate about their discipline and customer experience, they also possess the business acumen to understand the impact of their efforts within a wider scope.

About you

You love a challenge and are hungry to help reinvigorate one of the internets pioneer brands. You care about making great products and obsess over the details. You negotiate and evolve design with partners in the project team, and ensure the integrity of the design is upheld. You're knowledgeable about our competitors, understand established design patterns and best practices, but always feel the need to do better.

Key Responsibilities
Drive the design and communication of design guidelines, patterns, and libraries
Craft beautiful design solutions that adhere to the eBay design language
Produce experience architecture, user flows, wireframes, prototypes, user interface specifications, and final graphics
Help drive the vision for crafting unique and compelling motion design for the eBay core product experiences.
Create extraordinary user-centered designs incorporating business requirements, product learning and customer feedback
Partner with others in the broader design community to develop and extend the experience across the array of offerings
Communicate your design work and negotiate future direction with peers, researchers, design leaders, product partners and executives
Inspire and mentor others on the core product team
Work collaboratively with research team members and management. Take responsibility for initiating peer reviews of work and make time to give feedback on others deliverables as requested.
Regularly look outward to identify opportunities for improvement and to incorporate advancements in UX technology, methods, and tools.
Basic Qualifications
5+ years professional experience as an UX design lead / user experience designer; expertise in both visual and motion design
Strong understanding of the user-centered design process
Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, UX Design, or related design discipline
Experience with design and prototyping tools such as Invision, Figma, Sketch, Adobe, & Keynote
Experience designing mobile web, and/or on-device mobile applications
Ability to cultivate an understanding of industry trends and communicate your ideas to the design org as a whole
A portfolio that showcases relevant design projects and includes your process, design explorations and final work
Able to understand detail and find radically simple solutions that delight users
Experience partnering with product managers and developers to deliver great experiences
We value
Curious minds and an appetite for learning
A strong point of view paired with a healthy dose of humility
Fearless brainstorming
Passion for the craft and the ability to showcase ideas with the latest design and prototyping tools
A user-centric and strategic approach
A point of view on the design and technology trends that will shape the future of our industry

Job Description:
Tic Toc Games is looking for a Level Designer! As the Level Designer, you will design and revise levels for multiple games. As a team member you will provide constructive feedback for other designers to improve level quality. You will also brainstorm new features and revisions to the current gameplay mechanics. Additionally, you will play similar titles, to study the market, and provide feedback to improve game quality.

YOU ARE:
A PERFECTIONIST: You are very attentive to detail and always strive to do more than the bare minimum.
A TEAM PLAYER: You collaborate with team members to ensure that not only the team achieves its goals, but that the project always has the best design implemented. You are comfortable with participating in design brainstorms and reviews and accepting feedback and direction in any project.
A GAMER: You love video games, in fact, that’s the whole reason why you’re applying! You want to be part of a game development team, get your hands dirty and release great, innovative games that everyone loves!

Responsibilities
Provide feedback to the level design team in a constructive, and positive manner.
Able to pitch ideas or concepts to engage users in existing projects.
Work closely with the Design team to collaborate and create new content across all projects within the studio.
Review and Revise levels with the Level Design Team.
Work with a team of Level Designers.
Build Levels for multiple games and game modes.
Design Obstacles and Game Features with the Design Team.


Skills & Qualifications
At least 1+ year as a Level Designer or similar role on 2D hardcore/casual shooters, 2D platformers, or similar genre styled game.
Experience in Unity 3D is a must.
Experience in developing games across all platforms — this includes mobile, console and PC.
Detailed-oriented, organized and able to work well both independently and collaboratively.
Exhibit strong management and conflict resolution skills.
Strong interpersonal and problem solving skills.
Attentive to Detail.
Experience as a 2D Level Designer.
Strong will to Learn and Improve.

Super Lucky is seeking a full-time Motion Graphics Artist/Designer to join our Marketing Art team to create engaging visual ads for our fun mobile casual games. Job Description:
About Mixpanel

At Mixpanel, our mission is to increase the rate of innovation. Not only as a company but for the businesses we serve. Through our analytics platform, companies can analyze how and why their users engage, convert, and retain in real-time across web, mobile, and smart devices. Then they can use that data to improve their business and products.

Mixpanel serves over 26,000 companies from different industries around the world, including Twitter, Expedia, and Ancestry. Headquartered in San Francisco, Mixpanel has offices in New York, Seattle, Austin, London, Barcelona, and Singapore.

About The Role

We are a small, collaborative team of multidisciplinary designers, and are looking for experienced product designers to help us dive deeper into our product vision. Our process always begins with product vision and is a collaborative between the product and design teams. We focus on innovation with purpose to solve the problem at hand, and we care deeply about simplicity and usability.

Responsibilities
Design and prototypes multiple solutions to improve and evolve Mixpanel's visual design language
Work closely with other designers, product managers, and engineers to see a project from concept through implementation and beyond
Ensure designs are based on user needs and business goals
Present work to teammates and stakeholders to gain buy-in on their ideas
Requirements
Design polished user interfaces, illustrations, iconography, and interactions that bring clarity to complex design problems
Know when to use, and create, the right data visualization for the right problem
Understand modern front-end engineering tools and practices
Enjoy helping people obtain meaning from their data
Bonus Points: Experience designing for enterprise software or SaaS web applications
Culture Values
Be Open: When knowledge becomes open, we can come together as a team to collaborate around a shared purpose
Customer Focus: Our customers' success is our success
Lead Change: Everyone at Mixpanel has the capacity to make an impact on the business
Results Oriented: Driving results in a measurable way ensures we stay focused on the highest impact initiatives
One Team: We can't win without each other
Why choose Mixpanel?

A clear market leader in the product analytics space, Mixpanel has raised $77M from world-renowned VC firms like Andreessen-Horowitz, Sequoia, and YC, and our revenue has grown significantly since then. Our ambitious, collaborative team makes it possible by finding creative solutions to new challenges with scaling, reliability, design, and customer service.

Mixpanel is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Work closely with Operations and Product to continually test and optimize our customer acquisition funnel
Inspire innovation and big creative ideas throughout the company: everything from a spear-heading a major patient initiative to step-changing how we acquire new patients through digital performance marketing channels or offline programs/channels.
Uncover insights through performance data and use the insights to inform creative development for maximum relevance and impact
Be a resource on how mobile technology is fundamentally changing marketing
