At Bluebeam, we empower people to advance the way the world is built. We create smart software solutions that make construction sites more efficient, connected and safe and improve the lives of design and construction professionals everywhere.

As a Sr. Product Designer at Bluebeam, you'll join the Product Design & Research team to support Revu, our flagship product with more than 1.6 million users worldwide. You'll help to define the overall user experience end-to-end including the micro interactions that bring the product to life. You'll tackle complex, multifaceted customer workflows, transforming them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use experiences for our customers around the globe.

As an experienced Product Design & Research professional, what excites you is solving for our Customer needs and finding solutions to their day-to-day problems. You are steeped in this sort of experience and as a result are able come to this role armed with best-practice techniques and approaches and you know instinctually what the best design tools for the job are going to be.

This role will collaborate closely with, and be supported by, other Product Designers who are also working on the wider Revu portfolio and it will partner with peers in Product Management and Engineering to deliver the actual experiences to our end customers.

*This role is a full-time, onsite position. Due to the Corona Virus, all new employees will be required to start work remotely until we are able to return to the office. More information will be provided in the interview process.*

What you'll do:
Create detailed UI designs for product features including low to high fidelity visual design mockups, wireframes, sketches, prototypes, and supporting design specifications and documentation.
Collaborate closely with Engineering and Product Management in an Agile/Lean and iterative fashion to ensure your proposed designs meet user needs and are feasible to implement.
Undertake user research, data analysis and user testing with our customers translating insights and findings into tangible solutions for our product.
Suggest ways to validate product ideas and concepts with customers in order to verify assumptions and hypotheses and ensure that customers will be able to realize value from a given experience you are designing.
Directly contribute to ongoing research process improvements, including establishing best practices and setting standards for the approach and rigor we apply to our research methods.
Tell the story of the customer, their jobs-to-be-done and create consensus around user outcomes.
Act as a champion for good user experience, sharing best practices and demonstrating curiosity about customer needs and behaviors.
Advocate and help to further embed best practice Design methods both within the wider Product and Engineering teams as well as across the company.
Play a key role in further developing tools and resources that will help build Design capability across the organization as well as educating and empowering teams to adopt new processes, methods and mindsets.
What we'd like to see in you:
5 or more years of experience designing delightful user experiences for a range of responsive desktop and native mobile apps and a diverse portfolio showing your processes, deliverables and the outcomes that they drove.
Demonstrated experience designing for complex user interfaces and workflows and in developing responsive design patterns and design systems that employ best practice UX.
Experience creating prototypes of different levels of fidelity using tools like Sketch, Adobe Suite, Invision, Figma etc.
An appreciation of user psychology and an understanding of how language and design resonate with users.
A proven approach as well as deep experience and expertise in creating personas, mapping user needs, experiences and customer journeys.
The ability to confidently present and articulate design decisions with ease, participate in peer design critiques, and incorporate feedback.
Comfort working in multi-faceted design, product and engineering teams in an Agile environment.
Experience mentoring, coaching and guiding other less tenured Designers in best practices and methodologies.
Experience with/or exposure to Service Design methodologies and approaches (i.e. creation of service blueprints) as well as significant experience designing for a holistic end-to-end experience with multiple touchpoints.
What we'd LOVE to see in you:
BA/BFA degree in HCI or design related field, with an emphasis on user experience, interaction design, or visual design.
Experience working in a design agency.
Experience prototyping in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
What we offer:
A chance to make a meaningful impact in a dynamic, growing industry ripe for innovation.
A fun, collaborative work environment with an opportunity to help shape Bluebeam's approach to Product Design.
Plenty of opportunity to try, learn, and try again. We work in a user-centric and iterative fashion. You will have ample opportunity to make a direct impact on our products and customer experiences.
To apply, please send the following:
Cover letter (Cover letter should address why you're interested in Bluebeam and, specifically, the Sr. Product Designer role as described.)
Resume
A link to your portfolio or examples of your work
About Bluebeam

The construction industry is adopting new technology at a feverish pace. Tablets and cell phones are replacing paper blueprints, drones are surveying jobsites in 3D, and cloud collaboration is changing the way teams work together. Bluebeam plays a crucial role in this transformation. The key to our success is a customer-focused approach to product development: we work with the industry to create solutions for the industry. Today, over 1.6 million people throughout the world use Bluebeam. In the US, we're a critical partner for the majority of top AEC firms, and rapidly expanding our presence globally, with offices in Sweden, Germany and the UK.

Come design and build your future with us.

Bluebeam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

Opportunity: The Mom Project is helping to source candidates for the above client who is looking for a Senior UX Designer--AWS Connect Team
Commitment Level: 40 hours per week, on-site

The Mom Project is partnering with AWS to transform and enhance their world-class Cloud Platform by adding more talented & passionate women to their growing Amazon Connect Team. Whether you're looking to return after a career break or just eager to work for an employer that supports working parents, our amazing partnership is dedicated to diversifying one of the most influential tech organizations in the world. AWS is committed to supporting and integrating their employees from day one through unrivaled benefits, comprehensive training and career-enhanced goal setting.

The AWS Connect team is growing and looking for a Senior UX Designer who leads by doing, values diversity of thought and background, has a passion for solving problems at massive scale and brings their best self to work every day. You will improve, iterate, and reimagine the product experience to shape the next generation of AWS software. You will also partner with a wide variety of internal and external customers to craft a modern, elegant BI experience for one of the fastest growing areas of software.

Who Are You?
You have an “anything is possible” mindset when faced with highly ambiguous and complex problems.
You’re proud of your work, your skills and expertise – but you’re not cynical, inflexible.
You love being part of a highly collaborative and high-energy team that isn’t afraid to swing for the fences or exceed expectations even on tactical projects.
You have a deep background in complex data products, geek out over customer experience, visualization and machine learning and believe that no experience is perfect unless it delights customers in unexpected ways.
You have demonstrated design acumen and believe in the power of strategic design to differentiate experience and increase customer loyalty.
You are an influencer who doesn’t hold your ideas as precious and who iterates quickly, based on data, and delivers recommendations and analysis that tell the story of the customer experience we are delivering.
You have a proven track record of inventing and simplifying elegant information architectures that make the complex feel simple to the end user.

What Will You Accomplish?
You will be responsible for leading a variety of design initiatives across a brand new suite of features.
You will work alongside product management, product/visual/interaction design, and engineering to define and build the essential lovable product.
You understand how to have deep customer focus, the ability to dive deep and invent, and the ability to make hard decisions fast.
You will contribute to the design of useful, usable, and desirable products in a team environment
You will create user-centered designs by considering market analysis, customer feedback, and usability findings

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
· 5+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar role
· 3+ years of experience designing for mobile, voice, web and web based devices
· Bachelor's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or 6+ years equivalent professional experience

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
· Experience designing user interfaces for data visualization or data insight products.
· Experience designing for mobile, touch, voice and web.
· Ability to prototype in HTML, JavaScript, and CSS etc.
· Visual design expertise demonstrated through mockups and style guides
· Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
· Experience working in a collaborative team and working directly with developers for implementation of designs
· Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
· Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role Experience with a variety of design tools such as Sketch, Invision, XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, Fireworks etc.
· A portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating user-centered design solutions
· Fluency in best practices for web-based information architecture and design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles and techniques
Apply today for the potential to redefine your career at one of the world's most
innovative companies with a defined commitment to building a diverse and inclusive
workforce.

The Group: Morningstar brings inspired problem solvers together with one goal in mind—to help investors reach their financial goals. At our core, we’re one of the world’s top investment research and data companies. But where we set ourselves apart is how we use that data and research to serve a diverse range of users. Our investment data and research enable us to deliver analytics and insights with a purely independent view, and then we leverage the latest in technology and design to deliver an array of solutions that best meet our users’ needs. This foundation of research, data, technology and design uniquely positions us to provide a more complete set of services to investors all around the world—ultimately helping people make better decisions about their money, or the money they manage for millions of people all over the world.

The Team: The Morningstar design team is dedicated to creating thoughtfully-designed financial products and services so that people across the world can make the best investing decisions for themselves and their clients. We synthesize complex financial information into experiences that empower our users to deliver better outcomes. We do this by not only creating the look and feel of a product, but also driving product direction: prioritizing the biggest opportunities to support our users and the business, while maintaining a strong sense of product ownership and its resulting success. The design organization is made up of several disciplines—visual, UX, communications, content, and research—united to help each other, and the whole company, grow. We’re always seeking designers who are motivated, are driven to deliver user-centered outcomes, and are equally committed to craft and compassion.

The Role: Morningstar is looking for an Associate Communications Designer for our Marketing group, specifically focused on developing marketing communications and experiences to support our professional software offerings. In this role you’ll help us express our differentiated brand and capabilities story through compelling digital campaigns and websites, print collateral and presentations, and live events with prospects and customers. Communications designers at Morningstar collaborate with other designers, content professionals, product marketing professionals, the brand team, and our technology and business partners to craft impactful customer interactions that drive brand engagement, elevate awareness of our products, and provide support for sales and client interactions.

This position is based in our Chicago office.

You’ll be great at:
• Conducting conceptual explorations that inform the creative direction and drive thoughtful design solutions, while also ensuring the successful implementation of concepts in real-world application in consideration of production constraints and techniques
• Making informed design decisions around typography, composition, color, and other visual elements that support a delightful, engaging experience, while reinforcing the Morningstar brand
• Solving challenging information and communication design problems and being able to present multiple concepts for consideration, with sound rationale
• Understanding current trends in digital design and bringing fresh thinking to your solutions
• Creating high-fidelity prototypes and other artifacts that communicate design direction and executional considerations
• Participating in creative workshops, user testing, and market research activities that help inform the direction of marketing initiatives and campaigns

We’re looking for someone who’s:
• Skilled in both visual and conceptual design, with a strong understanding of typography, color, illustration, and photography
• Able to execute design solutions through all mediums with an emphasis on digital experience design and multimedia
• Eager to master complex information, and can translate that information in a way that drives effective story-telling
• Deeply collaborative and can bring the right players together to solve creative problems
• A curious self-starter who isn't afraid of ambiguity, or constraints
• Open to feedback and knows how to defend design decisions
• Continuously striving for better ways of communicating and learning
• Comfortable with a fast-paced work environment
• Able to bring energy to a team and keep things positive

Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree
• 1–3 years of experience designing for brand and marketing communications

Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in graphic design or equivalent experience/training in the graphic arts.
• Strong knowledge of Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office Suite, and Mac OS X
• Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
• Knowledge of HTML and CSS

How to apply:
Include a link to your online portfolio or attach pdf samples along with your resume.

ABOUT AVENUES: THE WORLD SCHOOL

Avenues is on a mission to change the world through education. Founded in 2010 with the vision of becoming one school with many campuses, Avenues now has physical campuses in New York, São Paulo, Shenzhen, and a virtual campus, Avenues Online. Together, these campuses form one transformative, interconnected learning community preparing students to become engaged global citizens and worldwise leaders.

Avenues Hamptons joins this global community in the fall as the first of its kind: a studio campus.

AVENUES HAMPTONS

Our first studio campus, located in the heart of the Hamptons, establishes a new model of secondary education by combining our transformative, world-focused academic program with exceptional one-on-one mentoring, flexible scheduling, and personalized learning experiences in our unique, state-of-the-art studio facilities.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As a Learning Experience (LX) Designer, you will help launch a new campus and establish a new model of secondary education. LX Designers partner directly with the Head of Studio to mentor students, build community, execute day-to-day operations, and design authentic, relevant, and personalized learning experiences for each student.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Foster students' belonging and wellbeing
Build meaningful, positive, and individual relationships with middle and upper grades students
Support and counsel students as they explore academic, emotional, and social challenges or concerns
Facilitate small-group advisories and community building activities
Design transformative learning experiences
Collaborate directly with the Head of Studio and students to co-create, coach, and oversee student-directed projects and initiatives
Build relationships with local businesses, non-profits, and government agencies to identify real needs around which to engage students in meaningful partnerships and design projects
Help create a culture of student-centered learning
Provide general administrative support to the Head of Studio
Communication: assistance with newsletters, memos, and other school communications
Scheduling: assistance with creating and coordinating schedules, meetings, and events
Site Operations: assistance with the supervision of spaces, daily routines and safety procedures, ordering and supplies, etc.
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking for candidates who bring:
Understanding of and empathy for the social-emotional needs of adolescents
Desire to be a part of building a new school and a new approach to learning
Ability to collaborate, navigate ambiguity, and overcome challenges within a startup environment
Expertise or experience with one or more of the following:
Design thinking, social innovation, systems thinking
Service learning and/or social justice and advocacy work
Sustainability, outdoor education, and/or environmental studies
Social-emotional learning, counseling, and/or K-12 teaching
A bachelor's degree or equivalent
WHAT WE OFFER:
Contract-to-hire position for one semester converting to FTE based on performance
Unparalleled career growth opportunities across multiple campuses around the world
The thrill of a start-up and the opportunity to build things from scratch, all within an organization with global resources and supports, and a proven track record of results
Frequent feedback, ongoing coaching and top-notch, job-embedded professional learning
A beautiful, uplifting, student-centric school environment
A chance to change the world of education as part of a global community spanning three continents
TO APPLY:

Learn more about Avenues on our website (www.avenues.org) and LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/avenues-the-world-school/). Apply through the Careers section of the Avenues website (http://www.avenues.org/en/careers/).

SENIOR UX DESIGNER

Are you passionate about designing for data-rich and complex interfaces? Can you balance business and competitive needs with the needs of end-users? Introduce simplicity into complexity and marry passion with practicality?

If that sounds like you, let's talk. We're looking for a Senior UX Designer to join our fast-moving team. Our product is constantly growing and expanding, so there's ample opportunity to shape its future, weaving your own innovation and inspiration into the mix. We need someone who has imagination and vision, but who's also able to buckle down to produce actionable designs.

This all happens alongside smart, funny, and competent colleagues. We value fun, accountability, mindfulness, integrity, love, and 'yes!' — our culture is as important to us as our product. Our reputation and vision are the strongest in our market and we're backed by a seasoned executive team to help navigate our continued year-over-year growth.

The Company

6sense is a B2B account-based orchestration platform, helping our customer's sales and marketing teams identify opportunities, foster relationships, and close deals. We capture and analyze the intent and interest of our customer's potential prospects, delivering actionable insights that translate into increased revenue and sales. Our product does more than just present collected data – we also draw on advanced AI capabilities to offer predictions and recommendations to give our customers a competitive edge in their go-to-market execution efforts.

We put our money where our mouth is: our own marketing and sales teams use our product to sell that same product. This raises the stakes for our product team – but also means we can claim a part of the company's success in ways you won't find elsewhere.

Job Responsibilities

· Design user interfaces that incorporate and balance user needs, customer feedback, and feature requirements

· Understand written product requirements and how to translate them into initial designs; help PMs bring those requirements to maturity as necessary

· Create both low and hi-fidelity wireframes and mockups as required

· Work within (and help maintain) an existing design system

· Collaborate closely with front-end developers to turn designs into best-in-class interfaces

Required Skills and Qualifications

· 4-7 years' work in user experience design.

· Superlative skills in both visual and interactive design (with emphasis on the latter)

· Experience with designing user experiences and UI interfaces for B2B SaaS applications.

· Demonstrated ability to guide UX projects from design through production, backed by a portfolio of examples.

· Ability to manage and prioritize multiple UX projects; to meet shifting deadlines; and to put in extra effort when needed.

· Native-level written and spoken English, paired with excellent interpersonal skills

· Proficiency with core UX tools: Balsamiq, InVision, Sketch, Illustrator, and others

· A positive attitude; a collegial outlook; and the flexibility to work in a fast-changing environment

"Nice to Have" Qualifications

· Degree or formal training in a relevant field

· A background in marketing, sales, or advertising technologies

· Experience in designing, conducting, and analyzing user research

The Role
Loloi Rugs is seeking an experienced, highly motivated Senior Textile Product Designer based full-time in Dallas, TX. This unique opportunity transcends just design; you’ll be responsible for executing product development from concept to completion, which includes occasional overseas travel to visit manufacturers, domestic travel to attend trade shows, interfacing directly with customers interested to inform design direction, communicating cross-departmentally and with manufacturers to confirm product information, request sample revisions, and more. You’ll also have the opportunity to learn under industry veteran and company owner + founder, Amir Loloi, who holds over 30 years of textile design experience.
If you have 7+ years of textile or related product design experience, and enjoy a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, creative environment with a growing company, then we’d like to hear from you.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the design and development of new rug and textile collections.
Responsible for creating original CAD artwork, color matching, and editing existing artwork that is provided either by a vendor or a licensed designer.
Communication with overseas Loloi offices as well as directly with vendors via email and telephone
Collaborate with Owner, Director of Product Development and entire Product Development team when deciding new qualities to pursue and during important collection set-up milestones.
Participate in weekly product reviews to encourage continuous learning of product and process.
Compile technical specifications and costs by construction for item setup for Loloi purchasing department.
Travel to domestic trade shows required, approximately 3 - 5 times per year.
International travel may be required after some tenure within the department. International travel includes visiting factories abroad and / or attending forecasting and trend shows.
Administrative duties such as tracking sample shipments and organizing collection documents.
Research industry trends for design inspiration.
Support and leadership of other Product Designers on the product development team.
Other duties as assigned. Loloi is growing quickly, with new opportunities and products on the horizon. A certain degree of adaptability and willingness to learn on the go is required to be successful in this position.
Qualifications:
Demonstrated success with a portfolio of current or prior design work.
Experience working with overseas vendors is a huge plus. If you have this experience, please mention it in your cover letter.
Excellent visual, verbal and written communication skills.
Must be highly organized and able to manage and prioritize multiple projects at once.
Ability to work autonomously and make strong decisions at times with limited guidance.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Textile Design or Merchandising & Design or related field.
Minimum 7 years of experience in textile design and product development.
Must have excellent computer skills including thorough knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign.
Thorough knowledge of MS Office; Excel, Power Point and Word.
Prior experience using Nedgraphics; preferred not required.
How to Apply
Please submit resume and cover letter when applying. Within your cover letter, please specify your preferred salary as well as available start. Please include a link to your portfolio - examples of hand-illustrations are highly encouraged.
What We Offer
Whether it's the products we develop or the showrooms we design, Loloi believes there's always room to be better. We extend that belief to our team, continuously striving to improve our employee’s quality of life. We offer health, dental and vision benefits, 401 (k), sound meditation and professional chair massage to all of our full-time employees.
Our fast-paced culture values people who act and think like founders. If you're someone who takes initiative, works hard and brings a positive spirit, there's no limit to how far you'll go here.
About Loloi Rugs
Loloi Rugs is a leading textile brand that designs and crafts rugs, pillows, and throws for the thoughtfully layered home. Family-owned and led since 2004, Loloi is growing more quickly than ever. To date, we’ve expanded our diverse team to hundreds of employees, invested in multiple distribution facilities, introduced thousands of products, and earned the respect and business of retailers and designers worldwide. A testament to our products and our team, Loloi has earned the ARTS Award for “Best Rug Manufacturer” in 2010, 2011, 2015, 2016, and 2018. For more information, visit loloirugs.com.
Loloi Rugs does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

What You Will Do
Gannett Fleming is looking for an Architectural Designer to join our expanding team of professionals in our New York (NYC) office. Collaborating and supporting Senior Architects, the successful candidate will work on projects in the areas of transportation, transit facilities, utility, institutional, K-12, higher education and municipal and public sector agencies in the Greater New York Area. Specific responsibilties include:

• Generates take offs for cost estimates and performs architectural square foot or other appropriate calculations in support of architectural activities involving the design of architectural systems, components, or features.
• Gathers and records information such as product information and cut sheets to be used for cost estimating and specifications.
• Supports efforts for studies and reports and assists with preparation of routine technical reports or sections of reports.
• Assists with sheet set up on project drawings, drawing schedules, plans, elevations, sections, details, and specifications.
• Assists with pick up of redline markings on drawings and completion of work.
• Learns basic code evaluation procedure and information gathering requirements for review with supervisor.
• Individual is capable of working proficiently on their own with direction from supervisor.
• Capable of recognizing when to ask questions so they may continue with work efficiently within their time schedule for the project while limiting interruptions of the supervisor and work flow of others on the project team.
• Coordinates work with other team members thru communication and supervision.
• Capable of following direction, project / office standards, and implementing constructive criticism to improve work product and development with supervision.
• Responsible for project work during construction as assigned by supervisor including but not limited to submittal tasks, RFI’s, supplemental work including sketches, or submittal review process.

Minimum Qualifications
• Architectural Engineering Degree, Bachelors of Architecture Degree, or Bachelors of Science with a Masters of Architecture
• Starting or in process of fulfilling internship requirements / path for licensure
• Designer position with (5) years of experience in an Architectural Office.
• Capable of using and proficient experience with AutoCAD, Building Information Modeling (BIM), Revit
• Sketch-up, 3D software, Rendering software, Photoshop
• Proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook)
• Good oral and written communication skills
• Capable of communicating and / or presenting concepts and thoughts thru verbal, written, or drawing medium

About Morningstar
Morningstar brings inspired problem-solvers together with one goal in mind—to help investors reach their financial goals. At our core, we’re one of the world’s top investment research and data companies. But where we set ourselves apart is how we use that data and research to serve a diverse range of users. Our investment data and research enables us to deliver analytics and insights with a purely independent view, and then we leverage the latest in technology and design to deliver an array of solutions that best meet our users’ needs. This foundation of research, data, technology, and design uniquely positions us to provide a complete set of services to investors all around the world—ultimately helping people make better decisions about their money or money they manage for millions of people all over the world.

Our Design Culture
The Morningstar design team is dedicated to creating thoughtfully-designed financial products and services so that people across the world can make the best investing decisions for themselves and their clients. We synthesize complex financial information into experiences that empower our users to deliver better outcomes. We do this by not only creating the look and feel of a product but also driving product direction: prioritizing the biggest opportunities to support our users and the business while maintaining a strong sense of product ownership and its resulting success. The design organization is made up of several disciplines—visual, UX, communications, content, and research—united to help each other, and the whole company, grow. We’re always seeking designers who are motivated, are driven to deliver user-centered outcomes, and are equally committed to craft and compassion.

Position
We are looking for a product designer for our Financial Planning team in our Professional Software group. Backed by Morningstar's independent research, methodologies, high-quality data, behavioral science and innovative product design, our newly formed Global Financial Planning team builds modern software that helps advisors extend from investment selection to holistic advice through engaging software arming them to deliver goals-based advice and insights in the best interest of their clients. This multi-talented individual will be involved in all parts of the design process: concept development, creative visualization, user research and testing, UX writing, system design, and prototyping. This person will work within a cross-functional, global team developing software for financial professionals. We seek a curious, entrepreneurial designer who loves the challenges of elegantly simplifying complex data, translating user needs into intuitive, rewarding interactions, and beautifully expressing our brand.

This position is based in our Chicago office.

You’ll be great at:
• Owning all parts of the design process from discovery, definition, development, and delivery
• Identifying connections between products, services, and touchpoints to account for a great user experience
• Utilizing user-centered design methods in day-to-day work to inform design decisions (such as user research, prototyping, and other design thinking)
• Creating high-fidelity prototypes and other artifacts that communicate design direction and execution considerations
• Guiding teams to build coordinated solutions that will support the end-to-end vision of the product experience
• Solving navigation and information organization challenges
• Making and articulating decisions around information structure, relationships, and content strategy
• Visualizing and communicating a user’s task flow through various parts of a product and system
• Creating visual artifacts to visualize and communicate design direction (such as wireframes and low-fidelity prototypes)
• Applying creativity, logic, and critical thinking in new situations to find the best solution, while continuously striving to find better ways of doing things
• Actively seeking out new challenges and tasks and be tenacious in overcoming obstacles to achieve results
• Demonstrating core design skills—especially concerning typography, composition, information hierarchy, and data visualization—to create delightful, engaging experiences that reinforce the Morningstar brand
• Solving challenging information and communication design problems and being able to present multiple concepts for consideration, with sound rationale
• Supporting the Morningstar Design System by using consistent interactions, patterns, and conventions

You’ll also do things like:
• Collaborate with the product owners, designers, and engineers on your squad to make product decisions
• Clearly articulate design decisions and share your process with stakeholders and other designers
• Participate in critiques, workshops, design studios, and other design activities
• Participate in user research and prototyping activities, such as helping with planning, taking notes during sessions, and helping analyze the data
• Adapt your work and approach to meet changing priorities as they occur
• Be curious, resourceful, flexible and adaptive
• Have a desire to solve challenging information, communication, and systems design problems

Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree
• At least 3 years of relevant professional experience designing for software, web and/or digital products

Preferred Qualifications:
• Strong knowledge of Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office Suite, and Mac OS X
• Knowledge of HTML and CSS
• Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
• Experience working with Design Systems

How to apply:
Include a link to your online portfolio or attach pdf samples along with your resume.

By applying to this position, your application is automatically considered for the range of Product Design/UX roles we have at Wayfair. If we think you might be a fit, a recruiter will reach out to learn more about your background and discuss relevant positions in more detail.

Who We Are:

Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 14 million items across home furnishings, décor, home improvement, housewares, and more.

Our Product Design/UX teams partner with Engineering, Product Management, Analytics, and business leaders across Wayfair to ensure we're building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, and measurable ways.

Our Product Design/UX organization includes a variety of teams solving interesting problems:
Storefront, our consumer-facing technology team, is tackling a wide array of fascinating, incredibly difficult problems - like helping a massive, rapidly growing global customer base efficiently find the perfect products from our catalog of >10M items (with the majority of traffic on mobile), building 2-sided marketplaces to connect consumers with interior designers and contractors, and leveraging A/R and Computer Vision to help customers visualize products in their space.
Our Supply Chain technology team ensures the right products are in stock, in the right places, at the right time, with the right cost profile to enable valuable delivery experiences for our customers, and differentiated value for our suppliers and carriers. We power availability, speed, and cost reduction across the value chain, from forecast to home delivery and post-delivery services.
Our Operations technology teams drive the development of the world-class software products that power Wayfairs transformation of retail for home. These teams create new and innovative services for customers and build the backbone of Wayfairs pricing, merchandising, and enterprise operations. Whether on desktop, mobile web, app, or any of our proprietary internal platforms, we leverage data, user-centric design, machine learning, and Agile to achieve operational excellence, fueling company growth
What Youll Do:
Collaborate with product managers, developers, content strategists, user researchers, and other designers to execute design concepts that deliver on brand goals, business goals, and are technically feasible to implement
Utilize design thinking principles to build engaging customer experiences that solve goals with elegant simplicity
Conceptualize and create pixel-perfect design mockups from sketches, wireframes, and other UX deliverable that represent your design thinking capabilities
Drive a sense of urgency in the team to deliver work, emphasizing the use of lean tools and techniques
What Youll Need:
Expertise in producing relevant deliverables including an online portfolio that demonstrates an unfailing advocacy for the user, highlighting: detailed site maps, user flows/task flows, user journeys, page flows, taxonomies/folksonomies, paths to purchase, wireframes, annotations, and prototypes that represent interaction recommendations, etc.
Strong skills in, and understanding of, modern design processes, including design tools like Sketch, Abstract, Invision, Framer, UXPin, and Creative Suite
Passion for building functional and engaging user experiences with a strong customer-centric focus
Ample experience collaborating across multiple stakeholder groups, communicating with diverse audiences, and balancing/negotiation priorities
Bachelors degree or equivalent practical experience
7+ years of professional UX experience

Wayfair is one of the worlds largest online destinations for the home. Steampunk is the explosive collision of human-centered design and traditional government contracting. Job Description:
Schematic / Wiring Designer - Philadelphia, PA

Westwood Professional Services, Inc.

Westwood Professional Services, Inc. is seeking a Schematic / Wiring Designer to join our team in our Philadelphia, PA office. The wiring designer would work with our growing Substation Engineering Team to prepare schematic and associated wiring diagrams for high voltage utility substations projects and renewable energy interconnections. The position would require the employee to work with engineers and consultants to create these drawings. Westwood has a highly experienced and dynamic team of individuals dedicated to providing high-level professional services to our clients.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Computer aided design and drafting of all engineering products and deliverables.
Collaborate with engineers and other drafters to correct discrepancies in drawings and designs.
Typical drafting is that of functional electrical drawings as shown below.
Operations Diagrams

Chime is the largest and fastest-growing player in the challenger-banking space, providing mobile and online banking technology in the U.S. and facilitating over 5M accounts with no physical branches. We're a technology company relentlessly focused on helping our members achieve financial peace of mind. That's why we offer access to an award-winning bank account that doesn't charge hidden fees, can give members early access to their paychecks, and enables them to grow their savings automatically. And we're just getting started. We are proud of our mission, devoted to our members, and passionate about applying technology to the challenge of making financial health a reality for everyone.

We have one of the most experienced management teams in Fintech and have raised over $800M in funding from DST, General Atlantic, Iconiq, Coatue, Dragoneer, Menlo, Access, Forerunner, and others. If you're looking to join a fast-growing company with a beloved, daily-use product and an authentic mission that puts people first, we want to meet you.

About the role

We're seeking a talented and driven Lead Product Designer to join the growing Design team at Chime, where we are working hard to better the financial lives of our members. You'll be working as a team lead for our consumer facing experiences. Your focus will be making finance and managing money simple, intuitive, and easy. You'll be a voice and relentless advocate for our members as you expand upon Chime's product offering.

As a Lead Product Designer, you'll be contributing with individual work as well as leading other designers and improving design team processes. You know that user experience goes beyond pixels and you're able to influence organizations to create experiences that hit the highest bar. You will facilitate cross-functional collaborations, which will help the design team operate more strategically, holistically, and effectively. You will also help set the gold standard for design execution by collaborating closely with the Head of Design, and together you'll establish a vision for the future of Chime's customer service and tooling.

Responsibilities
Put the user first in all decisions. Don't lessen their problems, actually eliminate them.
Champion high caliber design throughout Chime. You're a role model to other designers and other parts of the company.
Own full-stack design work, from hand sketches through to hifi mockups and prototypes
Work on products not as a singular feature, but as an entire experience that can scale and grow
Manage and iterate upon our internal design system and brand language
Present work to, collaborate with, and influence product managers, engineers research, exec team, and other stakeholders
Wear multiple design hats, helping to work on any project as needed
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in graphic design, product design, or related design field (or applicable experience)
5+ years of proven history shipping consumer mobile and/or web products
Experience leading and mentoring other designers, and a knack for inspiring others to be their best every day
Ability to tackle a problem in fundamentally different ways and weigh the pros/cons of each
Ability to balance business objectives with user needs. You represent both sides and balance your design decisions, getting the best possible outcome for both.
A relentless desire to make banking really, really, really (we mean it!) work for our user's benefit
What we offer
Competitive salary based on experience, medical and dental benefits, as well as a 401k match
Free snacks and drinks, plus weekly catered lunches.
Flexible vacation policy.
Monthly happy hours and company events.
A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join one of the most experienced teams in FinTech and help create a completely new kind of banking service.
We know great work isn't done alone. We're building a team of individuals to Chime in with their different strengths to benefit our employees and members. Think of the brands built by Apple, Netscape, Google. They created an aesthetic that made the tech easy to understand, and — in the process — moved millions of people. That's what we aspire to. To get us there, we're looking for a remarkable designer to create marketing assets that are not just effective, but iconic.

Intro

Why this Role?

1. Make an enormous impact on the company: Notion is growing rapidly through word of mouth, but we have the chance to go bigger. Creating compelling content — websites, videos, graphics, emails, etc. — is what will make this difference.
2. Play a major strategic role: Help us figure out how to deliver the right messages to the right audiences.
3.Broaden your super powers: Everyone at Notion wears multiple hats. You'll get experience with editorial, growth marketing, consumer education, and more.
4. Join us at a magical time: We've hit profitability and over a million users with a very small team, which gives us a huge green field to experiment with.
So, what will you do as a designer on the marketing team?
Make marketing materials from scratch. Design, write, and produce landing pages, email campaigns, social media assets, sales collateral, published content, and more, end-to-end.
Tell stories. Notion is a product that can be simple or complex. It can also be used for many things. Create materials that help people understand the product and its value for them.
Constantly learn from our users to determine how they want to use Notion, how to teach them to do more with the product, and how to engage new users.
Measure how marketing materials are performing, and figure out how to make changes to increase engagement and conversions.
You might be a good fit if...
You have at least 3-5 years of visual design experience, ideally producing marketing assets.
You're a masterful communicator, able to draw people in and enhance understanding through design and written language.
You can produce graphics, videos, and GIFs with a high level of craft and attention to detail.
You're a strong writer with a bit of edge and play in your voice.
Bonus: Coding abilities so you can build what you design. An understanding of how things work behind the scenes goes a long way.

At Bluebeam, we empower people to advance the way the world is built. We create smart software solutions that make construction sites more efficient, connected and safe and improve the lives of design and construction professionals everywhere.

As a Sr. Product Designer at Bluebeam, you'll join the Product Design & Research team to support Revu, our flagship product with more than 1.6 million users worldwide. You'll help to define the overall user experience end-to-end including the micro interactions that bring the product to life. You'll tackle complex, multifaceted customer workflows, transforming them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use experiences for our customers around the globe.

As an experienced Product Design & Research professional, what excites you is solving for our Customer needs and finding solutions to their day-to-day problems. You are steeped in this sort of experience and as a result are able come to this role armed with best-practice techniques and approaches and you know instinctually what the best design tools for the job are going to be.

This role will collaborate closely with, and be supported by, other Product Designers who are also working on the wider Revu portfolio and it will partner with peers in Product Management and Engineering to deliver the actual experiences to our end customers.

*This role is a full-time, onsite position. Due to the Corona Virus, all new employees will be required to start work remotely until we are able to return to the office. More information will be provided in the interview process.*

What you'll do:
Create detailed UI designs for product features including low to high fidelity visual design mockups, wireframes, sketches, prototypes, and supporting design specifications and documentation.
Collaborate closely with Engineering and Product Management in an Agile/Lean and iterative fashion to ensure your proposed designs meet user needs and are feasible to implement.
Undertake user research, data analysis and user testing with our customers translating insights and findings into tangible solutions for our product.
Suggest ways to validate product ideas and concepts with customers in order to verify assumptions and hypotheses and ensure that customers will be able to realize value from a given experience you are designing.
Directly contribute to ongoing research process improvements, including establishing best practices and setting standards for the approach and rigor we apply to our research methods.
Tell the story of the customer, their jobs-to-be-done and create consensus around user outcomes.
Act as a champion for good user experience, sharing best practices and demonstrating curiosity about customer needs and behaviors.
Advocate and help to further embed best practice Design methods both within the wider Product and Engineering teams as well as across the company.
Play a key role in further developing tools and resources that will help build Design capability across the organization as well as educating and empowering teams to adopt new processes, methods and mindsets.
What we'd like to see in you:
5 or more years of experience designing delightful user experiences for a range of responsive desktop and native mobile apps and a diverse portfolio showing your processes, deliverables and the outcomes that they drove.
Demonstrated experience designing for complex user interfaces and workflows and in developing responsive design patterns and design systems that employ best practice UX.
Experience creating prototypes of different levels of fidelity using tools like Sketch, Adobe Suite, Invision, Figma etc.
An appreciation of user psychology and an understanding of how language and design resonate with users.
A proven approach as well as deep experience and expertise in creating personas, mapping user needs, experiences and customer journeys.
The ability to confidently present and articulate design decisions with ease, participate in peer design critiques, and incorporate feedback.
Comfort working in multi-faceted design, product and engineering teams in an Agile environment.
Experience mentoring, coaching and guiding other less tenured Designers in best practices and methodologies.
Experience with/or exposure to Service Design methodologies and approaches (i.e. creation of service blueprints) as well as significant experience designing for a holistic end-to-end experience with multiple touchpoints.
What we'd LOVE to see in you:
BA/BFA degree in HCI or design related field, with an emphasis on user experience, interaction design, or visual design.
Experience working in a design agency.
Experience prototyping in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
What we offer:
A chance to make a meaningful impact in a dynamic, growing industry ripe for innovation.
A fun, collaborative work environment with an opportunity to help shape Bluebeam's approach to Product Design.
Plenty of opportunity to try, learn, and try again. We work in a user-centric and iterative fashion. You will have ample opportunity to make a direct impact on our products and customer experiences.
To apply, please send the following:
Cover letter (Cover letter should address why you're interested in Bluebeam and, specifically, the Sr. Product Designer role as described.)
Resume
A link to your portfolio or examples of your work
About Bluebeam

The construction industry is adopting new technology at a feverish pace. Tablets and cell phones are replacing paper blueprints, drones are surveying jobsites in 3D, and cloud collaboration is changing the way teams work together. Bluebeam plays a crucial role in this transformation. The key to our success is a customer-focused approach to product development: we work with the industry to create solutions for the industry. Today, over 1.6 million people throughout the world use Bluebeam. In the US, we're a critical partner for the majority of top AEC firms, and rapidly expanding our presence globally, with offices in Sweden, Germany and the UK.

Come design and build your future with us.

Bluebeam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

The Group: Morningstar brings inspired problem solvers together with one goal in mind—to help investors reach their financial goals. At our core, we’re one of the world’s top investment research and data companies. But where we set ourselves apart is how we use that data and research to serve a diverse range of users. Our investment data and research enable us to deliver analytics and insights with a purely independent view, and then we leverage the latest in technology and design to deliver an array of solutions that best meet our users’ needs. This foundation of research, data, technology and design uniquely positions us to provide a more complete set of services to investors all around the world—ultimately helping people make better decisions about their money, or the money they manage for millions of people all over the world.

The Team: The Morningstar design team is dedicated to creating thoughtfully-designed financial products and services so that people across the world can make the best investing decisions for themselves and their clients. We synthesize complex financial information into experiences that empower our users to deliver better outcomes. We do this by not only creating the look and feel of a product, but also driving product direction: prioritizing the biggest opportunities to support our users and the business, while maintaining a strong sense of product ownership and its resulting success. The design organization is made up of several disciplines—visual, UX, communications, content, and research—united to help each other, and the whole company, grow. We’re always seeking designers who are motivated, are driven to deliver user-centered outcomes, and are equally committed to craft and compassion.

The Role: Morningstar is looking for an Associate Communications Designer for our Marketing group, specifically focused on developing marketing communications and experiences to support our professional software offerings. In this role you’ll help us express our differentiated brand and capabilities story through compelling digital campaigns and websites, print collateral and presentations, and live events with prospects and customers. Communications designers at Morningstar collaborate with other designers, content professionals, product marketing professionals, the brand team, and our technology and business partners to craft impactful customer interactions that drive brand engagement, elevate awareness of our products, and provide support for sales and client interactions.

This position is based in our Chicago office.

You’ll be great at:
• Conducting conceptual explorations that inform the creative direction and drive thoughtful design solutions, while also ensuring the successful implementation of concepts in real-world application in consideration of production constraints and techniques
• Making informed design decisions around typography, composition, color, and other visual elements that support a delightful, engaging experience, while reinforcing the Morningstar brand
• Solving challenging information and communication design problems and being able to present multiple concepts for consideration, with sound rationale
• Understanding current trends in digital design and bringing fresh thinking to your solutions
• Creating high-fidelity prototypes and other artifacts that communicate design direction and executional considerations
• Participating in creative workshops, user testing, and market research activities that help inform the direction of marketing initiatives and campaigns

We’re looking for someone who’s:
• Skilled in both visual and conceptual design, with a strong understanding of typography, color, illustration, and photography
• Able to execute design solutions through all mediums with an emphasis on digital experience design and multimedia
• Eager to master complex information, and can translate that information in a way that drives effective story-telling
• Deeply collaborative and can bring the right players together to solve creative problems
• A curious self-starter who isn't afraid of ambiguity, or constraints
• Open to feedback and knows how to defend design decisions
• Continuously striving for better ways of communicating and learning
• Comfortable with a fast-paced work environment
• Able to bring energy to a team and keep things positive

Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree
• 1–3 years of experience designing for brand and marketing communications

Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in graphic design or equivalent experience/training in the graphic arts.
• Strong knowledge of Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office Suite, and Mac OS X
• Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
• Knowledge of HTML and CSS

Title: Learning Experience Designer (Contract to hire)

Location: Hamptons, NY

Start date: July/August 2020

ABOUT AVENUES: THE WORLD SCHOOL

Avenues is on a mission to change the world through education. Founded in 2010 with the vision of becoming one school with many campuses, Avenues now has physical campuses in New York, São Paulo, Shenzhen, and a virtual campus, Avenues Online. Together, these campuses form one transformative, interconnected learning community preparing students to become engaged global citizens and worldwise leaders.

Avenues Hamptons joins this global community in the fall as the first of its kind: a studio campus.

AVENUES HAMPTONS

Our first studio campus, located in the heart of the Hamptons, establishes a new model of secondary education by combining our transformative, world-focused academic program with exceptional one-on-one mentoring, flexible scheduling, and personalized learning experiences in our unique, state-of-the-art studio facilities.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As a Learning Experience (LX) Designer, you will help launch a new campus and establish a new model of secondary education. LX Designers partner directly with the Head of Studio to mentor students, build community, execute day-to-day operations, and design authentic, relevant, and personalized learning experiences for each student.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Foster students' belonging and wellbeing
Build meaningful, positive, and individual relationships with middle and upper grades students
Support and counsel students as they explore academic, emotional, and social challenges or concerns
Facilitate small-group advisories and community building activities
Design transformative learning experiences
Collaborate directly with the Head of Studio and students to co-create, coach, and oversee student-directed projects and initiatives
Build relationships with local businesses, non-profits, and government agencies to identify real needs around which to engage students in meaningful partnerships and design projects
Help create a culture of student-centered learning
Provide general administrative support to the Head of Studio
Communication: assistance with newsletters, memos, and other school communications
Scheduling: assistance with creating and coordinating schedules, meetings, and events
Site Operations: assistance with the supervision of spaces, daily routines and safety procedures, ordering and supplies, etc.
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking for candidates who bring:
Understanding of and empathy for the social-emotional needs of adolescents
Desire to be a part of building a new school and a new approach to learning
Ability to collaborate, navigate ambiguity, and overcome challenges within a startup environment
Expertise or experience with one or more of the following:
Design thinking, social innovation, systems thinking
Service learning and/or social justice and advocacy work
Sustainability, outdoor education, and/or environmental studies
Social-emotional learning, counseling, and/or K-12 teaching
A bachelor's degree or equivalent
WHAT WE OFFER:
Contract-to-hire position for one semester converting to FTE based on performance
Unparalleled career growth opportunities across multiple campuses around the world
The thrill of a start-up and the opportunity to build things from scratch, all within an organization with global resources and supports, and a proven track record of results
Frequent feedback, ongoing coaching and top-notch, job-embedded professional learning
A beautiful, uplifting, student-centric school environment

SENIOR UX DESIGNER

Are you passionate about designing for data-rich and complex interfaces? Can you balance business and competitive needs with the needs of end-users? Introduce simplicity into complexity and marry passion with practicality?

If that sounds like you, let's talk. We're looking for a Senior UX Designer to join our fast-moving team. Our product is constantly growing and expanding, so there's ample opportunity to shape its future, weaving your own innovation and inspiration into the mix. We need someone who has imagination and vision, but who's also able to buckle down to produce actionable designs.

This all happens alongside smart, funny, and competent colleagues. We value fun, accountability, mindfulness, integrity, love, and 'yes!' — our culture is as important to us as our product. Our reputation and vision are the strongest in our market and we're backed by a seasoned executive team to help navigate our continued year-over-year growth.

The Company

6sense is a B2B account-based orchestration platform, helping our customer's sales and marketing teams identify opportunities, foster relationships, and close deals. We capture and analyze the intent and interest of our customer's potential prospects, delivering actionable insights that translate into increased revenue and sales. Our product does more than just present collected data – we also draw on advanced AI capabilities to offer predictions and recommendations to give our customers a competitive edge in their go-to-market execution efforts.

We put our money where our mouth is: our own marketing and sales teams use our product to sell that same product. This raises the stakes for our product team – but also means we can claim a part of the company's success in ways you won't find elsewhere.

Job Responsibilities

· Design user interfaces that incorporate and balance user needs, customer feedback, and feature requirements

· Understand written product requirements and how to translate them into initial designs; help PMs bring those requirements to maturity as necessary

· Create both low and hi-fidelity wireframes and mockups as required

· Work within (and help maintain) an existing design system

· Collaborate closely with front-end developers to turn designs into best-in-class interfaces

Required Skills and Qualifications

· 4-7 years' work in user experience design.

· Superlative skills in both visual and interactive design (with emphasis on the latter)

· Experience with designing user experiences and UI interfaces for B2B SaaS applications.

· Demonstrated ability to guide UX projects from design through production, backed by a portfolio of examples.

· Ability to manage and prioritize multiple UX projects; to meet shifting deadlines; and to put in extra effort when needed.

· Native-level written and spoken English, paired with excellent interpersonal skills

· Proficiency with core UX tools: Balsamiq, InVision, Sketch, Illustrator, and others

· A positive attitude; a collegial outlook; and the flexibility to work in a fast-changing environment

"Nice to Have" Qualifications

· Degree or formal training in a relevant field

· A background in marketing, sales, or advertising technologies

· Experience in designing, conducting, and analyzing user research

The Role
Loloi Rugs is seeking an experienced, highly motivated Senior Textile Product Designer based full-time in Dallas, TX. This unique opportunity transcends just design; you’ll be responsible for executing product development from concept to completion, which includes occasional overseas travel to visit manufacturers, domestic travel to attend trade shows, interfacing directly with customers interested to inform design direction, communicating cross-departmentally and with manufacturers to confirm product information, request sample revisions, and more. You’ll also have the opportunity to learn under industry veteran and company owner + founder, Amir Loloi, who holds over 30 years of textile design experience.
If you have 7+ years of textile or related product design experience, and enjoy a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, creative environment with a growing company, then we’d like to hear from you.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the design and development of new rug and textile collections.
Responsible for creating original CAD artwork, color matching, and editing existing artwork that is provided either by a vendor or a licensed designer.
Communication with overseas Loloi offices as well as directly with vendors via email and telephone
Collaborate with Owner, Director of Product Development and entire Product Development team when deciding new qualities to pursue and during important collection set-up milestones.
Participate in weekly product reviews to encourage continuous learning of product and process.
Compile technical specifications and costs by construction for item setup for Loloi purchasing department.
Travel to domestic trade shows required, approximately 3 - 5 times per year.
International travel may be required after some tenure within the department. International travel includes visiting factories abroad and / or attending forecasting and trend shows.
Administrative duties such as tracking sample shipments and organizing collection documents.
Research industry trends for design inspiration.
Support and leadership of other Product Designers on the product development team.
Other duties as assigned. Loloi is growing quickly, with new opportunities and products on the horizon. A certain degree of adaptability and willingness to learn on the go is required to be successful in this position.
Qualifications:
Demonstrated success with a portfolio of current or prior design work.
Experience working with overseas vendors is a huge plus. If you have this experience, please mention it in your cover letter.
Excellent visual, verbal and written communication skills.
Must be highly organized and able to manage and prioritize multiple projects at once.
Ability to work autonomously and make strong decisions at times with limited guidance.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Textile Design or Merchandising & Design or related field.
Minimum 7 years of experience in textile design and product development.
Must have excellent computer skills including thorough knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign.
Thorough knowledge of MS Office; Excel, Power Point and Word.
Prior experience using Nedgraphics; preferred not required.
How to Apply
Please submit resume and cover letter when applying. Within your cover letter, please specify your preferred salary as well as available start. Please include a link to your portfolio - examples of hand-illustrations are highly encouraged.

Whether it's the products we develop or the showrooms we design, Loloi believes there's always room to be better. We extend that belief to our team, continuously striving to improve our employee’s quality of life. We offer health, dental and vision benefits, 401 (k), sound meditation and professional chair massage to all of our full-time employees.
Our fast-paced culture values people who act and think like founders. If you're someone who takes initiative, works hard and brings a positive spirit, there's no limit to how far you'll go here.
About Loloi Rugs
Loloi Rugs is a leading textile brand that designs and crafts rugs, pillows, and throws for the thoughtfully layered home. Family-owned and led since 2004, Loloi is growing more quickly than ever. To date, we’ve expanded our diverse team to hundreds of employees, invested in multiple distribution facilities, introduced thousands of products, and earned the respect and business of retailers and designers worldwide. A testament to our products and our team, Loloi has earned the ARTS Award for “Best Rug Manufacturer” in 2010, 2011, 2015, 2016, and 2018. For more information, visit loloirugs.com.
Loloi Rugs does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

About Morningstar
Morningstar brings inspired problem-solvers together with one goal in mind—to help investors reach their financial goals. At our core, we’re one of the world’s top investment research and data companies. But where we set ourselves apart is how we use that data and research to serve a diverse range of users. Our investment data and research enables us to deliver analytics and insights with a purely independent view, and then we leverage the latest in technology and design to deliver an array of solutions that best meet our users’ needs. This foundation of research, data, technology, and design uniquely positions us to provide a complete set of services to investors all around the world—ultimately helping people make better decisions about their money or money they manage for millions of people all over the world.

Our Design Culture
The Morningstar design team is dedicated to creating thoughtfully-designed financial products and services so that people across the world can make the best investing decisions for themselves and their clients. We synthesize complex financial information into experiences that empower our users to deliver better outcomes. We do this by not only creating the look and feel of a product but also driving product direction: prioritizing the biggest opportunities to support our users and the business while maintaining a strong sense of product ownership and its resulting success. The design organization is made up of several disciplines—visual, UX, communications, content, and research—united to help each other, and the whole company, grow. We’re always seeking designers who are motivated, are driven to deliver user-centered outcomes, and are equally committed to craft and compassion.

Position
We are looking for a product designer for our Financial Planning team in our Professional Software group. Backed by Morningstar's independent research, methodologies, high-quality data, behavioral science and innovative product design, our newly formed Global Financial Planning team builds modern software that helps advisors extend from investment selection to holistic advice through engaging software arming them to deliver goals-based advice and insights in the best interest of their clients. This multi-talented individual will be involved in all parts of the design process: concept development, creative visualization, user research and testing, UX writing, system design, and prototyping. This person will work within a cross-functional, global team developing software for financial professionals. We seek a curious, entrepreneurial designer who loves the challenges of elegantly simplifying complex data, translating user needs into intuitive, rewarding interactions, and beautifully expressing our brand.

This position is based in our Chicago office.

You’ll be great at:
• Owning all parts of the design process from discovery, definition, development, and delivery
• Identifying connections between products, services, and touchpoints to account for a great user experience
• Utilizing user-centered design methods in day-to-day work to inform design decisions (such as user research, prototyping, and other design thinking)
• Creating high-fidelity prototypes and other artifacts that communicate design direction and execution considerations
• Guiding teams to build coordinated solutions that will support the end-to-end vision of the product experience
• Solving navigation and information organization challenges
• Making and articulating decisions around information structure, relationships, and content strategy
• Visualizing and communicating a user’s task flow through various parts of a product and system
• Creating visual artifacts to visualize and communicate design direction (such as wireframes and low-fidelity prototypes)
• Applying creativity, logic, and critical thinking in new situations to find the best solution, while continuously striving to find better ways of doing things
• Actively seeking out new challenges and tasks and be tenacious in overcoming obstacles to achieve results
• Demonstrating core design skills—especially concerning typography, composition, information hierarchy, and data visualization—to create delightful, engaging experiences that reinforce the Morningstar brand
• Solving challenging information and communication design problems and being able to present multiple concepts for consideration, with sound rationale
• Supporting the Morningstar Design System by using consistent interactions, patterns, and conventions

You’ll also do things like:
• Collaborate with the product owners, designers, and engineers on your squad to make product decisions
• Clearly articulate design decisions and share your process with stakeholders and other designers
• Participate in critiques, workshops, design studios, and other design activities
• Participate in user research and prototyping activities, such as helping with planning, taking notes during sessions, and helping analyze the data
• Adapt your work and approach to meet changing priorities as they occur
• Be curious, resourceful, flexible and adaptive
• Have a desire to solve challenging information, communication, and systems design problems

Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree
• At least 3 years of relevant professional experience designing for software, web and/or digital products

Preferred Qualifications:
• Strong knowledge of Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office Suite, and Mac OS X
• Knowledge of HTML and CSS
• Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
• Experience working with Design Systems

How to apply:
Include a link to your online portfolio or attach pdf samples along with your resume.

Strong skills in, and understanding of, modern design processes, including design tools like Sketch, Abstract, Invision, Framer, UXPin, and Creative Suite
Passion for building functional and engaging user experiences with a strong customer-centric focus
Ample experience collaborating across multiple stakeholder groups, communicating with diverse audiences, and balancing/negotiation priorities

Pitch new game ideas!

Highly adapt and adaptable with Unity
Passionate about light hearted, romantic, playful, and sweet stories. RomComs or YA novels are your go to for comfort.
